author: Steelheart
review: It is a tricky task for me to write a review of this game and I might be biased, because of how much I enjoyed it and how much I am missing it now that there is nothing more to do for me, but I will try to stay objective. I think this is a game you will either love or hate, you will put down after a couple of minutes or hours of playing, or you will play it fully till there is nothing left to do. I think it depends how you approach it, if the countless bugs destroy your immersion or you look beyond them and focus on the "soul" of the game. For me it was the second case. There is no secret I am a huge fan of the Witcher 3, still my favourite game of all time, and felt CD Project Red managed to keep the magic of it in this game too, at least for me it worked.Let's start with the obvious issues however, there is no denying the game is buggy. The biggest problem I see is the visual bugs, that might drag you out of the world very easily, but I encountered a lot of issues with bugs with the crafting and inventory items as well. Inventory management is clunky, and it just feels not modern, the fact that after an inventory change the whole screen refreshes feels cheap and doesn't look next gen at all. The same issue is with NPC interaction, the way the police is working, the way driving physics is working (or not really working), it feels not finished at all. On the other hand there is a lot of "filler" content in the form of shards, every inventory item has a funny description to it, the database information is huge, but I often felt instead of this more attention should have been given to the crucial game mechanics.Now the good parts, combat is just fantastic, it feels good, it plays good, there are multiple ways to approach a given situation, you can combine it with different character builds and come up with your unique style. Weapons are great, I absolutely enjoyed every moment of the combat. I think the cyberware mechanism is excellent, adds a lot of variety and feels futuristic. Map design is good, I liked roaming the countryside (badlands) around the city, gives a nice variety of getting out of the concrete jungle, has a great feel to it. I also liked the character development mechanics and the character management and configuration when it comes to clothing to attribute utilisation and cyberware management.The music is just awesome, it works so well with the world and the combat, it is one of the strongest points for me in this game. The strongest part for me however is the story, the characters and the fact that in some miraculous way CD Project Red managed to create a world (at least for me, highly subjective), where I wanted to return to interact with, to do the main and side missions and to just roam around and do things, customise my character, be in this world. Just after finishing everything did I realise how much I am missing it, and I am really sad that there is nothing left for me to do at the moment. Overall it was a great experience, not a lot of games got this close to me and I look forward to return to Night City as soon as possible when the DLCs come out. It is hard to objectively recommend this game to everyone, it definitely worked for me and it is one of my best gaming experiences ever, but this is not because it is so polished and all the promised features are there, it is just because I enjoyed it and I got attached to it emotionally, hard to say if it will work for you. I would definitely recommend giving it a try though. Farewell Night City, I miss you and I hope to return soon :).

author: Rhazar
review: After 24 hours (at this time) of playing, I will run my experiences down so you can either save $60, or purchase a game you'd like. I will try to do this review with my knowledge of game development. The Good:+ Quite impressive graphically. Expected nothing less from the developers behind The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt.+ Very well crafted character customization. There are tons of ways to play and unless you're playing on max difficulty, they're all viable and can become very powerful.+ I like how this game feels like a "Fallout type character development, meets Grand Theft Auto style of game, with a dash of Warframe in terms of cybernetics and futurism." Basically this is just futuristic GTA with a better character customization.+ I actually did feel emotions towards some characters. To get a player emotionally attached to characters in the story is a really good thing. The Bad:- The amount of bugs and glitches is pretty insane. Right off the rip you may see problems with actors clipping through solid objects, I've fallen through the world a few times just running across the street, and sometimes the dialogue doesn't appear, making you literally unable to make choices. - Some of the mechanics are absolutely busted. For instance, being a "netrunner" in this game is hugely unrewarding until very late game when you can afford to buy a better operating system with enough slots and then having good enough RNG to have decent hacks. Why go through all that when you can just dump all your stats into reflex and shoot things down in just a few bullets? Especially with pistols. Pistols do not need to be stronger than rifles. I don't know what logic comes in from "Smaller bullet (pistol) deals more damage than larger bullet (rifle)" but it doesn't make much sense. Balance-wise, pistols should be very good bang for your buck, not stronger than rifles. - Some of the upgrades for your character should really be a perk you get from progressing through the perk trees. I've actually made a character with near unlimited slow time. As long as the difficulty spike doesn't allow the enemies to shrug off the damage, my character quite literally can't die. The Ugly:-- There are just things missing from this game that really should be there. Like  - Why do I have to buy vehicles from fixers? Why can't I just steal a car from the street and bring it to a safe location and claim it? Not saying that should be a free process, of course you can charge the player some eddies for the process of converting ownership, but it should be far cheaper than some 24k+ for just a cheap ride.  - Why are clothing and a lot of customization locked in with the choice for color palette? Maybe I don't want my character to look like a mishmash of different colors, like someone just dropped acid.  -- The Borderlands-esque style of level -> equipment power doesn't add up. You get a pretty crazy difficulty spike after act 2 and you are definitely not geared enough for it. I mean, I think I was level 16 and had over 200-250 defense before going past the biochip heist, and I died to common Tyger Claws thugs in like 2 shots where just 30 minutes ago I ate their lunch. My guns (I had the 4 shot revolver, 4 shot sniper, and the burst fire assault rifle), especially the revolver, did like 250-300 or so damage per shot, and I have seen numbers as high as 1.6k for a headshot. The BASIC Tyger Claws took it and spat the lead back at me. I was chugging down consumables so much that I couldn't do anything other than haul ass and keep popping meds, that's a bit absurd. All in all, I really want to enjoy this game, but I cannot recommend it. There are just too many problems going on that needs to be addressed before I could say this is worth $60. From game breaking bugs still existing to the choices really not mattering, it all just gets to be a giant problem that hangs pretty high.

author: Babos
review: First off I wasn't hyped for the game at the beginning, but was curious. I tried to keep as much news of this game away. After the gameplay trailer I had confidence that this game would be at least be good and interesting.If CDPR never promised all the features they cut it would be a pretty good game. But now it just feels like we got the empty shell of what the game was supposed to be. Just another open world game with a lot of recycled content.And these things wont get fixed, it is to much in the core game that you can only hope for fixes, but the game is dead outside of the story missions.The good:- Graphics. If you have a PC good enough to crank those graphics up. The game looks beautiful and the city seems to come alive from that alone.-Story. The story is very good, it wasn't what I expected (I'll go into this later) but it did rope me in, The acting was good and the character were interesting and I started to care about them.-Side Missions. Again like the story, the few side missions are good, because of the characters and acting and story writing.The bad:-AI. The AI is horrendous. The city feels alive because of the looks. But the city feels dead because of the NPC's. Wether it is civilian pedestrians or drivers. Or police AI that spawn out of nowhere and vanish into thin air. The AI is horrible. It takes you right out of the game when no one acts like even a little bit of a human.-Choices. The choices in this game matter little to nothing. Every dialogue option is a question which won't continue the conversation or quest. Or a few choices on how to continue which are "Grumpy OK, happy OK or neutral OK". You can get a few new side missions or endings through this. But nothing really changes. You are on a set path, and nothing will change that.Repeated voice lines. Some times, but often enough. Not even for minor conversations, but pretty big and emotional conversations.The options are often not even close to what V eventually says. If you want to be nice you often times can't. Even if the dialogue option looks like it. Or vice versa.-Romances. Like the choices. Almost non existent. For every gender / sexual orientation there is 1 option. Unless you are bi, then you can choose 2. But if you are gay or straight. too bad, only 1. Even though the storyline for this is pretty good. you can't do anything else with them. Outside of missions they are just drones with 3 lines.Also you can only visit 2 sexworkers, one male, one female. In the entire city, only 2. With a few scenes here and there but those are once and add nothing, and is more mission related than anything else.-Customization. Once you are out of the character creation (which is lackluster) you cannot change anything.No tattoos, no hair, no implants, no facial hair. Nothing.Except for cybernetics, which don't get a cutscene or anything, and are almost never visual. You just buy them through a inventory screen and place them.You can changes clothes which were advertised as being pretty important, but they aren't. You change clothes because of armor and perks, not because something looks cool. You can't transmog your gear or turn off hats or face gear.You can't customize your apartment. There is also only 2 "homes" you get, which are story based. You can't buy any new home.You can't customize your vehicles. You also need to drive to a location to buy one. You don't have a garage.- YOU ARE NOT VNo matter what you choose, what you do. You are not V. V is a character, nothing you do changes his/her personality. If V doesn't like someone, (s)he doesn't. No matter if you want to be nice or not. V decides.-Cut content / Nothing to do outside of missionsYou can't go to a bar, sit, drink, call friends, hang out, do something with your romance. NothingThere seems to be so much, but every time you think "Can I do this?" you can't.This doesn't feel like the immersive cyberpunk RPG sim they stated it would be.Almost nothing they advertised is in the game. Except the game world.-The bugs and glitches. Everyone knows about these. But my game just fell apart at the seams at the final mission.Crucial moments didn't trigger. Had to reload several times to get an NPC in the right place to continue.AI / pathfinding went all out the door. enemies stumbled to find a place to stand and shoot, they came out of vehicles T posed and rotating every way.Enemies ran through walls / obstacles / vehicles.Some didn't even enter the area they were supposed to be.Walls didn't want to render at all. I could see into the void.Animations didn't trigger or were completely busted. Going into idle, t-pose, walking etc.Voice lines didn't trigger at all, or played twice.Sudden insta deaths with no reason as to why (no damage taken)Lipsync got busted several times.And all these bugs were only in the final mission, and I probably forgot some.Other bugs are:Not being able to pick things up.Cars suddenly flying through the air.Clothes / hair disappearing.Trash/boxes etc just suddenly exploding because they popped into existence just a second ago.Kill boxes in areas you can double jump to.Getting stuck in random places with no way out.Jumping on fences and whatnot increasing your speed so you instantly die.All of the NPC behaviour stated above.Vehicles disappearing on the horizon. You almost always drive alone one you get onto the freeway / outside the city. Even tough in the distance it seems like the road is full of vehicles. The closer you get the more despawn.

author: droobus
review: Where to start? After 150+ hours and exhausting pretty much all I could (not a trophy hound - most were popped during normal gameplay, the rest can go **** themselves) I have to say this game is tremendous. I only started playing after patch 1.2 and in all those hours I had 1 mission breaking bug early on (Jacky wouldn't sit down when told and I needed to restart..) Other than that I got a harmless graphical glitch (someone floating or drinking from an imaginary bottle) once every three hours or so - although I didn't play this like a GTA game, I behaved myself (because the character would) and I used the city for sightseeing as I went from mission to mission - other players tolerance of police and car chases may vary...  And what sights - Night City is one of the most immersive environments I have ever seen. This was one of the only games I have ever played where I didn't ever use a fast travel point. If it was daytime I'd summon Jackie's bike and at night I'd summon a car and drive first person around the city with the jazz channel on, savouring the sights and sounds with some John Coltrane. :)  One of my Steam friends wrote that he was thinking about the game and Night City when not playing and that's bang on - the desire to just dive back in and soak up the atmosphere is so strong.The missions too, especially side missions, were all engaging and different - loved diving with Judy and exploring a flooded town - will be one of those games missions I always remember, like the Bloody Baron. On the negative side, depending on your character spec, this becomes incredibly easy about a third of the way in, if you do all the side missions. I went with the hacker build and for about two thirds of the game I would pull up 50 metres from a gang and kill them all remotely with contagion, system reset and cyberpsycho - never got old though and made me feel like techno-wizardy 4rsehole, so not a problem for me but I can imagine some people upping the difficulty. Plenty of scope for replay as well - still not sure what the Cool stat is used for - mine was 5 all the way through. I also would have liked to have seen more missions set in cyberspace - there are a couple of narrative-heavy ones with little interaction but something that allowed you to navigate through cyberspace like Neuromancer or Count Zero would have been amazing. This is way too long, just play it and ignore the naysayers (on PC at least :)).

author: Rebecca Labfiend
review: I hold this game up on the same level as I do New Vegas.  Came out buggy, the console versions were unacceptable to the point of being possibly illegal, but its a very fun world to inhabit that feels alive and has a really vibrant modding scene that makes the game a 10/10 for me.  I will admit that the choices you get to make are inferior to New Vegas, but the world is just as high concept and full of unforgettable characters and stories.  If you want to try out some mods yourself, I recommend this mod pack, which installs and configures a ton of mods for you with minimal effort, all designed to work well together.

author: JG | Luxe
review: Wow, Well worth the wait.Sure, It's full of bugs, but none of the bugs I have encountered are game breaking. The story line is great and for the "game journalists" that said the game was only 20 hours long? lmao... PLEASE. I am 18 hours in and have barely even gotten started.There's TONS of Side quests, Side Gigs, Vigilante-esque missions and many more things to do. It will be a long time before I 100% the game to its completion.I love it.My PC is kind of potato, so I only get 75-80 FPS.i9-9900kRTX 3090 FTW3 Ultra32GB 3200 Mhz RAMM.2 SSDWater cooled with a 3 push/3 pull AIO set up (6 fans for CPU alone)2560x1440P Highest settings, Ultra everything, Ray Tracing on, DLSS on QualityGame is BEAUTIFUL and runs SMOOTH.

author: DOSU10
review: There is a cut scene at the beginning of the this game that shows V and Jackie making money and doing odd jobs and meeting people around Night City..... I would have much rather been playing that game then the one we got.

author: Zquarda
review: Overhyped from the trailers, disappointed from the actual game. Bugs, glitches or bad optimized are all fine to me, the gameplay is boring itself. IMO Cyberpunk2077 is just like Farcry with more details from story, same repeative activities around the map, weapons upgrading, even Farcry have aircraft and vehicles upgrading. Many missing contents from the trailer that could make the game better like cutscreen, customize apartment, life paths stories... too bad new contents won't be here any sooner cuz the game still a buggy disaster and need to be fixed first. I completed the story but I don't feel enjoyable most of playtime, the only thing that keep me stay is the story and soundtrack. Maybe new patches will change my mind, hope so.

author: Barricadas
review: This was probably my first preorder.  I felt that if the game turned out to be the worst game I played or didn't even run, 10 dollars I paid for The Witcher 2 and The Witcher 3 felt so much like stealing that the extra 60 would still not cover the amount I would pay for the enjoyment I got from them.After putting 160 hours on Cyberpunk 2077 I can say that it fully deserves the full price I paid for it on its own merits and after so many disappointments in the recent AAA releases that I had, this is the highest praise that I can give to this game. I'll start by saying that I love urban spaces, I love finding alleyways that I have never seen before in my real life neighbourhood, I love seeing all those lit up windows at night and I love that there are so many details and slices of life in every corner in a city. A city, to me, is the greatest work the humanity can achieve due to its intricacy, its organic nature and how it reflects the "human condition". Since the Liberty City of GTA IV, most games have been a disappointment in this regard, for example Skyrim's cities consisted of 20 NPC's and copy pasted guards, Los Santos of GTA V was just a sanitary (and small) theme park that just could not function as a city if it was translated into real life, and San Francisco of Watch_Dogs 2 was utterly devoid of character and charm. Previous game of CD Projekt Red, The Witcher 3 came close to what I expect from a digital urban space, Novigrad (and to some extent Toussaint) were brimming with life and had all the details that a real urban space might have but failed in size.The real protagonist of the marketing campaign for this game was the city itself, especially in Night City Wire episodes, V and his or her story was in the background and rightly so because this game, even with its minor issues has been the greatest city that has ever been built in a game. Every district, even every alleyway has so many details that I was amazed that my GTX 1070 could even run it (at a stable FPS rate too by the way!). There is a never seen before verticality in Night City. When GTA IV came out, I was impressed how many buildings there were that you could enter but most of them were just copy paste jobs with no real character to them. In 12 years that passed since its release I had expected that this would be polished and taken further but this did not happen until now. Night City on the other hand, does not only offer tons of well-designed buildings that you can enter, but completely opens up a new appreciation for the city once you get the leg cyberware that allows you to double or power jump (you probably should get one of those early). You can probably spend hours parkouring around buildings while focusing on every little detail that has been lovingly crafted and placed. Even some streets have multiple levels and while this is a common occurrence in real cities, I never noticed their absence in digital urban spaces until I visited Night City. Not only verticality distinguishes Night City from others, at 160 hours I know that there are probably hundreds of alleyways and tens of shops/bars/buildings that I never visited and even though I have completed the game at this point, I look forward to going back to the game and dissect every little detail in those and the small stories they tell. Especially whoever designed the graffiti around the city deserves a raise as I often found myself looking at those admiringly, wishing that the city I live in had some of those.Gameplay wise, I was not expecting much, just a Witcher in 2077 and this would have satisfied me but the game we got is a beautiful lovechild of The Witcher and Deus Ex. Every minor quest offers multiple paths you can take (if you have the necessary skill level on body or technical ability) and I had fun exploring every one of them that I could have found but I cannot deny that this level of freedom sometimes makes the game too easy and if you cannot go through some path you can always find alternatives that allows you to skip most of the level and reach the objective quickly.Game's difficulty level (I played on hard) is not helped by the fact that there are so many perks you can obtain to transform yourself into a demigod that one shots the opponent most of the time (I was doing 400k damage with my sniper rifle at the end of the game) but enemies can often one shot you as well if you are playing on hard or very hard. If you are an experienced player, I absolutely recommend picking one of those two difficulty levels. There is a good amount of weapon variety and unique reload and equip animations, and they make you feel like the most badass merc in the city. You can also use different hacks to keep your hands relatively clean, but I won't spoil this part as I loved seeing how those most of those hacks worked for the first time.Story and the characters are amazing. I did not think that I would enjoy this game as much as I did enjoy The Witcher games, as I am annoyed by the rampant individualism of the modern world and most of the themes of the Cyberpunk genre hit too close to home, but they found a good balance between the dissolving sense of community and aforementioned rampant individualism. I did not expect that the so many of the character side quests would dabble on the same issue that has been driving me mad and this theme was executed perfectly without stepping on too many tropes of the modern storywriting. For these side quests, I feel that the only thing is missing is a proper closure or change that impact the world, but it is also possible to consider this as a deliberate choice as V is just a passing merc and not the main character. One of the most groundbreaking parts of Cyberpunk 2077 is that, usually you feel like a companion in other people's main quests and this is extremely refreshing to see a game where the world does not revolve around player character. I feel like this should have been fleshed out more with a Stalker like system where every gang/community has its explicit objectives, and the player can see and impact this dynamic struggle for power or survival but maybe this is expecting too much from a game that already achieves so much.The main story is more related to traditional Cyberpunk genre themes, especially transhumanism, libertarian erosion of the state (or in better terms absolute corporate dictatorship) and artificial intelligence, but how they are presented elevates Cyberpunk 2077 from another example of the genre to a unique experience. Compared to newer Deus Ex games, where these themes are so on the nose that these issues become a mundane, everyday thing, Cyberpunk 2077, with the inclusion of Johnny Silverhand, approaches these themes with so much clarity and simplicity that you never feel the necessity to take a breather to adjust your suspension of disbelief. You may feel like the main story should have been longer and I thought of the same from time to time but at least there is a cohesive story that will force an expulsion of feelings, a catharsis, at numerous points of the story. First person point of view and a plethora of facial expressions that the characters employ greatly contributes to this as V has been much more of a relatable character than the most due to POV.Another innovation that I believe will pass under the radar is how I never felt the obligation to be Mr. Goody Two Shoes during the game and could usually transfer my personal beliefs and judgement into the story, without being punished by it which is so rare. In most games, you will often be punished by locking you out of content or forcing you to get a worse ending if you are not some form of a stoic angel, but Cyberpunk 2077 does not have this problem.Please see comments for the rest of my review as I have exhausted the space given to me by Steam. Sounds, bugs and final conclusion are in the comments.

author: Jirkis
review: Maybe not the tremendous and flawless game we were waiting for, but such a great game nonetheless. At least to me.According to the early trailers and promises, Cyberpunk 2077 was supposed to be a game coming from a distant future through a worm-hole and made by some aliens with a technology that we couldn't even dare to imagine. The hype was insane, the true next-gen was coming. Obviously it was too good to be true.In the end, we have got a game from our time, with the mandatory bugs, AI issues and head-scratching moments. People were outraged : “so many lies”, “my pre-purchase money was stolen”, “worst game ever”. Anger can make people say many things.Lesson learnt for some : pre-purchases can be a bad idea (sometimes), and the video game industry shareholders should talk less and give more time to the developers to avoid some backlashes and stock value drops.A few months after this drama, is Cyberpunk 2077 worth it ? My answer is yes. Yes it is.First of all, the game is not a mess. It’s perfectly playable and the bugs I had were minor : some junk I couldn’t pick for strange reasons, a few times I saw random NPCs going through a wall, and the car summoning may end with a good laugh. That’s basically all I saw. The AI is… alright. No better or worse than the other games. Enemies will look for you when they are aware of you, sometimes they can be clever and surround you, often they will hide and stay there shooting you at sight. Using your stealth abilities, the game will be easy as the enemies can be blind sometimes. Though the 1.3 update fixed a bit that issue in the hardest difficulty. The game runs very well and smoothly. I had one single crash in 186 hours, the loading is extremely fast and I had no fps issue. Frankly, I'm very impressed.The balance is somewhat unpolished. You can have a very easy or hard time following the weapons and build you use. Tech perks with a tech sniper with the ability to shoot through walls ? You are a god, one bullet, one kill. Basic assault rifle ? You might run out of bullets very fast. But it’s still playable and you can progress with whatever stats, build and equipment you use. About these stats and perks, the game is a RPG, not a FPS. You have lots of ways to go through this game. A sniper ? I was that. A ninja with a katana ? You can be that. A hacker who turns off the cameras but also the brains ? Go for it. You prefer to throw some grenades then go to melee with a baseball bat ? It’s a way of life in this city. These stats can also be useful in dialogues or to open some doors or computers. It’s pretty well done and adds a decent replay-value.But what I liked the most in this game is its immersion. From the main quest to the most hidden side quest, from Johnny Silverhand to Maman Brigitte, from the codex data to the e-mails in a hacked computer, from the trash bags in the city center to the rocks in the desert, everything felt polished, well-written and meticulously put in this huge city. I cared about Night City, I cared about every single quest, I cared about every single e-mail I read. And for this point only, the game is worth it, by a lot, and erase the few reproaches I have.  For sure this game is not perfect, and for certain it’s not the game we thought it would be, but I enjoyed a lot my almost 200 hours in a single playthrough that I spent in Night City during the last three months. I’ll remember this game for long. Thank you for all of your work, CD Projekt RED.

author: MarkNinety9
review: I just played a couple hours of patch 1.2 hoping things improved, but I had to quit when an NPC got stuck inside a shipping container and I couldn't kill him to end the mission. I reloaded and he was still stuck. Reloaded earlier and had to do a full clear to complete. Only buy this if you get a deep discount.

author: Brikthor
review: I'm not the biggest fan of skating games, but the absence of skaters in an immersive world like Cyberpunk 2077 just seems really off.Compliments to being an extremely good game with tons of content and impressive attention to detail otherwise.

author: EnforcerKiller
review: I just can't recommend this game in its current state. The story's kind of engaging, combat soundtrack is decent but will probably get repetitive, radio stations are eh, they have their good tunes. The driving feels really bad in this game and the physics don't help with that. Gunplay's alright, no complaints there. The skill trees have no real depth to them, just 3% more damage here, 5% more crit chance there, etc. None of these are why I'm giving this a negative review, however. It's the bugs. There's way too many of them, more than what should be even remotely considered acceptable in a video game.  of them aren't game-breaking, sure, but they are definitely immersion-breaking. Performance is also an issue for most people it seems, you need your hardware to be the best of the best if you want acceptable FPS (for reference, I was using the 3080 and pushing all settings to the max which got me to 40 fps in some spots, 60 in others). Another issue I have is that your lifepath matters ♥♥♥♥ all past the first 10 minutes. All you get is a choice for a different voiceline on occasion that doesn't add anything. That also ties into my issue with the dialogue options. They consist of this: move conversation forward OR ask a question related to convo. That's it. Sure, you'll get the occasional important choices later on in the game, but it feels like 90% of my dialogue choices so far have no meaning - mostly cause there are no real choices.After writing this review, I realized that the bugs ended up being a distraction that overshadows the actual problems with the game.The open world aspect of the game is weak. In fact, I recently found out that there isn't even driving AI in this game - they only follow preset paths and that's it. That's why you will never get a car chase in free roam - there is no AI that would make one work. You could get a wanted level maxed and you'd still not get any car chases, instead just lose the cops in 5-15 seconds. I'm disappointed that they advertised this game as open world - while technically true, yes, there isn't actually anything to do in it. Only complete quests, side quests and side quests masked as random events (gang attacks and the like). The world is completely hollow. "Over 1000 NPCs with different behaviors" might  be true, but it's misleading as ♥♥♥♥. They just have different preset paths which, when they reach the end of the path, they just circle around and follow the same path but backwards.Don't buy this game until CDPR fixes all the issues. This is an early access game disguised as a full release.

author: Mr.Gold
review: The point of this review will be mostly to argue against those that claim "It's just graphical issues" or "You're PC just isn't good enough". The game has far more issues than graphics and was blatantly not ready for release, so here we go. -This review will NOT contain major spoilers.1: There are several pretty big side quest lines that end up going absolutely nowhere, they hint at a much greater story but just end up dropping off on a cliff hanger like they were left unfinished. 2: About 1/3'rd of the map is actually utilized. The entire east section outside of the city is barely used, even if you choose the path that involves it those most. As well as other sections of the city such as Pacifica. 3: You simply don't spend enough time with a lot of the main and side characters to know enough about them besides the ones that have specific questline's tailored towards them. Such as the gang leaders, you barely interact with them or learn anything about them, most of it is stored away in the data shards you have to read. 4: The crafting system is just bad, there's really no excusing this one. If i want to craft ammunition for instance, it does not tell me how much i will craft, how much I have, how much i can store, I cannot choose how much i craft and i have to wait to craft each individual thing of ammo. On top of all that what is the point of crafting guns in the first place? They are so prohibitively expensive to craft and the parts are so rare, whats the point? The gun will be out dated in a couple levels anyway. I could upgrade it sure but that's limited and usually not worth it as I'll typically have a gun that I picked up that's better anyway.5: The game is poorly paced and/or too short. I was genuinely confused when I hit the "Point of no return". I felt like I was just about to hit the climax of the game when it was just about over. There was so much build up for a pretty disappointing ending that lacked a lot of context. Much of the story just felt incomplete and rushed, like they were trying to get me to move on to the next attraction so I don't stop and see the flaws or think about all the plot holes and lack of general context. 6: My computer is the "recommended specs" to a T and the game could barely run at low settings at 1080p. Its not the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ user. For the love of god stop blaming people who complain about the game running poorly because they just have "a ♥♥♥♥ PC". No, CD Projekt Red has ♥♥♥♥ optimization and ♥♥♥♥ recommended specs, stop with the cope. I SHOULD NOT HAVE TO ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ BUY A 2K COMPUTER JUST TO PLAY THE GAME I PREORDERED. 7: Many of the weapons and cyberware were just outright gimmicky and not fully flushed out. For example, the ricochet power, there was no point in the game i ever found it useful, the AI would always just rush me and never take cover long enough for it to be useful and it was also very difficult to get a proper hit when they were in cover. This goes for the smart weapons as well, what is the point of me being able to shoot around cover for less damage if the AI is too stupid to take proper cover in the first place and the smart shot gun was laughably worthless to use. In addition the only arm cyberware i used was the rocket one and I always seemed to kill myself more than the enemy even with a perk preventing explosive damage from myself. This leads into the problem with cyberware in general and that is the lack of it. The only truly useful ones you can't afford or don't even appear until the end of the game since you're not high enough level. So that cool new cyberware you saved up so much to get you barely use before the games over. 8: Atmosphere. I found very little to do in night city besides the main story and side objectives. No mini games, no interesting shops, no cool non story locations. There's this big open city to explore and ♥♥♥♥ all to do. This one could absolutely be just me admittedly but I just don't see a reason to return to the game and mess around as there's nothing to do once the story stuff is completed. In conclusion the game is not a terrible game but just a woefully rushed one. I know I spent the review talking about all the negative points but if you wish to know the positives there are plenty of other reviews that do it better than I would. I don't hate the game or think it was the worst game of the year. However considering how much time, money, advertisement and hype has gone into this game the state that it was in at release and its current state are completely unacceptable. Especially coming from a company with such a good reputation. There is plenty more I could drone on about like poor AI, the police being a complete non factor but I think ill leave it there as I felt like I hit the main points i wanted. No it's not "Just the graphics" and thank you for reading.

author: Rabs
review: All bugs and cut content aside the game is alright at best. It's still buggy as hell but let's put those aside for a moment.|Open World| 5/10The "open world" feels dead. Pedestrians just aimlessly walk around the block doing nothing. 99.9% of buildings are locked. There are barely any cars on the street. No random events on the street apart from some police shootings. The only couple places that felt alive were the mega-building where V lives and Voodoo boys place. ALL npc including those that suppose to be tough - cower in fear if a bird farts nearby, feel like a herd of sheep rather than "people". Oh you want to dive into role play and submerge into the futuristic cyberpunk city? Forget about it, just look at those flashy buildings eh? The city is very detailed and filigree crafted I give them that. But as someone once said: "the city is like a museum". It's cool to look at but don't touch it.|RPG| 3/10It is barely an rpg. Sure you can follow one path or another during some of the missions of the main quest and it changes the ending but that's as much as you get.There are love interests for main character that depending on your gender (or genitals I guess) in this game. In my case that was Panam Palmer. I can basically c*ckblock her every time she advances, ghost her and basically tell her to ♥♥♥♥ off and she still gonna call me near the end and tell me she misses me.I can go around the city and shoot gangs left and right and minute later their boss gonna call me and offer me a job. Speaking of calls. Somebody is gonna call you EVERY 5 F*CKING MINUTES.98% of dialogues are useless fillers. At one point of the game some dude asked me to join his gang and my options were "No" and "No<Attack>". Speaking of gangs. Who are they again? Is somebody even cares about them? They were hyped up like this rival gangs who are trying to take over the city, but you don't get to see rivalry, you can't side with any of those. And the only interaction with the gangs is when their boss gives you a mission. And those side missions feels like they're from mediocre MMORPG. "Go kill couple of dudes", "Go clean that place from dudes", "Go steal something from those dudes", "Go follow this person or steal this car".As for those notorious "origin stories". Yeah it's a filler to pad the runtime until the game starts. It's a "choose your tutorial", where you just walk around and talk to those forgettable npcs until the game throws you in the game as a street kid anyway. Yeah there are dialogue options that depends on your origin story but those do f*cking nothing. Just a different phrase that unravels the quest all the same.|FPS| 6/10Combat mechanics in this game are good. Shooting or punching someone actually feels like you're inflicting damage. Lot's of perks that allows you to enhance you combat in a meaningful way. For example you can jump from heights on someone with mantis blades and insta kill a goon in a cinematic fashion. Now to the bad side of the fps. The are like 20 weapon models. Just different color, rarity and stats. Still feels good to experiment with them with all the attachments and mods. Quickhacking is stupid. Basically you hack in the enemies chip briefly stagger them or deal minor damage. Unless you max out on hacking it's basically useless. |Character building| 8/10Your stats matter. I like the way they affect your gameplay. If you a strong guy you can open this door with force to reach location you otherwise miss. You maxes intelligence, you can hack in to the system and turn off all CCTV cameras to make your stealth even stealthier.Crafting is also good. The game doesn't throw a million different resources that are required for crafting like most games do. You have common/uncommon/rare/epic/legendary parts that you can use to craft or upgrade weapon or a piece of armor.Perks. There are good perks but there are sooooo many of those that they don't feel like they're affecting your gameplay. |Story| 9/10Ending on a good note.If you drop the fact that main character is Mary Sue. The story here is fantastic. Most of the time I find myself so invested in the story that I couldn't care about all the flaws of this game. I didn't watch any trailers or pre-sale marketing events of this game and I was straight up shocked by some turns of events of this game. I was so attached to Jackie that when he died I immediately went googling whether or not you can save him.Overall - 6.2/10 if you don't take into account the vast abundance of bugs. The game as it is now 4/10.

review: Finally. Time to burn the D A M N city

review: It works now

author: Jax
review: In it's current state this game is not worth full price. I believe there is a good game in there somewhere but in it's current form this game is incomplete and broken. There are several glitches, game breaking moments, and numerous bugs. Save your time and money. Don't buy this game until they improve the experience.

author: Trébily
review: Despite all the bugs and bad rating, this is a great game, exactly what I was waiting for. I'm really happy to play it.After completing this game i still think it's really good game with interesting quests and characters.

author: chicken stomper
review: I jumped into the game expecting good things, but not something incredibly life changing, just something well done and on par or close to the witcher 3 in terms of both gameplay and story. My review isn't perfect cause I just blasted through 10 hours of this ♥♥♥♥, and am a bit fried.Say what you will about it's story but I quite enjoyed the first act, and was touched at the characters interaction, despite having very little set up. The story so far has been suspenseful, and fairly immersive, something that was, of course, expected. but the side quests, they're god awful. Most of them are just little radiant fetch/ kill missions and the story accompanying them is terrible/nonexistent. Some of these radiant quests can't even be bothered to have recycled voice lines (unless that's another bug, which there's plenty of) and are just a fleshy mob of unremarkable enemies to sink lead into.The melee combat is absolutely pathetic, you just meekly slap people with whatever weapon you happen to have, and while it does good damage, you really just spam left click, there's no skill or anything creative involved in it, animations are boring, and never even interact with your target, ie a sword bounces off somebody, doesn't actually cut/stab them, even for a final swing.All in all, I would not recommend this game, it's buggy as hell, the combat (a primary function of the game) is rather boring at times, consisting mainly of bullet sponges and endless shootouts. The story is enjoyable but judging by other reviews that's clearly up for debate, and half of the side quests are absolutely boring as hell.It really just feels like a modified, slightly more serious and much for sexual saints row, and you can buy that for like 3 dollars.

author: Harry101UK
review: This is the buggiest game I've played in years. Literally every 60 seconds I encounter another bug. Whether it's a pedestrian floating and walking through the sky, a garbage can exploding near me, NPC mouths not moving when they talk to you, a guitarist playing an invisible guitar, a story NPC walking through walls, or many items that I simply cannot pick up; it wears you down after a few hours.Cars and pedestrians also just disappear right in front of you a lot. When I look into mirrors, my female character is bald, even though they have hair and a hat. Your body casts a shadow on the world, but most of the time it has no head, or no hair. When I reload one of the assault rifles, the magazine doesn't get pulled out when the character grabs it. The list of glitches is endless. I've been documenting a lot of the problems and made a video here: Gameplay is similarly disappointing. The combat feels worse than Fallout 4, and enemies are complete bullet-sponges. Even on Easy mode, you need to unload 2-3 magazines to take down some of the basic human enemies. I started on Normal, and after the first few missions I had to turn it down because it got boring shooting every enemy hundreds of times.One of the first missions features enemies that can 'hack' you and make you burst into flames. They do this through walls on the other side of the building and there's nothing you can do to stop it. I just kept burning over and over until I progressed through the level enough to find and kill them.A lot of the time, your footsteps and movement make no sound. It's really weird when you're jumping and climbing over rooftops and obstacles and it's completely silent.Some of the controls cannot be rebinded. I usually play with the right side of the keyboard, but here I can't. You can't remap the interaction key from 'F', can't remap the movement to arrow keys, etc. The only way to fix this is to dig into the game's configuration files and alter some text lines. Even then, some keys like 'Inventory' and 'Map' are completely hardcoded and cannot be changed.Vehicles keep turning after you let go of the direction key, so I nearly crash on every corner.Performance on a 2080 Super (i7 6700K, 32GB RAM, 850 EVO SSD - latest Nvidia drivers) is less than ideal. Even with ray tracing disabled, I NEED DLSS enabled just to hit 40-60fps. And that makes it look blurry and aliased, especially at 1440p. There's also a weird bug where if I change a graphics setting and then return to gameplay, my FPS drops to a 5fps slideshow for a minute or so. It's like it needs to reload every shader in the game or something.I will continue to play for the amazing world design, and update the review as necessary, but it's definitely a disappointment so far. It feels like it needed another year in the oven.

author: マイラ DEATHBRINGER
review: This game works surprisingly well on my nearly 7 year old laptop. I can play at max settings with little to no lag or performance issues.These past few updates have really made this game shine. Still not a fan of all the re-writes and re-cuts but what we got is still a decent Cyberpunk RPG with captivating characters, nice crisp visuals, badass music, beautiful city-scapes with lots of nice vehicles to ride around with and cool weapons to kill droves of enemies with.Better than most open world games and the in-depth RPG mechanics are fire.The side quests really add to the longevity of this near perfect masterpiece. I've been waiting since 2012 for this game to come out and and hopeful that future content will make it better and closer to their original vision.

author: ceno0
review: the game is unpolished as fuuu, lots of bugs and stuff like that (tho i didnt encountered anything game braking). But if you really like games like new Deus ex-es or new Prey you gonna like this one too. Even though the balance and some of the mechanics are kinda off, i suggest you to play more aggressively no matter mele or ranged weapons you use Also the game needs a good pc.

author: professional pants shitter
review: It hurts me to write this.I've been waiting on this game since 2013. I've followed every piece of media or news surrounding it. I even did something I normally never do - pre-ordering. Unfortunately, at this current state, I would not recommend purchasing this game at full price.I'll start off with the good parts about this game. Mainly the storyline and overall gameplay. Combat does leave some to be desired, but it's still engaging and really fun. The main campaign and side quests are really good, with plenty of emotional and thought-provoking moments. Choice and agency  there in some form, but I feel there's not as much as I would like. But that may be cause I hadn't adjusted my expectations properly, so take that with a grain of salt. Night City is also quite possibly the most beautiful game world I've seen to date. The music and sound design is top notch and it just adds to the beauty of Night City. Only issue I've had in this regard are the short lifepath prologues. I wouldn't mind them to be a bit longer.Now for the not so fun bits.The bugs are there. They're glaring and they impede on the immersion, which is what sold this game for me in the first place. Floating objects, t-posing NPCs, poor rendering of characters and cars, NPCs just magically appearing out of nowhere. Your vehicle vanishing into thin air upon reloading a save. Braindead AI and probably the worst cops in any open world game. NPCs simultaneously talking to and over V, failing lip-syncs and pieces of clothing turning invisible.Normally, I would overlook most of these bugs. But because they're so pervasive and happen literally every single time, it becomes really hard to not notice them. I've had the fortune to play this on a relatively high-end PC, but I've also heard that the game is practically unplayable on consoles. This is unacceptable for a game that's been in development for eight years,  crunch time. CDPR tampered with reviews, withheld information about the final product, and straight-up lied to its costumers. For a company that boasts about being consumer-friendly, this sets an extremely poor precedent which unfortunately is all too common among the gaming industry.Until this game gets the bugfixes it needs, I see no reason to purchase it.: Fun game with engaging storyline. Bugs make it a continuing hindrance on overall enjoyment. Will not recommend at full price in its current state.

author: SHAKER
review: # من أفضل الألعاب الي لعبتها #1- نعم اللعبة تعاني من مشاكل وقت كتابة تقييمي # لكن التحديثات و الحلول في الطريق 2- عالم رهيب رهيب بمعنى الكلمة #هذا وانا شخص اكره العالم المستقبلي 3- الترجمة قوية جدا وممتازه #مع بعض التخفضات على بعض اختيار الكلمات 4- مجريات القصة إلى وقت كتابة تعليقي مشوقه جدا # و المهام الجانبية رهيبه تدخلك جو في العالم 5-  القيم بلاي ممتاز مع اني العب ميلي اكثر و التصويب جيدا جدا # لكن احينا احسه بدائي بعض الشيء 6-   في اللعبة قوي بمعنى الكلمة خيارات و خصائص و تخصيص جسدك وقوتك و المهارات ..rpg # أفضل لعبة أستغلت كل شيء كل جزئية 7- الرسوم و الجرفسك - خيالي قفزة قوية #لكن تحتاج جهاز ممتاز انا على كرت 1060 مع هذا مستمتع لاني ما اهتم بـ الفريمات$ في المختصر هذي لعبة تستحق سعرها الكامل لما تقدمة من عالم و قصة ( يوجد خيار إزالة التعري جدا رهيب و انصح الكل يفعله )

author: Feindbold
review: You can barely play for more than 20 minutes, without encountering major game- or immersion breaking bugs. For instance, you usually have to spawn your car multiple times, until you get lucky and your car doesn’t spawn inside other cars or props and gets ripped apart immediately. The city looks great at first glance, but the moment you start exploring, especially climbing, this all falls apart and you will notice how empty and soulless everything is. The entire city is built with a relatively small set of assets. These assets are lazily copy-pasted into each other and if you look closer, you will find many obvious holes in the geometry. Interesting to note, the area around your Apartment looks noticeably less generic and much more polished than the rest of the map.I’m not even going to talk about the non-existing NPC AI or the broken mechanics, according to tests on Reddit, even after Patch 1.1, there are still 35 Perks, that simply not work. It seems like this game was released in an early beta stage. Even though I enjoyed it overall, I feel very cheated as a customer. The release of Patch 1.1, that was hyped as a big update, but was a very small set of bugfixes in reality, is a good indicator, that CDPR continues to disappoint and lie to their customer base.

author: Pyrenox
review: First I wanted to write lot of things about this game then I realize that it's not worth it so all I wanna say is that After I finish this game I got the same vibes when I watched Game Of Thrones season final thats all I'm saying.Totally garbage Only 2 good things is Johnny's comments in game and no loading screen people thinking the problem as bugs but its not about just bugs no rp no choices that matters its empty af in the begining you choosing your life path and thinking like wow man thats deep maybe its like TVM:BL but its not its not even skyrim ffs its just gta with some action and  too short main story and some side jobs thats all 4/10

author: Faunfire
review: We waited years for this. And if you don't have the best of the best computer, it looks like dog crap, maybe something out of unity with unfinished lighting and 30fps. If you can't run ray-tracing, don't even bother buying the game. The glitches are constant, and even *with* a good graphics card, it does not look remotely like how it was advertised to look. This game is not optimized at all. I can run red-dead redemption 2 on ultra graphics, but not cyberpunk? Ridiculous! Your character customization is based on preset button choices. Do you want ugly jaw type 1? Or awkward broken nose type 2?. You dont have the option to change your bodytype/shape at all. No muscle mass options, no nothing. Saints Row 4 came out in 2013 and has both better voice acting, more choices of voice actors, a slider to pitch the voice, sliders to customize with in general, better dialog, and doesn't make you feel second hand embarrassment when you hear your own character speak. There's only two voice actors. "I'm clearly a middle-aged man" and "I might be a girl with bronchitis in my teens" and it's edgy to the level of cringe.You can change genitalia, and for some reason they decided to put in *realistic peepee physics* instead of giving you the option to remove breasts from a woman because you maybe don't want to look like a walking slab of meat. But hey, you can make a futa, right? The NPCs glitch out, the game is full of bugs, and it feels like a rushed product for a mobile RPG game. This in no way feels finished at all, and for a game that's all about customization and including every type of person; for a game that's set in the future so you can modify your body however you want if you can pay for it, you have zero control over what your character looks like. If you want to even consider buying this game, you need to wait. You need to wait until they start optimizing it, wait till they change the loading screen because for anyone with epilepsy; it has a *significant* risk of giving you a seizure. You need to wait until they give you proper customization options, better choices, and definitely definitely wait until they lower the price. It might be a good game over all, but if I can run red-dead on it's highest settings without my rig catching fire and i can't even play cyberpunk without the lighting erasing the inside of my character's eyeballs and making it look like they're a ghoul from fallout? That's just sad. This game is not worth all the hype, and it's soul crushing to see that it had been pushed back and pushed back and pushed back because no-one bothered to actually work on it.I don't think i've ever been more disappointed in my life.

author: Kitty ♡
review: Such a good game, I didnt try it for ages cause I thought it wouldnt be good and run badly, but now it is one of my absolute favorite games

review: Not nearly as buggy as people are making it out to be, nothing game breaking and the bugs it does have are few and far betweenLooks great but you'll need a 30 series to even hope to play it smoothly
