review: a lot of naked women

author: ꝚΞM
review: Tl;Dr Cyberpunk 2077 is an experience I recommend to anyone, but depending on the platform ppl have it on, it could be best to wait a while for some patches that fix the current bugs, otherwise NightCity is truly breathtaking, in more ways than one. For PC I think the bugs will get ironed out in due time and that would be the only gripe with the game currently, as the sum of it all has the potential to be one of the best role playing games: -the storytelling is gripping-the environment is rich and immersive-the graphics and sound aspect are top notch-the game play is fun and rewarding while movement, gunplay and driving behave pretty good - as much as you'd expect from a role playing game and these do get better with time.All these pros are currently muddled by the bugs still present on PC (other platforms are not subject of this review) rarely game breaking, yet annoying when they happen, since the immersion is so strong for me in this game and bugs can ruin it completely.That being said this is an awesome first person experience; I enjoy just walking about and seeing how the game looks, I enjoy the lore pieces and references scattered throughout the city. The music fits very well. The gunplay feels particularly rewarding. There could be some combat balance issues to fix further down the line. The inventory/UI could use another pass for clarity and convenience. The game looks very good on high and fine on medium preset. The REDengine 4 does a very good job and the game is playable on 40 fps unless you're in a fast paced shooting scenario with multiple enemies. That being said, performance overall is acceptable on PC as the requirements were pretty high from the start and if you want a full RT experience (DLSS required) on above 1080p you will need 6800 XT/3080 or above with a strong CPU.I believe CDPR will do a good job here as it did with improving Witcher3 and once the bugs are patched, Cyberpunk 2077 will be remembered as one of the greatest role playing experiences or at least one of the most immersive cyberpunk games up to date.

author: Trucker Cassie
review: It has been a long time since I played a game that made me long for the next game session as much as Cyberpunk. I absolutely love this game. Yes, it is glitchy and buggy and yes, the developers should have gotten more time to actually finish it. But as long as the bugs are only visible and will be fixed later on, I don't think it's a problem. Night City is so nice to look at, I find myself getting distracted from my quests, just to look at everything in the city. The NPCs wantering around feel a bit creepy though. The just wander aimlessly, and if you interupt them, they just go the other way, or even disappear.I get a bit bored during the long sit-down-and-talk sessions and often miss what the quest was about, but that's more a personal problem I guess. And the game leads you through what to do very well when the mission starts. Mini map works like a charm.Overall, I have had so much fun in this game and I am so grateful I get to play it. Can't wait for multiplayer!

author: Vlad 254
review: Game's fine, at least I'm enjoying it although let's be honest, this game had little chance after so much hype. That said, it sat in my library and I did not actually download it until Feb 3rd as I waited for some patches.I have played far worse games and far buggier games. This is well done imo and I have not ran into any real glitches and maybe 2 or 3 very minor ones in over 100 hours of play.I have a decent rig but not a NASA level pc, i7-8700 and an RTX2070 but I'm sure this game runs less favorably with a lesser rig as it is a 2021 game with some decent technology.Reviews in general don't always tell the story. I do read them and write a few on products in general including games but I find some people complain regardless. I would have missed out on some good products over the years if I strictly went by reviews. Tastes are different and so are mindsets and temperaments.That said I noticed a campaign of sorts by those who hate this game to actually bring the overall rating of this game down. Yes some in the forums have been pushing for bad reviews. Enjoy the game and if it's not for you move on, or vent and move on. But don't bust on other people who like the game just because you don't like the game. When you do that I can't take your original opinion with any degree of seriousness.Edit: 1 more thing. The are countless "Let's Play" videos or quest walkthroughs and how to videos on the web. You'll see that the game runs just fine. And I am enjoying this game. Btw, it is an action Adventure with some RPG elements.2nd update: So 190 hrs in and I have to say this game is fun and has been running very well for me. No freezes, no crashes, no issues completing missing, no issues with achievements (if that's your thing) although I'm not really an achievement hunter. The game looks amazing.The game might not be equal to all the hype but not many if any could hurdle the bar that was set for this game. Make no mistake it's a good game if Action Adventure games with some RPG elements are your thing. I give it a 7 1/2 out of 10 on PC but on console forget it from what I've seen and heard. More patches coming for both. Enjoy, I know I am.3rd Update. Finished the game on two different endings and I have to say there is much I really like about this game. Really took my time exploring this game plus I focused heavy on crafting and that can be time consuming if you let it be which I did. Fortunately when you get to the point of no return the game auto pauses and let's you know while also autosaving at that point then will throw you back there after you beat the game if you say yes to that option which I did. I love the Crafting, the weapons, the gameplay fighting mechanics, and of course the story. You can really get attached to some of the characters.As far as glitches go nothing really stopped me from completing the game and although I am not an Achievement hunter I don't feel like I was glitched out of any except maybe one but I can't say for sure as in the beginning before I really had a grasp for the game I messed up a side job and that job cost me 1 achievement.This game is worth buying, but if you have a potato for a computer I would hold off until more patches come out and then make sure you meet the min requirements of course. Oh, I am also now modding a second character (playthru) with Nexus mods and they have many many mods already including a couple of game fix mods but I did not use mods on my first playthru.I'm revising my overall score on this game of which I am so glad I played to an 8 although I'm tempted to go 8 1/2. I'll be playing more characters as time goes on.

author: Kiden
review: the memes were good

author: MadMaxLiS
review: We don't need wait for nude mods, game already have detailed 18+ content (respect to authors) ;)

author: JL3001
review: I have 200 hours in this game. Not from actual gameplay, but from a bug where the game doesn't fully close and runs up the time on Steam. Just another bug, which I guess is CDPR trying to run up the hours of playtime on the game for metrics since most players dropped it a week after it came out. But uhhhhh, yeah, the game is alright. So many moments where it's clear that had they actually put more work into the game it would've been awesome but so many corners cut. Beautiful looking city that is completely devoid of life. Some great missions but a truncated and somewhat linear story mode. Performance issues out the wazoo. Just a whole mix of good and not so good, but it's occasionally fun to play.

author: Nails
review: Yes there are bugs, no they're not game breaking. Most are graphics glitches, some are AI bugs, some are mission bugs--- but in my experience they don't take away from the game which is fun as hell. You can sink hours into just side missions and gaining money and street cred.  It looks great even while running medium graphicsGreat characters, great story, the city is massive and one of the best designed open world cities since GTA San Andreas. Forget the haters, if you like good immersive RPGs and open world games you'll enjoy this. Few tips for newer players: -Play on Hard mode, it'll be more rewarding and challenging. -Scan everything all the time. -Save (F5) all the time...ALL THE TIME. -Buy skills based on your style and it's okay to banks points until you're sure what you want to spend them on. -Do side missions as you see fit, they'll stack up, but don't worry. -Have fun out there chumps!

author: Miserable Panda
review: It's really hard to write this, but I strongly recommend to wait or even not to buy this game for the time being. Besides the glaring performance, visual and gameplay issues (which are severely consistent across the whole game), Cyberpunk 2077 has an even worse problem under the covers.The thing is, Cyberpunk can hardly be considered an RPG by this point. There is almost no player agency, as the story always plays out the same way, with the only meaningful choice being the epilogue of the game and the final mission. Not only that, but player customization is pretty lacking, with only 5 stats and several skills with a bare-bones talent tree. It seems that CDPR mainly focused on its script and the action elements (which are acceptable as best) instead a providing an outstanding role-playing experience, which seems extremely weird when we consider that this game was developed by the same company that published the Witcher 2, one of the best RPGs of all time. It seems that AAA RPGs will keep taking this route in the near future (see Fallout 4, Outer Worlds), so I would advise you guys to consider games such as Disco Elysium if you really want to experience a deep and complex RPG game. Going back to Cyberpunk, I hope that future patches will fix the most notable bugs but, deep down, I believe several core aspects of the game will stay the same, leaving us with a husk or a 'what-could-have-been'.

author: Evergreen
review: I was one of the poor fools who pre-ordered this game. I watched the 48 minute "gameplay" demo (which was revealed to be fake post-launch) almost every day to hype myself up for this game. I wasn't expecting a godly game, I really wasn't. But I was expecting what was shown leading up to launch to be what we got. I'm not even too angry about the bugs. Sure, they're immersion breaking, and are just dumb overall, but I can live with them. No, what I'm upset about is all the features that were shown which were all but existent in the final release. So many features were removed an entire essay's worth of text was written just showing what wasn't in the final game. (By the way, if you wish to see that post, you can do so here - - ->  <- -) Point is, what you see in the images, and footage from CDPR isn't what you get. The footage is almost all taken from a montage, or the intro to the game, with all the shown off features outright missing from the game. AI is brain dead and will leave fights underwhelming, the dialogue system, and your choices don't seem to impact anything, the weapons, while fun to use, are victim to that "ditch it as soon as you find another with +1 Damage" system, and the city generally just feels dead. Sure there's people walking around, but they don't do anything, other than show off how buggy the game is. All in all, I wouldn't recommend this game because of how badly we were lied to. The features shown off are almost all gone, leaving a hollow husk of a game. It's truly sad to me, as I would've loved a single player game to dive into a genre like this and generally popularize it. Unfortunately, it seems the term "Cyberpunk" will be associated with this game for years to come. One thing I feel I need to specify: I'm not entirely blaming the Developers of Cyberpunk 2077 for how it turned out. I blame the greedy execs who wanted to rush this game out the door for a quick buck, as this is what happens when they do. I am hoping that, by some miracle, the developers are going to somehow add in all the previous features shown off, and give us the game we were promised, but I highly doubt that would happen.

author: Ley
review: The only good thing that has happened in 2020.

author: FroBodine
review: I just want to give this a thumbs up for now.  I know it's way, way too early to write a review, but the game runs pretty great on my aging i7-6700K, GTX 1070ti, in 2560x1440 resolution.  All settings on medium except LOD, which I kept on high.  I'm getting at least 40 fps, sometimes almost 50, sometimes less.  I may drop my resolution to 1080p to get constant 50+ fps.Plus, I have more play time than the penis review and the reward for 2020 review.  It's quite fun so far, and that's all that matters to me.[Update 6/15/2022]  Yep, it's good.  In fact, it's fantastic.

author: MagicianArcana
review: SPOILER FREE REVIEW:After 113 hours, I've finished the most anticipated game of the decade. I played as a mantis blade-totting male V with the Nomad lifepath and got the good/best ending with primary attributes being Body/Reflexes/Tech. To say the experience was underwhelming would be the understatement of the century.Let's get the good things out of the way first:> Interesting plot: V, a mercenary in the game's dystopian setting of Night City finds themselves chasing a once-in-a-lifetime job- retrieving a biochip (allegedly granting immortality) from the biggest corporation in the city, Arasaka.> Fantastic visuals: On a technical level, this is one of the best looking games out there, capable of some good looking shots even at lower settings. Amazing lighting and character detail.> Solid soundtrack: Developer CDPR has always excelled at this so no surprise there.> Great lore: as Cyberpunk 2020 is an already established franchise, (going back to the late 80s) there's a ton of material for the devs to work with and they definitely seem to have done a decent job in translating the tabletop material to a mainstream RPG format with the world, design, terminology, signature characters, etc... all the while encapsulating it with their own spin on the lore.> Good characters: the major cast is well realized like Jackie, Rogue, Panam, and Johnny Silverhand himself. Voice delivery and animation work is good for the most part.> Promotes a variety of playstyles - tanky solo (using the Berserk deck), sneaky netrunner (with a Cyberdeck), hybrid, etc> The Cyberdeck Quickhack system: Its cool and frankly overpowered, letting you deal with enemies without even entering combat.> Encourages exploration: with some neat rewards and non-plot related world building for those who take their time to explore.Mixed on:> Character customization: feels a tad limited/basic> Gameplay: In essence it has Fallout like interaction and attribute system + Deus Ex like exploration + Borderlands like combat and skill system - all of it is servicable. Melee is ok, not bad but not good either. The hand-to-hand fight quests were garbage in Witcher 3 and they're even worse here. Combine all the problems the game has, both technical and fundamental, and combat becomes stale very quick.> V's disconnect from the player and world: due to being strictly first person, the cinematography feels very unimpactful during major moments.> Lots of augs and skills - but most are extra stat boosts/tweaks (like regain health when reaching certain lower threshold) or borderline pointless stuff (like 2% chance to shock enemies); only augs that were actually gameplay changing were the Double Jump for the legs and Kereznikov/Sandevistan (slows time for a few seconds)> Side quests: Some of the story side content is quite good (like The Hunt and Sinnerman) but most are forgettable. Though none of them are as complexly designed as the first major side quest about retrieving the spybot from Maelstorm.> Wonky car handling: its either too heavy or too slippery but some vehicles handle better than others - you get used to it eventually.> Gear system: Since different gear have different values, your character will end up looking like a complete buffoon if you want to equip the highest armor accessories. Something like Nioh's refashion system would've been great.Unfortunately the game just drops the ball with regards to everything else:> Basic open world: Night City is beautiful but shallow - huge and vertical with nothing to do besides run, sneak, interact, jump, attack, drive and pick up scattered loot. Most open world activities (including Gigs) are picked from Ubisoft's book: go here kill this person, clear this hideout, upload this malware, steal this item etc.> Action and choice: The world does not react or change based on your choices or actions and majority of the decisions you make outside the main plot don't really make a difference to anything.> Lacking basic enemy variety: thugs/enforcers, netrunners, robots/drones and the occasional cyberpsycho - that's literally it.> Horrible AI: The worst AI I have seen in a modern video game yet and makes the meh combat a dull endeavor. NPCs have limited behaviours and no basic pathing or collision detection either.> Tedious crafting system and inventory management - seriously who designed this? Upgrading/crafting gear is very expensive due to needing a ridiculous number of components (often in the higher double digits or hundreds) - even after investing in relevant skills. Disassembling items is a slow process and crafting said components is hair-pulling levels of frustrating; the game really expects me to keep clicking the CRAFT button 500 times to get the 100 components I want?> Buggy/broken: It's no secret this game is a mess thanks to being in development hell AND being rushed by the upper management. That means this is one of the buggiest games I have played yet, with immersion breaking glitches at every turn - from as harmless as not being able to pick up smaller loot to major, like one of the minibosses being unable to move due to getting stuck in a chair. If I had to describe the situation in one sentence, it'd be "barely hanging together with duct tape and spit".> Misleading marketing: As much as I sympathize with the devs, Cyberpunk 2077 is unfortunately the best example of "overpromise and underdeliver" - promised features cut throughout development (like vehicle/apartment customization, non-combat uses for weapons), numerous missing features (no law enforcement tier system, no environmental hazards, no complex AI routines, etc), mechanics that don't work as intended (cops spawn out of thin air instead of in vehicles) and watered down systems (missing lifepath content and toned down verticality). Oh and lying about the state of the game mere weeks before launch.> Bad optimization: I've seen people across various platforms (and different PC configs) reporting different problems even after patches - for me the game slows to a crawl whenever I look in a mirror (despite rendering mirror res being low and pixelated) or even freezes for a while when taking a picture using the photo mode. Although some of the more pressing issues have been reduced/tweaked (like slightly better overall performance and asset streaming post-patches).Verdict:5.5/10. I agree with my V on this one: while I enjoyed my stay in Night City, I don't see myself returning to it anytime soon. The game peaks during the first 6-7 hours which got the most development polish out of the several dozen hours the journey lasts. Not worth buying till it's fixed and when it is, wait for a discount. The pros can't save this one from being painfully mediocre, even though it manages to be engrossing at times. Oh well, hope they finally realize their vision with a sequel.

author: K-
review: Haters and mindless trolls are just part of gaming now. The world is full of fake news, real news being called fake news, science denial, and Russiam troll farms stoking the embers of dissent. Nowhere is that more apparent than politics, and for some reason, metacritic. Just scroll through the reviews on metacritic and look at all the new accounts in Russian or broken English, ranting about SJWs in video game development. It's coordinated.Cyberpunk 2077 and every game with analog of hype that has ANY flaws or controversial material will be targeted by these whiny ass people with no lives.The game is a little buggy, but it's far from unplayable. As someone with a love for old school PC RPGs, bugs were a part of the charm. These are minor and will certainly be fixed in a few months of updates.The game itself is beautiful. On my PC, with an RTX 2070, it's the most impressive looking game I've seen. The story and cutscene are a masterpiece. The gameplay is fun and deep. This game would easily deserve 10 if not for the bugs, which were easily foreseeable given the rush to release. Because the game is victim to review it will be a 10 trolls, I'm giving it a 10. By the time you read this review it will most likely be a 10.But make more mistake, this is a great game and anyone giving it less than an 8 is a troll, a whiny loser, or just a paid shill.

author: Fever 🔥
review: Cyberpunk Edgerunners is the greatest video game anime of all time !!!I tried watching it in sub (Japanese Original Audio) but it gave me headache each time i heard japanese voice over english songs from the game. So i settled for dub (English Audio) which im not proud of but ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ that voice acting in english is soooooo freaking good, that even u'd hear characters from the game in here like wakaku... i freaking loved this anime, for 10 episodes this is really well written, kinda fast paced, full of action and top quality animation & music. Overall, great anime, thank you CD PROJECT RED for giving us another hearty story from nightcity ! Honestly, it's how i pictured the game to be, but it ended up in anime ! Recommend this as a much watch !(Old Review) Maaaan, this is the cybernetic future dream ! Feels like im really living it out in NightCity & I aint never wanna leave !2020 was gonna be the worst year ever but this game turned dem tables...11/10

author: MightyOwl86
review: EDIT: Replaying this game throughout 2022 has been a generally good time. Game is a lot better now than it was at launch, however there are still a couple of bugs occasionally. I can recommend it now if you're into Immersive Sims. The Prologue/First Act is the highlight for me, it's where I enjoyed the game the most. The rest of the story just felt...eh. Vehicles feel alright, the FPS game play could be better, as it feels pretty clunky. If I could add something to the game, it would be more varied options in clothing. Everything feels like it's some slight variation of other items, and most of the time during the game you're gonna be looking like you just ran through the clothing section at a Walmart. Give me some Cyberpunk helmets or somethin. I'm glad I can actually enjoy it now in some form, because I'm never gonna forget how much of a disaster this was at launch.And if you already own it, chances are you're re-downloading this because of Edgerunners.
There is a quote in the game "Corpotrash. Style over substance." - which perfectly summarizes this game.

author: Keels.Gawds
review: Amazing game and soooo much replayablility! Check out all the available mods online.

author: Max 1987
review: If you want an ROL game, and the promises that CDP told us in 2017, to choose to be what we want, forget it.It is an open world action game and nothing else.The three useless backgrounds, they only change dialogues, forget about being from Arasaka and being an evil businessman like Mr. Burns, choose the background you choose, you end up being a mercenary, there is no option to join any faction that is in the game, which is what CDP promised.When we talk about RPG or ROL, it is the option of being able to interpret the ROL of something, for example, being a policeman, a doctor, a militech, Arasaka, Malestrom, Sector 6, Triads, etc.You can't be any of that, you can't join any faction, you can't be bad, or I would have liked to be from arasaka and use sleeper agents or spies to destroy another company, you can't join the police and be a police officer , you can not join militech .In other words, there is nothing about ROL, you end up being a mercenary, you meet Jackie, then NEO or Kanue Reves, nods to the matrix, and a linear game in terms of history.A real pity, because the base is there.I would have loved to be able to be with Malestrom, and become a cyborg and do missions for them, like kidnapping people to steal their implants and sell them on the black market, or being able to join Militech and do missions for them and move up the ranks, or to be able to be the doctors who are armed, or some ROL option.Give us the option to be bad and intervene in the decisions of the story.Not to mention all the content they cut and the promises they never kept.The problem is not the bugs, but what was previously written.The graphics and the artistic part are spectacular, but it is noticeable that in each patch or update they focus more on Ray Tracing and DLSS, it is noticeable that they are more interested in selling more Nvidia RTX than improving the game.There are very few weapons, there is no customization option as promised, very zero, you only see and a silencer.You cannot modify the magazines to increase the ammunition capacity, you cannot modify the barrels of the weapons to improve the range or damage, you cannot modify stocks or anything, I would have liked a system similar to that of Pay Day 2. The only thing that can be done is to improve the STATS, and in a few variety of weapons, the colors change, and nothing more.The cars were a mess handling, you can buy cars, but they can't be modified as promised.There are parts of the map that were never finished, not to mention the metro system that was promised, it shows that something happened in the development of the game, a pity.Theme of secondary missions are entertaining more than the main story.Very repetitive activities.They honestly promised something they didn't deliver. A real shame because the base is there, I hope they fix it or improve it, but I doubt it.If there was a scoring system I would give it a 6. but since it does not exist it is negative but the CDP lies and the promises that they did not keep.Si quieren un juego de ROL, y las promesas que nos dijo CDP en el 2017 , de elegir de ser lo que queramos , olvídense.Es un juego de acción de mundo abierto y nadas mas.Los tres trasfondos inservibles, solo cambian diálogos,  olvídense de ser de Arasaka  y ser un empresario diabólico tipo señor Burns , elijan el trasfondo que elijan , terminan siendo un mercenario , no hay opción de unirse a ninguna facción de las que hay en el juego, que es lo que prometió CDP .Cuando hablamos de RPG o ROL es la opción de poder interpretar el ROL de algo,   ejemplo , ser policía, medico , militech , Arasaka,  Malestrom , Sector 6 , Triadas , etc.No podes ser nada de eso , no podes unirte a ninguna facción ,  no podes ser malo, o  me hubiera gustado ser de arasaka y usar agentes durmientes o espías para destruir a otra compañía ,   no podes unirte a la policía y poder ser agente de policía,  no podes unirte a militech .O sea de ROL no tiene nada ,   terminas siendo un mercenario , conoces a Jackie, luego a NEO o  Kanue Reves, guiños de matrix,  y un juego lineal en lo que se refiere a la historia. Una verdadera lastima , porque la base esta .Me hubiese encantado poder se de Malestrom, y convertirme en un cyborg y hacer misiones para ellos, como secuestrar personas para robarles sus implantes y venderlos en el mercado negro ,  o poder unirte a Militech e ir haciendo misiones para ellos y ascender de rango ,  o poder ser los médicos que van armados ,  o alguna opción de ROL. Darnos la opción de ser malos e intervenir en las decisiones del a historia.  Ni hablar de  todo el contenido que cortaron y las promesas que nunca cumplieron .El problema no son los bugs , sino lo  anteriormente redactado .Los gráficos y la parte artística son un espectáculo , pero se nota que en cada parche o update se centran mas en el Ray Tracing y en el DLSS,  se nota que les interesa mas vender mas Nvidia RTX que mejorar el juego. Tema armas muy pocas,  no hay opción de personalización como prometieron , muy nulo , solo miras  y algun silenciador.No se puede modificar los cargadores para ampliar la capacidad de munición , no se puede modificar los cañones de las armas par mejorar el alcance o daño , no se puede modificar culatas ni nada,   mue hubiera gustado un sistema similar al del Pay Day 2.  Lo único que se puede hacer es mejorar las STATS,  y en variedad de armas pocas, cambian los colores, y alguna variación nada mas .El sonido excelente , como la ambientación , sonido de armas etc. Los autos el manejo un desastre ,  podes comprar autos , pero no se pueden modificar como prometieron .Hay partes del mapa que nunca se terminaron , ni hablar el sistema de metro que prometieron , se nota que en el desarrollo del juego paso algo , una lastima .Tema de misiones secundarias son entretenidas mas que la historia principal.Las actividades muy repetitivas.   Honestamente prometieron algo que no cumplieron.   Una verdadera lastima porque la base esta , espero que lo arreglen o lo mejoren, pero lo dudo. Si hubiera un sistema de puntuación le pondría un 6 . pero como no existe es negativo pero las mentiras de CDP y las promesas que no cumplieron .

review: undercooked.

author: mretsam
review: Revised Review:I enjoy the game overall.  It's really enjoyable, has a great story line and the graphics are top notch.  I am playing on an AMD 5950x and EVGA 3090 FTW3 Ultra, so I can play with all the settings maxed out, however, I don't hit 60FPS(I'm at roughly 40-45 FPS but to me that's playable and I'm happy to play as such).  While everyone might not have the hardware to play at the highest settings just remember to update your graphic cards as Nvidia and AMD both released brand new drivers right before release, and it substantially helps performance for many.  With that said the game needs optimization focus updates to help make sure those without beefy hardware can enjoy the game on higher settings.The game play very much like a Elder Scrolls/Fallout Game.  The way the first person mode is, the combat, the upgrade system and weapon customization system all feel alike.  To me I like this as it helps with familiarity, but I can understand where this may turn away games.  There's unlimited combinations on what you can upgrade.  Weapons, clothing, armor, ammo, just about everything serves a purpose in this game which is great!A downfall is I wish the game offered a better tutorial system and that was interactive and part of the game progression instead of what we get now which is going to a certain area and click to participate in the tutorial.  Now this should be optional for those who are going through multiple play through's so you don't have to go through the motions each time you play.  When I say interactive, I would like the game to teach you fighting while you fight actual enemies, sneaking and killing/disabling enemies as part of the story line and the rest of the options that come with the tutorial.  This is would help new players a better feel for the game, and it would offer veterans to pass through the game without going through it multiple times.I'll add more to review as I go along so this will be a work in progress.l  This definitely a great game and I do recommend getting it.  Just be prepared for hardware issues, because it's definitely an outstanding game.

author: Suis "Matasaburo"
review: Before release I thought that this game would have a feel like GTA, Watch Dogs, or similar open world games, but after playing it for some reason I feel like I'm playing The Witcher of the future. This game presents very good gameplay and is also fun with good music and story that makes me want to cry because the presentation of the ending is very good.Initially, this game had a lot of bugs and glitches that occurred because the game was still immature and optimized, but since it's been through a lot of patch updates, you have to try this game now! you will be impressed with the final result of this game.

author: Scribbletist
review: While I don't recommend it, I would be open to "buy it when it's on sale" being the real judgement.Sometimes the game is fun, but I'm not sure how after a year of updates and patches, the game runs even worse for me.The Good list: • You can now craft multiple items in stacks instead of one at a time.• Clothing is more diverse in styles.The Bad list:• Pop-ins• Cut scene models out of place• Being aggro'd by enemies from behind walls and well outside of their sight range• T-posing• Acrobatic corpses that perform flips in place long after dying• Bloom drowning out everything after un-pausing the game• Guns flickering• Color of guns in menu not reflecting their in-game models once equipped• The game outright crashingThis is a year later. A year of supposed development and polish to sort out the bugs. No changes to my hardware. The only changes would be OS updates to Windows 10 and that doesn't justify that I am effectively playing a less reliable game than when it was initially released.

author: ox_7:// #1
review: After finishing the game i have decided to write this short review.ive got to say the graphics, writing, the acting and the facial animations in this game are absolutely awesome. talking to (most) npsc feels realistic. the gun- and swordplay are both great and so is the hacking in my opinion.all in all the game is great and i would love to give a positive review but i cant, not in its current state.the performance gets worse the longer you play. you have to restart the game to make it run more smoothly in densely populated areas (even on a decent rig (my specs are on my profile if youre interested)). all the t-posing npcs, flying cars, random explosions, items that get stuck under the map and overlapping npcs on the phone completely throw you out of the game. the sheer amount of bugs and glitches is just unacceptable for a fully released game.Cyberpunk 2077 is a beta of a great game.edit: its been a few months since the release and i still wouldnt recommend it.the performance still needs a lot of work, the police system is still absolute garbage and you still cant become a crazy augmented cyborg like the maelstrom gang.we'll see in about 60 years when the game comes out of alpha.CDPR you people are scumbags, lying and manipulative cashgrabbers.

author: ElbruzOne
review: - Millions of bugs.- A lot of assets are loading at 5m away from you, even though "LOD" is on max and game is on SSD.- Terrible optimization.And that's 2020 game, that was in development for over 8 years?Don't wake the f**k up until they fix the game, Samurai.UPD: - The stupidest ever AI in AAA open world game: * Nobody even tries to flank you in combat, enemies are stupid AF * Crowd on the streets don't react to other AI's shooting, fighting, but if you will punch someone, the whole block will scream and run * Have you seen at least one police chase in the game that is not scripted? Neither did I or anybody else. Because there is no AI in this game for driving. You know how police tries to keep up with you, while you're driving? They are teleporting right behind your back. Moreover, all the cars on roads only move along the scripted paths, so if you'll stay in front of any car or block the road, they won't even try to find another way — they'll just stop and wait until you leave.- Terrible UI. It's just that. - World sucks. It's dead. Nothing happens in it other than shootings between 2 gangs.- Hacking sucks as well. Great budget on marketing, very small budget for an actual game. People are complaining about lots of bugs, but when they'll fix those, you'll be left with the game, which is unfinished on so many levels, that it's just unbearable.

review: Just speechless. These two words only.

author: Hielke
review: Can't push myself to play more of this. Cyberpunk's world is beautiful, yet feels so empty. Why is there no metro system? Why are there flying cars when I can't drive them? Why are there no police chases and spawns the police 20 meters away from you instead? Why can't you go into most of the shops? Why can't you buy stuff from the existing shops? Why are there no random encounters? Why is Pacifica only half built? Why are the physics SO bad??Really expected more from CDPR. Such a let down. Hope they will fix it, but I don't have much hope. There's simply too much to fix.

author: Lonely Knightess
review: It's not great.It's not , it's not great. The problem is, CDPR marketed it as the second coming and while on a point by point basis it looks like it's there, most of it feels incredibly bland and like it was put there just to fill out a marketing point. If it was just some game I was playing I'd give it a recc because it's not unenjoyable, but since I feel the need to judge it over what people expected and what they see then I have to caution that it's one of those game's that when you list out the features and look at the screenshots you'll probably be misled.This isn't a comment on the unacceptable amount of bugs or the honestly disgusting release of the console ports. I also didn't go in with sky high expectations or follow it religiously like some people. I like the Witcher series a lot, and while I think CDPR as a company is extremely scummy I don't consider myself a hater on their games or anything, likewise I'm not a fanboy. This is fitting, because CP2077 is one of the most whelming games I've played in a long time.Hacking is incredibly bland and barebones, the skilltree does almost nothing besides give equally bland and incremental stat boosts, and the conversation system is the same exact 'press X to end at point Z, press Y to end at point Z but snarkier,  press the other buttons to get a line of useless dialogue before pressing X or Y' ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ that masquerades as conversation options elsewhere. This isn't necessarily a deal breaker, but when the game was marketed as a huge branching narrative filled with unknowns and a story you craft yourself, it's insanity that somehow  gave deeper dialogue options.The prologues were nonsense, marketed as these huge world shaking stories that completely changed your character and added a ton of replayability when in actuality they're just five minute setpieces before you're dropped in the same place as the others and given a dialogue option once an hour that serves no real purpose besides bypassing a skill check you could probably pass anyway. While marketed as being on the level of those seen in Dragon Age: Origins, they're not. It's also painfully obvious that the Streets origin was given so much more detail so that when reviewers were forced to only play that one, it'd make it look far more important than it is. Corp and Nomad origins are so underbaked it's actually insulting.Night City itself is big and pretty and expansive, and remains interesting for several minutes before you start seeing the glaring flaws and the glaring hole where the living breathing world that CDPR assured everyone would be there should be. NPCs are the same budget 'spew random dialogue when clicked on then replay animation' stock you see in literally every somewhat open world video game. They don't have any sort of life cycle, they will sit there and play the same animation and say the same line literally every time you walk past forever. This would just be one more mark of 'meh' to the game, if it wasn't for the fact that, yet again, CDPR constantly marketed this. And I know this all just sounds like pedantry, but my point is that were promised stars and the moon with the game and it's just not that. It's an action shooter with some dialogue. The dialogue isn't bad, when the cutscenes actually work they're enjoyable, I like some of the characters. Like I said, I'm not particularly underwhelmed, I'm just whelmed. There's no huge massive glaring problems (besides the bugs and how misleading CDPR were), the game just is. It's what you expect from a huge multi-billion dollar company's multi-million dollar project that was made by committee. Ironically, it, the marketing campaign, and how CDPR runs itself all feels like more of a satire of the game's soulless and scummy mega corporations than the game's own half-assed attempts at conveying a message. Which I could start a whole other diatribe on (how little attempt the game actually makes to say anything about its world or raise any interesting questions) but won't to scavenge some form of brevity from this.To cap it off, CDPR made a game. It's not a bad game, it's just a game. It probably won't blow your mind, and if you have seen any of the marketing material for it then yes it was probably built in a way to intentionally mislead you on what that game will be. Features aren't there, those that are feel like they were put there just to check boxes, characters sold to you for dozens of videos and prerelease stuff will die within thirty minutes of meeting them, those that stick around will do nothing besides shoot out five seconds of dialogue before sending you on yet another 'kill people in area' mission. It's a game.I have to assume, just from the dev time of the project, the result, and how absolutely scuffed it is, that CDPR has serious management issues. The whole project reeks of either having been restarted multiple times or having constantly changed directions and had features torn out or tossed in with no real direction. I don't think the people at CDPR are bad or that they're bad at their jobs, I just think as a company they might be in some form ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ incompetent. And I say ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ with the least malice and anger possible, because anger would imply CB2077 makes me feel anything, and despite CDPR telling us:"Do you want a game that's an eight or nine... or a ten?""I suspect the story will leave you an emotional wreck""Okay, we get it, Witcher was good, but boy, when Cyberpunk drops, these top RPGs lists will be shuffled..."It's just another game.But hey, can't wait for multiplayer and the cosmetic microtransactions!!!--Right my opinion largely hasn't changed. Just about to finish the story, have done most of the sidequests. People will say if I threw so much time and effort into it then it must have been worth the cost, but honestly I was bored and I didn't want to critique the game without having actually seen what it all had to offer. Also really  to enjoy it because it is almost my type of game, but it's just not really happening.For my own sanity, I decided to list out everything that comes to mind that eats at my brain because there's a ♥♥♥♥ ton of things that bother me that's not often talked about (yet). RAN OUTA SPAC

author: Variks The Loyal
review: Variks did not engage in the pre-launch hype for Cyberpunk, so Variks had no expectations to have been let down yeeees? And in my experience there were only a few bug for the Scribe of House Judgement to encounter... but all know of the legends of old that speak of almost unplayable game play: so be weary. For those willing to venture; Variks recommends purchasing Cyberpunk 2077 (Bug-like chattering). A great atmosphere, excellent game play with a great story line and a utterly beautiful city make it worth it to Variks. See you in Night City Guardian

author: Axxxel
review: Great game. Didn't have the best launch, can get buggy occasionally and doesn't run particularly well at the moment unless you have good specs which I thankfully did when I played it. The City is mindbogglingly detailed. The characters and their stories are well written and will keep you interested all the way through. Kickass music too. I recommend playing it but I also recommend waiting a few months until it gets updated to run better.

author: Garoo Sama
review: It shows when all NPCs react the same way to gun fire: crouch in fear. No one pulls out a gun and no one runs away. Moreover, they all walk in pre-determined paths. If you try to block their path, they turn 180 degree and walk to the other direction along the same path, instead of moving around the obstacle. NPCs are mindless puppets that don't react to you stealing their stuff. Even if you steal a non-aggrod enemy's fancy car in front of them, they would be cool with it. Weak AI affects other aspects of the game as well. Player gets reported for crimes that have no witnesses, and police spawns out of nowhere behind you. Running away from them is easy, just sprint 200 meters in one direction and they're gone. Easier done with a car, as there are no police chases in this game. At this point I wish CDPR prevented killing NPCs and cancelled the whole police bounty system. You can get insane damage numbers if you know where to spend your points in the tree and what weapon to use.

review: It's buggy as all hell but for me personally, none of the bugs have been game breaking. Quite humorous actually. Story is deep, some of the side missions are better than the main missions. Lots of loot, crafting options and build opportunities.

author: Echo
review: Ive been meaning to write this review for a long time, but i cant deny i had a hard time forming a real opinion about this game. Its not bad, but its also not good. And thats what makes this so difficult. I love Cyberpunk, the story, the characters, the aesthetics, the music, the overall feel night city gives you, and yet all these good aspects about the game get overshadowed by all its flaws. Cars that dont render, enemies and AI that simply dont work, constant crashes. And its such a crying shame really. And yet, if we ignore all of these obvious flaws the game comes with, whats left really is such a beautiful piece of art. Im being completely honest when i say that no other game ive ever played in my long gaming career has left me feeling the way this game did. I chose to start the game as a nomad, an outsider, someone with big dreams, but little knowledge of reality. The same way a player starts a game, as a newbie really. And from the moment you set foot in the city, you see all it in all its lights. A beautiful city, with so many colorfull different people, opportunities and cultures. But behind it all hides a dark reality that isnt too much different from our world, or a world we might sooner or later live in. Now im not going to go deeper into each character, mission or overall storyline of the game. But if you are able to look beyond all the bugs and issues the game has, you will be left with something truly beautiful. You get sucked into this world, and i feel like you can never truly leave it again. Judy, River, Johnny, Panam, and at the end even you, V, a character that starts out as a clean canvas, that slowly but steadily becomes a version of you, but in the game. Sure not all choices you make have as much an impact, but they are still there. You still said all these things to the characters, and even if they might not have any immediate consequenzes, u still get the feeling inside you that they have an impact. A character might forget that you yelled at them because it fits the story, but you wont forget it. If you truly immerse yourself into the world, become V, you really can form  bonds with some of the characters. And to this day, long after finishing the game a second time already, i still look back at it, and feel the need to do it all over again, to go into Night City, say hi to all the people u left behind, see what they are up to, even just taking some car, turning on your fav radio station, and going for a ride becomes more than you could have propably imagined before starting the game. As a side note i want to add just how beautiful the ingame soundtracks are. Not the radio, but the background music you get during cut scenes, or certain conversations/missions. It really makes everything a million times more beautiful and emotional. Even now i often find myself listening to hour long versions of some of the soundtracks ingame when im feeling emotional or having a bad day.I know im not good at writing reviews, and this really isnt much a review, rather me rambling on about how i feel about this game, that has taken a very special spot in my heart. If you feel similar about some things, feel free to write a comment or add me, so we can talk about it :) If not, feel free to tell me how none of this made any sense, and how bad my english is, because for some reason many people like to do that on here.Cyberpunk really isnt just a game, its an experience, like a movie, that you are part of. It shows just how small and insignificant we really are in the grand scheme of things and yet are still able to find happiness in life, if we allow it to enter. Not in things like money, cars or sex (okay maybe a little sex lol xD) but in other things, friends, family. Because at the end, thats the only thing V has left, all the fame will dissapear, the money too, but the friends made along the way are what stays, and they give you a reason to keep fighting, even when all your other dreams and goals are shattered.As Johnny would say: "Never stop fighting V"

My original plan was to complete the game – at least the main story – without rushing before I sat down and wrote a review. I wanted it to be fair, to not nag on the bugs and the constant issues that seem to plague the game – they can be fixed. The Witcher III is proof that a buggy, mess of a game can be made great. People forget that game was Skyrim levels of bad. I mean, it was probably worse than Fallout 76.However, I soon realised that finishing the game would not change my review. The story, whether it remains as great as it is or nosedives, would not change my recommendation at all. Heck, I would not even blink.Believe it or not, my issue is the core design of the game. The fact that CD PROJEKT RED sit there and actually call this game an RPG is a slap in the face. It is an action-adventure game with elements of an RPG. It has a small crafting system, a limiting clothing system, and a deprecated and defunct weight system that has no place in a single-player videogame. I guess the developers realised this as they no longer call the game an RPG. Seriously. There are very few games that make me think, ‘Yeah, this is an RPG’ while playing. Really, it has pretty much the same system as The Division and no one clamoured over that – bullet sponges included.I want to mull some things over and debate their usefulness in the game.1) Genital Customisation – what was the point? Seriously?Speaking for men here. You see the wang in character creation, you see it in the menu when you remove the clothes (speaking of which, remember when the developers said there would be a wardrobe and not a menu inventory?) and that. Is. All. It is pointless. Like, I did not play this game to stare and drool over pixel penises, nor did I buy it and expect a substitute for pornography. However, they made a system, spent time actually implementing it, used it as some kind of pitch, and then created it. And for what? It appears nowhere, it has no impact on dialogue or the story, no one comments on it. No banter or shaming because you chose ‘small’. No awed noises when people see the ‘big’ option. No one cares whether you are cut or uncut. You take off all your clothes in the world, the game gives you bland underwear. In cutscenes, when V is showering, you are in clothes or in underwear. Was the penis added solely as a selling factor, another Rust or Conan Exiles? The wang is rare in media and people seem to find it memey when one is visible. My plan of a nudist V that wields nothing but a katana and has insane hacking skill is out the window. What is the point in slicing people up with a katana if my girthy meat is not flapping around?2) Character CustomisationPointless. You do not go for style like what was said. It does not matter at all. You will wear the booty shorts with a fedora because it has 2 armour more than the military trousers. You will wear heels over basic runners because, as above, they have better defence. My V looks atrocious because I am playing on the hardest difficulty and one small armour point is the difference between dying and coming out on top. The funny thing is, I would not care about this if there was a glamour system in-game. So I can keep the outfit I like but use the stats of other gear. Likewise, the ripperdocs change some aspects of your body, but what if I wanted my V to lose an arm and have to use a fake arm, like what a lot of people have? Where is the ‘cool’ factor? Glowing eyes, golden skin, chrome? It is all missing. The worst offender is you cannot change your hair once you start. Like, once your character gets better, you still look like you did at the start. I started as a scruffy nomad, but now my V is rich. Still have a wack beard and wild hair.3) DialoguePointless. It changes very little, it feels so very slanted, and anything in blue is a waste of time. A character will go from a passionate speech, full of anger, to a soft, “Yeah, we should do that. You are right” within the span of one second. Everyone is so hot and cold due to the weird dialogue. It feels like an intern delivering coffee wrote half of it and a professional screenwriter wrote the other half.-Onto some pluses, so I can actually not feel like I am crapping on a game that deserves some praise.When the writing is good, it is good. Some of the best writing of the decade. The quests are fun, immersive, and forge a connection to characters (when the writing of them is good). The game plays great and has better hacking than Watch Dogs. Characters feel realistic and have motives that are not screamed at you. There are emotional moments that will make you want to listen. This game will be great when the DLC is rolled out. I can assure that due to the loving care the developers show. As a baseline, it is the same spot as Witcher III when it released – if you have forgotten, go look at launch reviews and Reddit. It was a straight massacre. Everyone was livid.

author: IndigoJulze
review: If you are reading this and have not played the game yet congratulations. You know that playing any game Day 1 is a mistake. Specifically one that was delayed 3 times.This game is amazing. At this point the game runs fine, has plenty of things to do and is a dream to play.Gameplay: 9/10Voice Acting: 9/10Combat / Action: 10/10Graphics: 8/10And if you are considering getting this game on console? Don't.

author: artist.cz
review: Replay was way more fun than the first run. Most bugs were fixed, story is superb, city is still retarded as ever, 9/10. When CDpr. fix the AI of police and ppl living in the city, it will be a perfect game, as far as I am concerned.

author: SM
review: I came back about a year after almost finishing this game and the launch was disappointingBut I really enjoyed her world, the story, the characters, etc, especially the lovely Judy ;) ( 9/10 ⭐)📷👇

author: OrlandoTheOwl
review: I think now, over a year later, this game is 100% worth picking up. I pre ordered this game and played it on launch and did like it but the list of problems was huge. Tons pf bugs, horrible fps problems, enemy ai issues, economy and skill tree issues, etc. I personally dealt with very large fps drops running on a 2080 super, npcs walking through walls, and some type of bug or bad visual glitch about every 30 minutes.I knew this game was going to be great eventually and I can finally say that is the case. Going back and playing it now after all the fixes they implemented is a totally knew experience. I played through the whole game and in 50 more hours of play I only counted one bug that took me out of the experience. They fixed the skill tree and made the in game economy much better. The game still doesnt run the best fps but it sits probably 20 frames higher than before and is much more stable. They pretty much did everything that should have been done at release plus more, and I think if you like this kind of game its a very good buy now even at full price.

author: Markux
review: Despite game bugs, basic AI, awful police and traffic system, and no cosmetic system (no hair stylists or tattoo artists, etc.) I loved every minute of it. Devs put o lot of love into this game with an amazing story, interesting side missions, memorable characters, and a ton of easter eggs and references. The devs definitely needed more time to finish the game but the people running the company gave devs impossible deadlines so the game released in an unfinished state. I just hope cdpr won't release any paid dlc and multiplayer without fixing all the problems and adding missing features because then they definitely will kill all reputation that has left...

author: NinjaPork
review: Just another game in the long line of hype,cash grab games that get released at a financially beneficial time much to the detriment of the game and the industry.The game pretty much doesn't deliver anything it promised at the level described ,i hate to say it but at this point i think its time we had regulation within the gaming industry ,its clear to see over the many years this has been going on that the industry is now lead by greed,bait and switch shady tactics,and  and so forth ,its sad but these companies simply cant be trusted not to lie and screw the consumer ,this isn't news yet it still continues to become a larger problem in our hobby ,clearly pointing to needing a intervention by a outside power .cd project red have  rightfully ruined there reputation and will see no money from me again ,all whilist criticising and shaming others for the exact same scummy behaviour ...Maybe buy if bored and on a huge discount ,otherwise dont waste your money buying this below average bland product and supporting another garbage company and its practises .

author: CrushIce
review: I must preface beforehand I have a decent spec'd computer which is able to play the game very well and as of writing this review I have ~50 hours played based on steam's playtime. If there is a phrase I could use to summarize the game it would probably be .Cyberpunk 2077 was originally announced 8 years ago and the hype around the game was through the roof. Everyone couldn't wait to see the next big game CDPR was going to create after the overwhelming success of The Witcher 3, and it would be this same success which would ultimately lead to their biggest disappointment.Every bit of news that revealed anything about the game was like bits of crack for the general public to get high on. We had reveals of a large open world rpg set in the futuristic city, Night City, bustling with 1000's of unique AI, a "wanted" system with corrupt police officers that could be bribed, an immersive combat system with multiple methods of taking down your foes, a unique hacking system that gave you access to various intel on the world around you, a litany of quests that had a meaningful impact on your playthrough depending on the choices you made, an extensive character customization unlike anything we've seen before, and at the heart of it all is you, the player character, "V".You are supposed to play as "V", who is an everyday bloke that has dreams of making it big one day and to strive towards their goal, they take on jobs from "fixers" that have them doing all sorts of tasks and activities.  The more jobs you complete the well known you become on the streets and at some point big corporations would take notice. Whether they were beneficial to you or not was dependent on your choices in the game and your unique playstyle. After 8 years of development with multiple delays to the release I can tell you the only thing that is remotely close to what was promised is the fact that the map is called Night City. The game feels like a hollow shell of what was advertised and makes you wonder what was being done during development. The AI feels like something from a game 2 decades ago. The world is depressingly empty to the point its like playing in the same universe as Will Smith's "I am Legend". The AI that inhabit the world are all cookie cutter walking/talking npc's with no interactions whatsoever. The wanted system is essentially non-existent and the police AI literally teleports behind you in droves until you are either dead or managed to run across the block to drop your wanted status. The combat system is generic as shooters go, you shoot/pummel/slice someone to death and you rinse and repeat, the only difference is how the bullets come out of your gun. The hacking system is disappointingly shallow, where all you need to do is point and click to "hack" something for a miniscule advantage. The choices you make in quests have no impact whatsoever to the world around you and you are essentially given the illusion of free will. And the character customization is probably the most pointless thing in the game since the game is played in "first person" and you don't even see yourself in cutscenes. This is just a small snippet of things that were changed or is outright missing from the initial reveal to it's eventual release. I haven't even mentioned the vast amount of bugs in the game and unpolished feel the game has. If you have a beefy PC then you can count yourself "lucky" to be able to "play" the game. If you are playing this on a next gen console then the game is somewhat playable and if you are the unlucky few playing on base current gen consoles, then I am truly sorry for your experience. The huge amount of issues the game has at its current state and the vast of fundamental changes or cut to content makes you feel like what was advertised and what was delivered are two completely different products, and this is what is truly sad. The game's story is actually very nice and makes you want to keep playing just to know what happens next, and the side quests given to you by some of the unique npc's are pretty deep and you can tell that CDPR put time into the development of said quests. Outside of the few positive things about the game, you can't just help it but think about  for Cyberpunk 2077.The success of TW3 gave CDPR huge renown which led to expectations for this game to reach astronomical levels, and just like Icarus, CDPR flew too close to the sun. Hopefully over the course of the next year CDPR fixes the core issues with the game and implements some of the main missing features, but as it stands even though I am enjoying my experience with game, I cannot recommend the game in its current state. If you want to play an immersive open world game, go play Red Dead Redemption 2.If you want to play a futuristic, sci-fi, cyberpunk game, go play Deus Ex Human Revolution/Mankind Divided.If you want to play a game with tons of character customization and sex-capades, go play Saints Row the Third.

author: steelgoldfish22
review: it will never be as good as it should have been.

author: Purpleetea
review: Cyberpunk 2077 was meant to be chosen one in so many ways and become groundbreaking revolutionized Deux Ex brother. From the first anounced trailer the wait was so long and real. This is like waiting for Saint to come from heaven and save us all but for what cost. I wish I could shout I wish I could say to every gamer go try this masterpiece. So beautiful and yet so broken, so promissing an yet so shallow in some ways. There is no silver lining. You need to dig up so much dirt to find this diamond. If you stick up there are things to see stories to live and lore to hug. Cyberpunk 2077 is futuristic amazing bladerunner world in many ways. Night city looks beautiful and dense. Every corner every street looks different and interesting in many ways. You will meet some of the most interesting and charming characters here. From best friend Jakie to lovely tech genius Judy. Only shame they introduce some of them here and immediately get rid of them really quickly. Wasted opportunity. Main story feels different from other sci fy games and never stops to suprise you. There are no other games that let you play as John Wick in its fullest glory. Sadly this is not another Witcher 3 situation. I felt like I didnt have meaninful impact in story choices. You think you chosing different path but game is fooling you to think that. There is no other choice there is only one choice no matter what you say mostly. At the end you will have this option but only by chosing your ending. Which is really sad. I miss that greatly like was in witcher 3. The lore of cyberpunk keeps givining and giving. So many stuff to read and see. Cyberengineering and revolutionizing your body modifications feels like real stuff. You can modiffy many parts or just stay as far as possible from becoming robot freak. Developers gave you so much options to play this game. You can go full silent with mantus blades, or you can go full blazing with guns and katanas. They made me feel like real cyborg ninja and it was most amazing thing. Sadly the gameplay experience was ruined by bad npc AI and removed some of the features like Wanted system and corrupt police. The scrapped a lot of vision from this title. Some of the enemies gliched out and some of the boss battles were corrupted by bugs. Not all of them but had some good fights to. At the end of a day I had tons of fun. But we will remember this game as a bad launch sadly. This shows only one thing that corpo suits ruing gaming world. The most ironic thing that you playing as V who go against those corpo suits and want to take them down. Time will pass and devs will fix these things im sure of it. But good will was destroyed and I hope CD Project Red will rise again like fenix. Wait one year for them to fix this game.

author: storM
review: Completely fulfills my expectations.

author: ns_blazer_1979
review: Was a great game and played well on my PC until the latest patch , now crashes at start up so it is unplayable.

author: Just_Ryan
review: A few bugs but nothing game breaking so far. Game is quite tough on the graphics card, DLSS is a must for those who play on 4k. Other than that, it was exactly what I expected. Good combat, decent driving, story is engaging so far 8hrs in, graphics is great. Got nothin to complain about other than the bugs which I believe will be sorted out with time anyways.

author: 🥀cyb̾eяgơȶhiкa
review: Lets organize things here. Cyb77 had 6 dimensions I have never seen before within the same game;1- Insiduous; Due multiple development issues, they had to chop the whole idea into short linear scripts. It has transformed the dream and the promisses of choices and consequences into a ride-the-train and shut up condition.2- Abominable; The A.I. and police behavior were unnaceptable, unused maps area, lifeless outside scripts, too many bugs blurred the technical debts even worse than bugs, etc. etc.3- Awful; Medium important things, such as lack of more random events and lack of open-world features. 4- Reasonable; Things that were just badly done, but they helped immersion anyway. Such as bugged TV channels that never cycles right or just a single mini-game. 5- Good things; Music both collection radios and general, guns got good design and creativity, art-design isn't always original but still is very pretty, city modelling is just right, RPG book adaptation has also good fidelity.6- Fantastical; Story made me speechless first time I played and still impresses me today, dialog was written by people who knows how life works, art direction is state-of-the-art, characters psychology has unique sophistication, immersion is near-perfection.If you do not face the reality of these 6 dimensions, you're not being realistic. You may be suffering the fanboy condition or the hater condition. Find a cure for either of these 2 spectrum, so Cyb77 phenomena never happens again. If you accept it all, you'll doom future unfinished games that expects your easy acceptance. But if you hate it mindlessly, you'll help corporations to keep inducing our community. The only way is to be smart, pay attention, face the reality as it is. It is time to move on, but I'm not going to forget it. I will always ask for accountability where it is due and you should do too.To be honest, the game is better only if you compare to the release disgrace, but far away from any promises they made that will never be implemented. Sadly for me, I can't unsee all that. But in regards to bugs, it is way better.But bugs aren't just the problem, there is the terrible technical debts.Technical debts in programming is when you don't finish lots of things and they feel loose, some looks like an illusion, like building a staircase that leads to nowhere, but you leave a sign "up" anyway just to pretend it goes to the second floor. Sadly this game is plagued by debts, it is pretty much in everything, everywhere. I deleted my first review that was overly positive, it granted me some points from players that I don't think I deserve and now I feel horrible. I deleted it to make it more mature, tell the truth of why I loved the game. I had to delete it AGAIN for the second time and write this one, more in pair with reality. I was blind due my first impression on the story. I will disappoint a lot of friends. So I'm sorry, didn't want to get in the hate train but that's how this works. They screw us, sometimes we take some time to see it, but then there is the consequence.This patch made me angry because it helped me see what I couldn't see December 2020. I will only accept Cyberpunk to its full extent after the full extention of CDPR own words. As for now I'm done with it and I feel ridiculous, it toke me 3 months to see this thing is broken and I was lied to accept a rushed pile of bad programming.When I played TES IV: Oblivion ages ago, I never had the feeling I needed any mod to play it.Only after finishing it and having one of the greatest gaming experience of my life, I saw some mods in sites like the Nexus and I loved them - it was optional, non-essential, done for the pleasure of it. That's what mods should be for and their ultimate goal. But when Skyrim came out it was a totally different thing. Game felt empty in many aspects, lacking many things I deem essential - like a game set in a snowy mountain without footsteps sprites, and no decent coats or robes. Ugly looking armor, even the graphics were unpleasant. I had to overly mod Skyrim to the extreme, to fill the many thousands of lacunes left by Bethesda.I believe we did more harm than anything, developers gets used to it. Deliver poorly executed games with great advertising, then let the fans do the rest. That's not how this works dude. I paid for your promisses, then deliver it. If you enjoyed this review, follow my curator's page

author: Yagiz

author: Lufty
review: The game is a mile wide, but it's only an inch deep. Not only did CDPR blatantly lie and deceive the public, but they just spent the last year fixing the game. The game appears to be about 50% complete, as most anything in the game shows obvious signs of being rushed, pruned, or removed entirely.Do not believe this new flood of positivity coming from people that have no clue just how awful this game's launch and last year have been and bought it from a bin for $10 at Target. Meanwhile, us fans have waited nearly a decade for this, only to be given a mess of a game years off being ready and devoid of nearly all public promises made.CDPR are liars and have zero credibility or good graces after this monumental and historical disaster that will have implications in the gaming industry for years to come. STAY AWAY, put your money towards far better games that are polished, bug free, and ready to be purchased.

author: rafian_hernanda
review: I've played this game for more than 130 hours, I've finished all the main jobs, side jobs, gigs, NCPS scanner hustles and and I happen to get a good ending. What is lacking from this game after the end is that there is nothing more to do in the game, then after finishing we return to the main job "NOCTURNE OP55N1". I understand the purpose of returning to the main job "NOCTURNE OP55N1" is to get an alternative ending to this game, but in my opinion it is better to give the "New Game +" feature because we can play this game again from the start but we still have skills, money, inventory, and fast travel that we got from the previous game play. "New Game +" is still better than going back to main jobs "NOCTURNE OP55N1" because it can correct our mistakes when choosing decisions on main jobs and side jobs conversations. For example: I made the wrong choice at the beginning of the game so I couldn't get Jackie Welles' weapon. And I also made the wrong choice while running Judy Alvarez's side jobs so I didn't get a romantic scene with Judy T_T. I want to restart this game but if I have to repeat from 0 it will waste a lot of my time, that's why I wish there was a "New Game +" in this game. "New Game +" can also increase the play time in this game. Please add the buy property feature so we can buy a new house / apartment. And also add the custom vehicle (car and motorcycle) feature because when I saw the trailer for this game for the first time, I thought we could modify our vehicle. I hope that in the future bugs and glitches will be fixed soon

author: Relax
review: A few bugs, but all in one. Acceptable game.

author: Walter サリヴァン.༄༽.
