author: G00N3R
review: Cyberpunk 2077 is an open world RPG featuring FPS combat. When player character “V” is hired to steal some tech from the world’s largest corporation, they find themselves in an unusual life threatening situation, while also being drawn into a wider conspiracy.When Cyberpunk originally released in December 2020, it was a buggy, broken mess which disappointed many players who were expecting another masterpiece from CD Projekt (Witcher 3 is still my favourite game of all time).20 months and several patches later, I’m pleased to say that, while the game still has some rough edges, the small bugs that remain didn’t interfere too much with my enjoyment of the story and gameplay.•	Character creator has lots of options to customise the appearance of your version of “V”.•	Main story is good, although it feels a bit short. While it took me 53 hours to complete, I think the majority of that time was spent on side quests.•	There are several interesting NPCs. Obviously the highlight is Johnny Silverhand, played by Keanu Reeves, but there are a few other characters who have lengthy quest chains that I really liked too.•	Voice acting is excellent from the whole cast, and especially Keanu who brings his typical effortless cool style to the role.•	Most side quests have unique and well written short stories, such as investigating the death of the mayor, and helping a cop with a missing persons case. There’s not many examples of the copy and pasted filler content that you find in a lot of open world games.•	First Person Shooter combat is good. You can use a variety of pistols, shotguns, sniper rifles, assault rifles and SMGs, and most feel fun to use. In particular, I really enjoyed the shotguns, which literally knock enemies off their feet and leave them vulnerable to being shot a few more times while laid on the ground.•	If you wanted to try a melee build there are weapons such as katanas and baseball bats.•	Using your cybernetic implants to hack enemies provides more options during combat. In addition to just doing extra damage, you can disable enemy weapons, disable their cyberware (essential against some enemies who can do a speed dodge move which makes them very hard to hit), and take control of sentry turrets.•	You can use stealth to sneak up behind enemies, perform melee takedowns, and hide bodies in containers, Hitman style. Hacking is also useful during the stealth approach as you can disable security cameras and then blind enemies (by hacking their eye implants) or wipe their memory causing them to ignore you.•	Biggest weakness of combat is a lack of enemy variety, as the vast majority are just dudes with guns or melee weapons. Occasionally you’ll encounter enemy netrunners who will hack you (although they seem to only deal damage, they don’t mess with your gear), and there are a small number of drones / robot enemies.•	I didn’t encounter any crashes or framerate issues.•	While I haven’t seen any massively gamebreaking bugs, there are still quite a few minor annoyances. Sometimes snipers would shoot me through walls. They’d be hiding behind cover and I could see their laser sight aiming at me through the cover. Occasionally NPCs were missing frames of animation and they’d kind of glitch into position for the next stage of the quest. I’ve seen an NPC walking around pretending to hold an invisible gun. I had to reload my last autosave when an elevator button wasn’t interactable. During one short quest, an NPC’s dialogue didn’t have any audio (thankfully I had subtitles on). While driving around Night City I prefer to use the third person camera angle, but a couple of times I was locked in first person.If you can accept some occasional small bugs, there’s actually a lot to like about Cyberpunk 2077, which has a well written story, interesting characters, and good FPS combat. However you should definitely wait for a sale.

author: SuZull
review: This game is amazing. The story is awesome. I love the story. All Endings are awesome. Side jobs are too long. I like it. The music is awesome. The graphics are beautiful. The gameplay is great. I do like Cyberpunk! I like this game! I enjoy playing for many hours, but I got a problem with this game. The bug is everywhere. My car disappears and got flip out and glitch out for no reason. Too many bugs and glitches. I can't even complete a job. It's stuck forever because of glitches. Cops spawn nowhere, and I died quickly. I like this game, and it was my favorite, but you guys need to fix some bugs and many issues. Also, I want you guys to make some great physics like other open-world games. I give it like 8/10 because of glitches!

author: Devinchi
review: So far, with the 11 hours that I've played of the game, it's actually been really fun! The hacking is really fun and satisfying, and there are some really great moments in between where you feel like a detective. The gun play itself is fine, but I wish that there was more of an obvious notification of taking damage. One thing that has stood out to me most is the fact that I have been able to complete side quests and then use that information as leeway for parts of the main quest. I've never seen any game do that before, so seeing something like that is truly breathtaking. I'm really liking the characters and the story so far! The game is a bit overwhelming with how much information is thrown at you at once, and yet there are many moments where I had to just figure out how something worked without the game giving me a tutorial. Other than those few things, I've had minimal bugs which have been just comical, and the game itself has been great! Definitely worth the wait for a sale, and even more so after the patches and updates!

author: hidd3n_
review: I remember it was the end of 2020, I had a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ job and was pretty bored with the games I had available at the time. I knew little to nothing about Cyberpunk or the hype that it has created prior to its release, so when I bought the game on their platform, wishful to experience something good, new and fresh, I really went in without any 'grand' expectations.Well, a month later and I had 130 hours in the game, and although there were bugs, stutters, lags and what else playing on my entry level rig, I still was enjoying the game, the world, the gameplay, the story, but most importantly the vibe.I will never forget early in the game, getting in the car with Jackie after the Sandra gig and chilling in the passenger seat as Jackie drove you back home while...... would play in the background (if you know you know 😌).That while you'd marvel at the futuristic setting of Night City from the 'comfort' of your car, witnessing the good and bad of a world gone hell-bent on consumerism, brutalism, capitalism, and expansionism, disregarding public safety and exploiting whatever member of society it could, a glimpse of a possible reality awaiting us in the future if we're willing to let it go there.Still, halfway through the game some story related bugs got to me, so eventually I've put the game down and decided to await the fixes and improvements promised by the dev.About a year or so later I grabbed Cyberpunk on Steam with a neat 50% discount to finally complete the game this time and get all of its achievements.After sinking in another 100+ hours here, completing the entirety of this game and seeing all the endings, all I can say is that I only ended up appreciating the game more, and the near dystopian world CD Projekt was able to present us with.There are quests and questlines that arise some truly interesting questions, and with the rise of AI in our own world, these questions only gain more validity and will once become essential to consider and properly answer.And while the endings are all good in their own right, one or two of them really makes you think about what it means to be human, to be conscious, to know something, to be unsure if something's a distant memory or still a brain worm, to deal with an internal conflict you feel no resolve can be found for.All in all, a great game, the closest you can get in terms of cyberpunk Skyrim with a deeper story. Sadly my score won't be higher since the over promises and buggy launch are aspects that cannot be so simply excused.

author: JonasIV
review: This game is wack, the weirdest experience you might come across. You have people out there who have never experienced a single bug and their game runs perfectly, and then you have others who come across a game-breaking glitch or bug every few minutes. How does this happen?Bugs and oddities aside, I got this game when it came out because my friends said it would be sick, I don't know what the developers promised or said would be in-game so everything I'm about to say is coming from what I liked and disliked about the game. I started playing 6 months after releaseThis game is incredibly short for my tastes, there's only 3 acts and if you only do the main missions you have about 10-ish hours of content. There is alot of side quests, but the vast majority of them are going to a location and either killing/stealing/rescuing some people or an item or car (stealth is optional). Long story short they get repetitive QUICK. When I reached the final mission I was incredibly disappointed and stopped playing for a bit due to how short the actual game is.You have no interaction with the people who give you these side quests, you go near a side quest on the map, they pop up on your screen and say "yo these guys are giving me trouble detes attached". You complete it, they say "thanks v you're cool" and you get a bit of money. There are only a few people that you develop any sort of relationship with and they are so heavily underutilized it hurts. You have this honourable warrior who saved you and wants you to help him in exposing the truth but because the game is so short you have about 4-5 missions with him until the ending comes. You're expected to care about your best friend Jackie because the game tells you to. You meet Jackie when you start up the story, you do your first mission with him and boom the game gives you a short montage of 6 months passing by and now apparently I'm supposed to care about him. Act 1 SHOULD have been those 6 months.I'll stop with the hating and tell you the really good parts. Act 2 is the best part of the game and where I truly had fun, combat is enjoyable for the most part, I used a katana the entire time and despite how many bugs I had using it I still had a great time with it. The few times I used guns were pretty good too. The cybernetics are great, ranging from your generic "increases armour by 20" to giving you double-jump or letting you becoming literally Quicksilver for 8 seconds. It's fantastic. Many ways of going through an objective too, you can hack, stealth, fight with LMG's, sniper rifles, assault rifles, gorilla fists etc. There's a ton of replayability here if the game was much better in everything else.There is a chance this game might get the No Man Sky treatment and get free content updates alongside patches, and if it does, if this game somehow gets a complete overhaul of the story and fixes all its glaring issues, it could easily become one of the best RPG games out there, and I hope to God that happens.There's alot of stuff I didn't include otherwise this review would be insanely long, but TL;DR: This game is great if you like combat with a bit of a decent-enough story. Expect to get more and more disappointed if you think this is a triple-A game.

author: Vanguard [10th BLP]
review: TLDR: People got hyped and blindsighted, scummy yes, but not a reason to bash a very good game. What you get is still fun, you'll enjoy it.Bro, I'll be honest right. I get that a lot of people were sucked into this for a very long while, people went crazy over the promises and went nuts over what was on paper. And better yet it was a well known developer that could have pulled it off, due their reputation. And I completely understand how people feel ♥♥♥♥♥♥ for believing it. However even with that said, I cannot possibly give this game a bad review.If you're still on the fence of where you should buy the game, then listen here.I don't think the stuff that was promised will be all implemented. Maybe some good stuff will eventually with their DLC plans and whatnot, but right now, what you pay for, is still a great game. Call me whatever you want, but I didn't get hyped for this game, I thought it was a good idea when I heard about it ,but I didn't lose my ♥♥♥♥, I tempered my expectations. Perhaps you could say that the fact that I tempered my expectations alone is a bad sign to show where the gaming industry is, where the moment you see a game that seems promise so much, you already know that a lot of the stuff being promised won't be in the final product. But in the end that's how it is, and unfortunately it's not the first time it's happened. Do I think that's bad? Yes. Do I think the work people have put into this should be disregarded and that what's on offer already isn't worth the price of admission? No, and here's why.This game's content, story, visuals, and themes are all, without a doubt, great. I have played many games, and many RPG's, and this is one of the games that I can see myself coming back to to experience it. The city's design alone is fantastic, these guys nailed the cyberpunk aesthetic to a tee and that is worth a lot. The story is also the essence of what being a punk is, wether you accept it or not, and while a lot of people dislike the ending, I for one think it's only fitting for it to end on a note like that. The only problem that I genuinely have with the story, is the pacing device used. The fact that the game constantly reminds you that you have to work as fast as you can to save yourself damages the ability for someone to justify to themselves going out looking for side quests (Which are quite good) on their first run of the game. It constantly left me with a guilty feeling that I should be constantly on the move to find a way to fix the problem. However, it's just an illusion. A very well built illusion, but nothing more than that.Now, let's talk about the bugs! Oh the horror! I know you've seen all these terrible, horrendous bugs and glitches everywhere! Model LOD's not loading in properly! Cars jettisoning into space at mach 20 speeds! Oh my lord however could we recover!Honestly, during my 65 hours of game i've had so far, i've never encountered any of these game breaking bugs. And odds are you won't find them just regularly playing it. What I've found were simple bugs that I'd expect from any new release of an open world game nowadays, small stuff that doesn't impede your progress, or will ruin your game. I have a feeling some of these bugs are being blown out of proportion. Not because they don't happen, they very well could, there's videos for that after all! However when you go online and all you see are these videos showing off all the bugs and problems people find, it's not going to give you an honest representation of the game.Now, before you go and call me a CDPR shill, this is the only game i've ever played from CDPR. And I do have my own problems with the game, but I don't fill they are enough to not warrant a recommendation. Weapon variety is small, you'll find the same model of the same few weapons with a different paint job that somehow shoot harder. Am I saying every gun in game should have their own model? No, I just would have liked to see more weapon designs. Some side quests aren't super interesting, and some side characters seem to be uniquely designed, yet get only used once. And of course, some of the bugs drag down and can break the immersion some times, but like I said, they're nothing you haven't seen before.All in all the game isn't bad. It's quite good actually with all things considered. It'll give you plenty of enjoyment and with the new planned content, yeah, I can see this becoming more fun. The game was rushed to release due to stupid corporate reasoning and that's well documented, but that isn't an excuse to not review something honestly and give it it's due. While the PC version is fine, ps4 still got shafted hard with it's terrible performance. and last gen consoles aren't doing so good with the game in general, but that's neither here nor there, given we're talking about the PC version of the game.My final words: It's a good game, it's not an amazing, revolutionary game, but it's a good game, it has it's problems, but every game does. If you look past that, you'll enjoy the experience, and it'll be worth your time and money.

author: Scuba Steve
review: Equip the smallest penis during character selection, this will give you an early hidden exp boost and will greatly improve your  game due to the ability to unlock more cybernetics faster.

author: Montyote
review: Just play New Vegas

author: Gudrun Schyman
review: Way to much cut content for 8 years of production, where did they spend that time?Enemy AI is poor at best in ranged combat and sometimes cheats to do damage on you for example the melee enemies will sometimes glue themselves on to you if they manage to start a combat animation and if you dodge backwards during that time they will slide together with you. In ranged combat they will oftentimes not do anything at all if you just keep on your feet, it seems like they put all their cards on people shooting from cover because that is the only time you see enemies actually acting.The crowd AI is hilarious, walk into someone like 2-3 times and everyone in the vicinity panics, turn around and suddenly half the crowd is gone, turn back and the rest disappeared. There have been plenty of open world games now with crowds and it seems they took no lessons at all from any of them so expect 1st gen crowd AI with all its hilarity.Balance is nowhere to be seen, from level 1 you get a wallhack and you will be using it alot because xp from completing a mission is to low so most of the time you will go on a murder spree and make sure to go look at all the bodies because if they are still moving enjoy executing defenseless people because that earns you even more xp. Stealth becomes a joke with the included wallhack but that really doesn't matter either because AI is too poor to actually do anything while you indiscriminately kill everyone. If you like gunplay enjoy bumrushing everything because they AI counts on you being a cover shooter and if you just bumrush them it usually fails to do much at all. If you grace a bystander police will teleport right behind you almost instantly and they will keep teleporting until you find a "safe place" to hide which can be hard to find because sometimes they teleport right behind you inside closed rooms so I have no idea where to hide and usually just load a save.They wasted their 18 rating and could have just left the sex out, they plaster all the in game ads with sex and talk about all about the twisted night city but nothing is really ever shown, oh but you get to customize your junk which will never be in any scene and the only place you ever get to see it is if you accidentally sell your pants and check your inventory/mirror.The only reason right now to buy this is if you were waiting for the story or the lore because everything else is either cut out, barely working, unbalanced or broken sadly.

author: Necroniks
review: After a long time it's here! C Y B E R P U N K 2 0 7 7 I waited 8 years to play it! Now here is my honest review after several hours into the game!______________________________________________________________ Fast, Cool and revealing! You start either as a Nomad, Street kid or Corpo. The lifepath will give you unique options later in the game when you talk with NPC'sSPOILER  The Story starts slow and generic but becomes a insane ride with crazy outcomes and twists you didn't see coming! The characters are great designed and have a personality!______________________________________________________________ Sandbox/Open World with a Cyberpunk theme in a detroit like city. Night City is big enough to get lost in it for hours! ______________________________________________________________ Is based of the Cyberpunk Pen and Paper game. The game is full of Quests, E-Books/Emails and NPC conversations that build up the universe. Even the "bad guys" have an intersting lore that makes them human kinda. ______________________________________________________________ Has some minor bugs (Glitching items, NPC's in T-Pose etc.) but nothing that could destroy your savefiles. Gameplay is a mix of Deus Ex, Fallout 4 and GTA V. There is a huge skill tree with a level up system and a crafting mechanic for items (weapons,armor, healthpacks etc.)There are so many ways to play this game and you should really try out everything if you play it the first time!______________________________________________________________ Synthwave, Punk, Rock and more! I really like the soundtrack of the game! Everthing totally fits the cyberpunk theme but also of the world before that. There is als a DMCA free music mode for Streamers and Youtubers.______________________________________________________________This game should be played on PC on max settings! Don't play it on a last gen console for your own sake. The world is absolut beautiful (even more in the night!) I recommend to turn off some settings like "film grain".(Trust me it looks better without it)______________________________________________________________To end my review i can clearly recommend the game. It's not the best game of the world and i know it came a bit too early but it's a must have for every Cyberpunk fan! But please lower your expectations it's just a "good" game and not the holy grail.

author: -L1ch
review: While I haven't beaten Cyberpunk 2077 yet, currently I don't think I can recommend it to most people and I will update my review once I beat it, but currently...Cyberpunk 2077 doesn't really do anything new, almost everything you will do in this game has been done in another game. There is nothing game changing about this game at all. Completely middle of the road and as ride as an ocean but as deep as a puddle. New Vegas is still my favourite RPG, Deus Ex is still the king of Cyberpunk media, and Witcher 3 is still the best CDPR game.I definitely cannot recommend this game to anyone has under a 20-Series card or similar, the performance on even my 3070 is pretty weak at times and my 1070 would flat out not run it ~30fps at all, and 30 series cards might as well be vaporware at this point. Playing it on low is also not really worth it, the gameplay itself is just very... basic and the story while pretty good I don't feel myself engaged much, the companion quests were way more interesting than the main quest, but the main quest was pretty fine from what I played, I know I'm at the final quest currently I just haven't actually started it. I've been telling myself I'm going to but I want to wait for the free content they're adding at some point, as I don't really see myself returning to the game after I beat it between lack of interest and just too much to go back and replay if I were going to, and from what I've gathered choosing your different paths in the intro doesnt really change much between playthroughs apart from some supplemental dialogue here and there and nothing game changing.I also can't stand the way this game handles its RPG mechanics, in your skill points give you very minor increases most of the time with stipulations to even using that increase and it turns itself into a looter shooter unless you are constantly upgrading your guns. Personally, I cannot STAND this way of handling weapons in games and would rather weapons with static stats more dependant on your skills than the Borderlands style of two visually similar guns where one just happens to have better stats for whatever reason.Like I said though, the game is gorgeous and the combat can be satisfying, especially playing it like a Street Samurai. If you do choose to pick it up, just don't expect anything deep or game changing. S'alright.EDIT: I finally did beat the game, and while it is satisfying the ending I chose (Don't Fear The Reaper, Johnny Version), I still don't think I can recommend CP2077. I do plan on doing more playthroughs now, though. I'm interested in what the Free DLC & Paid DLC will offer in the future.

author: browntau
review: Disclaimer: I was one of the co-writers for the supplemental material for the original tabletop RPG this game is based on.Storyline: If you want to feel like you're watching someone else play a game, then play this and find yourself watching hours of cut scenes. This game feels like you're playing someone else's roleplaying campaign, full of well fleshed out characters, but you're along for the ride as you provide a vehicle for repeating the old campaign. Except of course, you weren't there for it first time around, so you're the fifth wheel.There's simply not enough room to develop your own character. I felt I was playing a tool for someone else's story. This is a fundamental problem for me.Setting: Amazing, seriously well-realised worldframe. Night City and its environs are outstanding. It's faithful to the original material, but also fleshed out remarkably well.Controls: The control layout is awkward, and accessing some of your cyberware comes at the cost of other functions. Eventually it grows on you, but it still isn't naturalSound: The voice acting is superb, with very few lines awkwardly delivered. I've only played through using the female voice in English, and there was little problem there. Needless to say, Keanu Reeves absolutely nails Johnny Silverhand perfectly. Graphics: There were some early glitches and T poses, which did not make for a good first impression, but generally the graphics ran well on a mid range machine.Overall: Unless you're intimately familiar with the original source material, you'll feel left out. If you ARE familiar with the material, you'll feel like you're just rehashing it all over. I'm glad I played it, but there were quite a few times I really just wanted to walk away from the game. Being forced to play another character for long periods at a time really broke the game for me.

author: ITS TIME
review: My Game Rating: - High End, 9.6/10- Low End, 8.8/10Overall it's the most fun I've had in a video game in a VERY long time. I look forward to playing it everyday, thinking about what I'm going to do and what missions i'm gonna complete. My two main complaints are these.- I feel like Jackie's story line is shockingly little, after I found out that the cut montage you get around the first 30 minutes of the game or so are all missions that were cut by CDP. That really disappointed me as his death felt way too early and almost made him look like a side character with no story, even though he's literally your best friend that your character constantly mourns every now and then. Maybe a DLC in the future that focuses on your friendship and fills the rest of the missions that never made the cut, for some reason.- The next complaint is the romance characters and how they just feel like another mission story. Although that's what they were, I wish after you romanced them that you could do more with them. For example, call them and be able to have them join you on missions, maybe more montages of you guys doing things, similar to the Jackie montage we get in the beginning of the game. Overall though, these characters are all really cool and enjoyable to play with.Overall, this game is amazing and is a 99% recommend. Can't wait for the DLC to drop.

author: R3TR0
review: Is the game buggy? Yes.Is the game unfinished and missing major advertised features? Yes.Is the story and gameplay terrible and is the game bad? NO, it's not perfect but it's not terrible either. Sure cyberpunk isn't really an RPG game as advertised but this has to be one of my favourite campaign despite its shortcomings. The ambience, soundtrack, and storylines were amazing along with the side quests and that's where your main focus should be, as an action, plot oriented shooter.I even had fun experimenting with the various play styles, cyberpunk will not disappoint you when it comes to choosing your own way to get to the objective. I certainly hope CDPR fixes its issues and kinks but overall it hasn't let me down.

author: basura_sensei
review: While I enjoyed the game despite all the bugs, I can't recommend this to anybody to buy at full price. I was hopeful for a while that CDPR would turn it around - yet here we are, 8+ months post-launch, and they're still doing damage control from the dumpster fire of a launch that was Cyberpunk 2077. I was hopeful for some ray of light, or some sort of DLC that'd bring me back into the game, as it has so much potential. Unfortunately CDPR just can't seem to get out of their own way when it comes to this game.

author: Yureina
review: Due to the hubbub over how buggy this game was when it released, I ended up holding off on buying it for a good while. Now nearly two years after it came out I've finished up with it and... it was worth it. Similarly to CDPR's last major game Witcher 3, this is easily one of the best open world RPG's i've played. The main story is plenty interesting enough, but all the side content - even tiny quick missions that in most games only fill the space - really help flesh out the world. The consensus? Night City is f*cked up and a pretty ugly place to live... but a great setting for a game. I did still have a few crashes, but my PC by now is seriously aging so maybe you won't have the same problems... maybe. At least the game autosaves often enough that the crashes didn't affect things much. Compared to how broken people made this game out to be at launch? It was perfectly acceptable.Anyway... I'm keeping this review short because I don't wish to spoil anything. This is the sort of game you really ought to experience for yourself. It is worth it. :D

author: Ignorah
review: Ignore the amount of hours I've logged on this title. It's not accurate. For some reason I would accrue hours while the game was shut down. Go figure. First off, I never , ever pre-order anything. It's just asking for problems. This was no exception. Yup, it had it's bugs. By the time I purchased it most of them had appeared to be fixed. The biggest glitch I experienced were the "ghost trees" which I fixed by messing with my graphics settings. I also had to re-load an earlier save game once. Once.... in 2 play throughs. And yes the driving can feel awkward as heck.So with the bad out of the way, what's good about this game.  The story, the lore, the environments, the freakin' soundtrack. This game is immersive in all the right ways. Yes it has fast travel points but when an environment is so beautiful and the music so awesome, I found  climbing on my bike just to drive and listen to the radio to get to quest markers much more enticing than just hopping from point a to b. I will say I enjoyed the male voice actor more than the female actor but hey, maybe that's just me. Overall I think this game is really worth playing.

author: 🔥UKIE
review: I haven't been this excited for a game since I was like, twelve. This game is a masterpieceIncredible world building, characters, setting. Storytelling is fantastic Visual style, car and even clothing are One of the best hes ever played - ever from top to bottom.Combat feels good and weighty and fun, you have a variety of options in combat that you can bounce between.Core gameplay loop is very satisfying, story and characters all blend together wonderfully. Meele combat was lacking and doesn't feel good (compared it to fallout)Normal difficulty is too easy, games shoves resources in your face, this actually diminishes a lot of interaction you have in the world (further in the game you probably don't need to go to vendors, interact with people for goods, etc.) Hard feels a bit to hard. Bugs - yes there still lots of them I am sure, game will be fixed.Performance is one of the biggest thing people complain about. Especially on the consoles...)In my case I am blessed with a decent rig and I am getting 70-90 fps on my 65" freesync TV running the game in 1140 with optimised settings and have been enjoying it immensely over the last 3 days (think my last save was at 60 hours, but I play slow, read everything I find, and look around a lot).Thank you  CD Project Red for all the goodies that came with the game and your hard work. Cd Project Red has done it again folks, Hear me out completely, Cyberpunk 2077 is as good if not better than the Witcher 3. There's nothing more to say, The story telling, the writing, the little details it's genuinely breathtaking (as Keanu might have said haha). I'm looking forward to see this game as a benchmark for any open world rpg`s now just like the Witcher 3 left the same remarkable impression on me.

author: Motta
review: You were the Chosen One. It was said that you would destroy the False Hype, not join them!

author: Mamilos
review: Cyberpunk 2077 launched, this was the best part of 2020.

author: Dr_Tschok
review: Controversy: The GameFor some people who had actively anticipated Cyberpunk 2077 ever since its announcement, closely watched every trailer and got themselves hyped up beyond belief, the game turned out to be very disappointing. Luckily (I’m convinced at least) I didn’t look forward to the game much at all and the only real appeal I saw was the collaboration with one of my current favorite musicians, Grimes, who produced a song for the in-game radio and voiced one of the sidequest characters. Other than that - I really couldn’t care less about this game... But bought into the hype a week or so prior to its release and partially transferred my wealth anyway. And here we are.Without any further ado, I’m just going to say that few games ever made me so invested in them. To make it a little more bearable to read through I’ll divide my thoughts into three different paragraphs.THE GOOD: 	1.	The designs. They are absolutely stunning here; from main characters, to someone you’ll only hear a few lines from throughout the game. From dangerous and scary (Adam Smasher) to soothing and routine (Judy). Applies to the in-game street ads, everything ever so slightly related to the Samurai band (later about that) and clothing for the most part. Stellar.	2.	The graphics. Alright, I’m guilty, this very game kinda made me upgrade my GPU sooner than I wanted to naturally do so. It’s mind boggling with RTX on: I’ve never seen any other game look prettier. The sights you see while driving through the city at night are worth a lot by itself.	3.	The characters. Each and every from the main character cast is very memorable and well written. Whenever Johnny (and yes, the trope with the iconic character that only the protagonist can see, due to said characters being inside their head, is as old as the world, examples: “Arkham Knight”, “Tales From the Borderlands”) appears and starts talking about his terrorist past or just says something disturbing in general, you can’t help yourself but feel like he’s all for real - he’s just that much of an idealist. And you grow to love him for that. At least that’s the case with me: you either love Johnny to bits or hate his guts - no inbetween from what I’ve heard. But even the secondary characters like Takemura and Rogue are to be remembered and have countless things and unique character features to cherish them for.	4.	Side missions. Just as rich, if not even richer, as the main story campaign. While some of them are lackluster and unapologetically short, quest lines such as “Dream On” and the story of a convicted murderer wanting to make a difference through his newly acquired faith are going to stay with you for a long long time. All of the secondary quests related to “Samurai” and Silverhand’s past are also a win. The bickering between the former band members feels like those are the conflicts that could’ve easily happened between any of the “days of glory longtime passed” rock bands, be it, say, Metallica or Deep Purple. Really authentic! 	5.	The story. Yes, as simple as that, I really liked the main story of the game and the way it was flowing. Full of memorable encounters and events, it’s the meat of the game and keeps you invested throughout. Written beautifully! 	6.	The symbolism. If you, as silly as it sounds, question yourself what makes a human different from god, wonder about afterlife and are curious about when does one’s life truly end - that’s the right game to feast on. The themes of faith (yes, faith, not religion, please never ever mix them together) are touched very authentically in one of the sidequests, too.	7.	Audio and music. The original soundtrack is a perfect fit for this world, from the menacing and grim “V” and “Consumer Cathedral” to the banging midtempo roller of “The Rebel Path”. Radio music is also great, curated by the likes of Run the Jewels, Nina Kraviz and Grimes. The latter contributed an absolutely stunning “Delicate Weapon” exclusively for the game, too, easily my favorite from all of the originals from “Cyberpunk 2077”. THE MEH:	1.	Gameplay. Yes, as sad as it is, the game gets a little boring to play after a while which is a cardinal sin for a game like this. Vehicles feel just okay, the gunplay is borderline alright and the quickhack system is fun for a while, until you realize it was done better even in the first “Watch_Dogs” game. Only the story and the characters kept me interested in immersing myself in more of the repetitiveness. 	2.	Customization. Yes, sure, you can customize your character to oblivion but that’s about it. You can’t even change their haircut later on, the clothing system is revolving purely around the stats and will force you to wear things you dislike for that sweet-sweet combat advantage. Cars can’t be customized whatsoever, but luckily I never really cared about them in the first place. But I have to admit that the game really allowed me to shape and make my character exactly the way I want them to be. Even though if you can’t be nonbinary in 2077, which I assume you can’t, since everyone keeps referring to you as to a “he” or a “she” exclusively, and the game doesn’t really give you a third option, CDPR are completely missing some really important attributes of the cyberpunk genre as a whole. 	3.	Cyberware. Oh they advertised it as the pinnacle of videogame customization, but more often than not it’s just another way to improve your stats with no visible changes. Only a few of the implants actually change you in a drastic way. But what about cyberpsychosis, you might ask. Obviously you can’t go insane because of all of the chrome in your body like you can in the pen’n’paper rpg, that’d be way too deep for a triple A 2020 game, right?	4.	Consequences of your actions. They are kinda there? Some of the things you do early on really affect the story and the flow of the later side missions but is it really game changing? Not in a slightest. Another overly advertised and underdelivered feature. THE BAD: 	1.	Technical issues. RTX 3060 ti with an i5-8400 are giving me ~55-60 FPS on high-ultra with medium RTX and DLSS on, what? Talk about optimization. The amount of bugs and glitches is legendary, not even worth mentioning at this point.	2.	Expectations. CDPR had it coming, really. Never seen a game advertised like that before, could even order a collaborative pizza from a local pizzeria chain packaged in a Cyberpunk themed box. The media, the trailers, the demos for the streamers; it’s very sad you can’t really see all this greatness in the game itself. The expectations were set too high and we received an undercooked product, as simple as that. And it’s no one’s fault but CDPR’s. Conclusion: So is the game really worth playing? Yes, but not now. I’ve had a lot of fun diving deep into the game’s world and I have to give all of my praise to the designers, writers and musicians that made it all possible for me. It’s one of my new favorite universes and I would love to play the tabletop rpg now. But the amount of technical issues and broken promises is really off-putting. Just give the developers sometime to actually fix the game, might take a year or even more, and, if you don’t mind the gameplay being a little underwhelming but care about the world and the characters of the game - absolutely go for it. Now is not the time, however, yet I’m still glad I enjoyed the game seemingly a lot more than some of the people I know. Don’t have your expectation high and you will never be disappointed.

author: withinmyself
review: Like a lot of players arriving in Night City for the first time this week, I was blown away by just how good Cyberpunk: Edgerunners was.  Half way through the series I checked the price on CP: 2077 which was 50% off.  F*cking nova!!20 hours in and absolutely loving this game.  One thing that has made this such a memorable and unique experience is coming from the show straight to the game.  I have a hard time paying attention and remembering lore, characters, factions, and world building in larger games.  Reading random things I find, listening to audio recordings, and hearing dialog that is stilted and boring just isn't enough to make real connections between everything so I can immerse myself in this world and its characters to the point where I believe its an actual place.Enter: Edgerunners.  This show is so freaking good at everything it is doing.  Night City feels like a real place and the vendors, bars, ripperdocs, corporations and people all feel very connected even when ultra violence can happen anytime.   All the characters seem important and interesting.  The protaganoists, antagonists, rippers, runners, psychos, and even the randomly killed characters with 2 seconds of screen time.I could go on, but this isn't a review for the show  :)So basically I feel more connected with this game going in and I understand more about what is happening in each mission and around the city which makes me feel like my time is more important.  In short, this is one of the few RPGs I've played where I can actually believe this could be a place and these could be real characters worthy of my empathy, sympathy, and time.  If you really love the Netflix Anime, and you haven't given Cyberpunk: 2077 a shot, this is the time to do it.  $29.99 is a great price.  Plus the studio is planning even more updates and FREE DLC in the future.  Buy the damn game!Graphics 10/10Audio 10/10Dialog 10/10Mechanics 10/10Character Development 10/10Fighting 10/10Family Friendly 0/10

author: hapizsan
review: im enjoy play this game, whatever if my laptop is just 1050ti 3GB lol

author: Kozzie
review: Bought this game when it released... it was insanely buggy. Shelved it. Picked it up 2 years later at the 1.6 update. got a supreme rig. See all the changes, everything looked fantastic. 6 hours in Sandevistan ability bugs and cannot be used. no ability can be used. reload, go back... nothing. entire Save build is messed up. Game breaking bug 2 years later... i'm out.

author: Tarkov Mihailov
review: First off. I didn't watch any of the preview trailers. I didn't know what was going on with Cyberpunk. I had assumed CDPR dumpstered it. When I heard it dropped,my curiousity got the best of me. THIS IS YOUR LAST WARNING TO AVOID ANY SPOILERS.It's been a year,a few patches later,and 2.5 playthroughs.  And I can review it.No,I don't reccomend it. Why don't I reccomend it? There's so many reasons why I don't.  But lets start off the good stuff.The City looks great. The music is killer. The concept is cool. The characters you interact with are generally interesting in some way(fixers aside).  And that's about where my praise stops. You'll see praise about the graphics and story,you'll see people sing praise about how CDPR fixed problems and will keep fixing problems,about how we got some DLCs.And none of that matters. Not one bit of it.  The core problems of the game are not fixed. There's issues with the game that go down to the foundation. And spit polishing the rest of the decrepit structure doesn't solve the foundations collapse. Lets start off with the story. Life paths generally mean nothing in the grand scheme of things. It changes your first hour or so,and it changes how you can interact with certain characters,but beyond that,it matters not.  Life paths werent expanded on by CDPR so I won't go further into them.The story pacing is all kinds of just..bad. The life path is 15m to an hour depending on if you actually want it to drag on longer. Then begins Act 1. Act 1 is just terribly paced.  The montage is gameplay we should've gotten,to build up with Jackie. The game wants us to care about Jackie,and tries,but it falls flat on it's face.  During Act 1 you meet a lot of interesting characters,talk a lot,and plan the biggest heist in the city. It's all cool and Payday like in some ways.  But there's cracks,small ones,that start to show here. You get introduced to all these people,and are given so little reason to care about them or their problems. Act 2 suffers more of the same,but we get Johnny. Johnny's actually a pretty cool guy in my opinion. I was always mostly entertained by his appearences,and quips in conversations or hearing is input on what's going on.  Sure he's a disembodied voice in my head,but at least he's funny at times.  Act 2 picks up where act 1 ends,you have a hole in the head,and you're dying because Johnny's eating your brain meat. There's high points in Act 2. The VA's did great work here trying to convey emotion and the troubling times. Vik,V,and other characters do amazing work here. Act 3 is figuring out what to do,and exploring Johnny and the End game. And the 3 paths you have laid out in front of you help with that final choice. Seeing Johnny change from a hardcore anti corpo jerkoff to becoming more mellow after he sees the damage he's done to V,and others around them,along with how the world didn't change,wakes him up. It's an interesting change of character and shows that johnny could grow. It's a shame that V didn't really grow as much as I hoped he would. The endings are all well done,and all interesting in their own ways depending on what you choose to do. I won't spoil them,but I did quite like them. But the stories alright,it's got pacing issues for the first half of the game. The side gigs are where the good writing really shows through. There's a lot of very good ones,and a lot of very enjoyable ones that I quite enjoyed.  Beyond the pacing problems I didn't have an issue with the story for the most part(I just wish that the writers took more into account of if V was his own character or the player. It feels like at times they forgot.)So the storie's passable. The Voice Acting is very well done,so why am I thumbing it down?Mechanically,the game isn't fun.  That's my biggest problem with the game. Mechanically,it's not fun at all. it's a boring slog. While yes,you can do crazy builds,those crazy builds don't mean a whole lot when you realize that the perks are all almost all passive bonuses like added damage or higher crit chance. The game uses a terrible looter shooter system,and there's just not enough gear to justify it. Some weapons have plenty of time in the limelight,others not so much.   The armor system is cancer and you look like you went dumpster diving in the trash wall outside the city.  Most of the gear you find will be broken down into parts to upgrade the gear you actually like. Most of the gear won't ever be touched because it conflicts too much with your build. The builds just aren't fun nor are they intuitive. Most of the perks are passive perks that increase critical damage or critcal change,or outright damage. Most of the perks you want for a build will end up conflicting with other things you want in a build.  But once you realize that all builds pale in comparison to the sneaky hackerman revovler build that clears entire compounds in seconds with spreading quickhacks,you learn that most build crafting is utterly pointless. You don't even have to spec into hacking to get the most benefits from a solid cyberdeck.Cyberware feels largely bad. Once you learn that the technomancer hackerbuild is the best build in the game,and you grind to get yourself to that point,the game is boring. The rocket arm is more likely to kill you than the enemy,the monowire uses almost all the same perks that Gorilla arms wants,and Mantis blades has so few animations that it gets boring to use very quickly. Once you get the hover jump cyberware your mobility needs are met and you only need to spec the rest to your build. But like perks,so much of it's passive perks that you forget you have them(more ram,more damage to bots and mechs,etc)You also cant sell certain cyberwares so it's pointless to buy a lower grade try it out then trade it in later.The economy is so out of wack for E$. Everything you make and sell,is worthless,everything you buy is tens of thousands of eddies.(yes i'm aware you can get a perk that increases the value of an item that you craft) but tell me,if I make a legendary weapon,and sell it,why is it 2900,but to buy it I have to tack on another 40k? Cars are largely pointless. You get so many vehicles for free,you only need to buy at minimum one,and even then that's debatable.  Get a bike if you really have eddies to burn.  You get the fasest car for free,a very good bike for free,and a free truck,so why waste eddies on any other cars or bikes?It's mediocre.  It's not very good. And it's a shame,because there's elements of a good game under here. I want to like it,but the first act is so boring that I hate doing it again.

author: mezolite
review: they listed the gtx 1060 as a recommended gpu but in reality you can't even get to 30fps if you try to play on high 1080p. 60fps is impossible even on the lowest settings. i'm disappointed

author: 7zH
review: Putting aside the insane amount of bugs, this game is barebones in almost every area, making it only but a shell of what it could've been.a) The attention to detail outside main missions is basically zero. Night City feels like a city full of nothing, and AI not having a routine plays a big part here, alongside the lack of AI's reaction towards your actions. Besides that, there is so much missed potential with how this city was handled.b) As i said above, the AI is extremely poorly coded. In fact, GTA 3 had better AI coding and that was 20 years ago.c) The "wanted" system has no depth and the police just spawns behind you whenever you commit a crime.d) Immersion is totally ruined by the insane amount of bugs that will inevitably distract you at some point in the game.e) Customization doesnt exist. Besides the beginning character customization that is really lacking, you cant change anything later on. Vehicle customization was cut from the game, yet they said nothing about that after they advertised it.f) There isnt even a weather system implemented, as the rain that you get to see in some missions is just a simple filter applied to your view.g) Shooting is alright, definitely nothing spectacular. Melee is not feasible because 9/10 enemies have guns. Stealth gives you no satisfaction and there is no incentive to do it, with how straightforward the level design is, in the few parts where level design exists.h) Might edit this later with more...

author: xeliicious
review: Disclaimer: I bought and played CP2077 about a year after release so all I know about the game is from patch 1.31 onwards - I cannot comment on the state of the game before then. I also got it for 50% off in a Steam sale, so I won't make any comment of "value" here either. What I do want to talk about is, despite all the controversy and the bugs, this is a genuinely entertaining game. From the weapons, to the characters, to the story... This world feels vibrant and immersive. I spent a lot of time just driving around with the radio on enjoying the views and the absolutely awesome soundtrack. Genuinely, the OST is just perfection - whether it's just the radio tracks, or the atmospheric bits that kick in at certain story moments.... sheeeeesh. Combat is FUN. I don't play a lot of FPS/shooty games but god it feels great wielding any weapon in this game. At times, you do feel a little too OP, especially once you get further in the game - a certain ending boss was wayyy easier than I imagined, which kind of sucked because he was hyped up as this near-invincible guy :/ But tbh I play Warframe so feeling OP isn't unfamiliar to me. But that's also the problem with this game. You start to fall in love with the characters, how they've been written and voice-acted, and then once you've completed their side quest, it's over. Both the main storyline and the sidequests/gigs are over too soon. They throw all these wonderful characters and locations in and use them all so briefly, it's such a shame. Once you've 100%'d it, there's not much else to do other than doing another run or modding the heck out of it for Photo Mode. So, do I recommend this game? Yes, I do. Especially when on sale. I've been thinking how best to explain how much I love this game and the only thing I can think of to sum up CP2077 is "neon joyride" - enjoy it while it lasts, then hop on again for round 2.
