author: Steve
review: Everyone knows about the bugs. I expect that on this PC version, those will all eventually be fixed. So I won't even take any of the technical problems with the game into account when I say: I would not recommend this game to anyone. I expected a legitimate first person open world RPG, in the vein of Fallout: New Vegas. I did not get that. Instead, I got a narrative heavy shooting game, with virtually no choices at all (even in dialogue), where the character building relates almost entirely to the damage your weapons do, and the leveling up process simply means your guns do more damage.Frankly, instead of saying "what is wrong with this game," it would be easier to list off the things that were done right: -The game looks good, when it's not bugging out-A lot of people put a lot of love into building the world-The car designs are cool-The voice acting is mostly well doneBasically, everything else sucks. What stands out as particularly horrible is the storytelling.The story is convoluted and confusing, and attempting to follow what is happening is emotionally and psychologically draining. Before I even finished the prologue, I was skipping entire scenes of dialogue, because I didn't care and couldn't really follow what was happening anyway. If you were thinking, like I was, that the narrative lightens up when you get into the core game - you would be wrong. No matter how long you play, if you are doing missions, the majority of your time spent in the game will be listening to people talk. It just goes on and on and on. Astonishingly, it doesn't appear that they ever touch on any of the interesting concepts that exist in traditional cyberpunk literature, and instead just focus on endless, inane crime drama. I'm not a big FPS guy, and only bought this game because it was advertised as an RPG, but the combat is also horrible. It's unclear how much of that is due to the bugs, but the basic fact is that if you are a low level character, you are in a situation where you can hit someone in the head five times with a sniper rifle and they don't go down. They use the leveling system (which is otherwise pointless) to punish you severely for attempting to play missions in any order other than the order that they've laid out for you. This might be because all of the missions have so much narrative attached to them that if you do them out of order, the story becomes even more confusing. I don't know. Here are some other observations:-Stealth appears to be completely broken, but that might just be bugs. It's not clear. But I would advise anyone to avoid even trying to use stealth, because it does nothing but cause frustration. -You cannot shoot while driving, but other people can shoot you. Also, you often can't get out of the vehicle after combat begins, so you just have to wait until the car blows up. -If you do anything illegal at all, you get cops on you. It's not clear how these cops know that you're committing crimes. However, cops are very easy to lose. Even if you have 4 stars and an army chasing you, you can simply kill a criminal, at which point the cops will leave you alone. -This isn't really cyberpunk, in the vein of William Gibson or Ghost in the Shell and other well known representatives of the genre. It's more just "crappy near future world." -The art style, this retro futurism aesthetic with the 1980s references, feels kinda dated in 2020. I guess that's what happens when you spend nearly a decade making a game. The style would have been cool if it came out in 2014, but it now seems tired and played out. -The soundtrack doesn't not contain any synthwave, which is simply bizarre. CDPR said they didn't want to use that music because it would be cliche or something (meanwhile the game is filled with stupid cliches). -If you walk around the city aimlessly, you don't find interesting missions in the way you do in other open world games. You can walk around for hours and find pretty much nothing at all. I will not even say "buy it if it is on sale" or "buy it if you like X." There is no context in which I would recommend this game to anyone. This does not bode well for the future of big budge games. The good news is, there are good games coming out from smaller studios every single day, so no one has to rely on these ultra-expensive, hyped-out games.

author: B1ng0, Doctor Dota
review: TL;DR: It's a fun game, but it's not what they promised us.. They hyped everyone for something and delivered something else. If it was a ubisoft game, they would have been crucified. The things that are in the game are fun, but the things that are missing makes the game feel bland and incomplete from time to time, which sucks. For example, there's no NPC driving AI, if you stop in front of them or just park you car on the side of the road, they will stop and wait for ever. There's no car chase except for the ones that are pre-determined and made for missions only. If you commit a crime, the police just spawns on you. There's a lot of stuff like this that when you see it happening, makes the game feel incomplete and bland. But don't get me wrong, I still have fun playing, it's just that I often wonder what the game could've been. It's like Metal Gear Solid V all over again for me.

author: excal
review: The problem is that when it works, it works, but when it doesn’t, it really doesn’t. Luckily, the game’s low points like the horrible binary stealth system and the bugs and lack of QoL are either fixable or vastly outweighed by the good bits, and the overall tally still ends up being much higher than the average of many other games out there. That’s helped a lot by the moment-to-moment gameplay, which pays off just as much as the story beats; the movement system lets you climb almost any short object, vehicles are weighty to drive and have fantastic interior and exterior designs, and guns feel properly loud and heavy. It’s story and narrative kept me glued to the screen, and everything – from sex scenes and romance options to Keanu Reeves trying to kill you or help you throughout the game – are remarkably well done. Cyberpunk 2077 is a game crafted with love, and it shows...A remarkably well-executed open world game whose great heights exceed its profound depths.

author: Hum
review: Gutting. Several elements in the game are absolutely superb, 10/10. But then there are a relentless, unavoidable stream of 1s and 2s in a rather empty universe. It's a cyber, inferior first person Mafia 3 for anyone who's played it.Ray tracing for many players means your characters donning black face paint when in cars. The driving model is utterly hideous - imagine sliding heavy magnets around a heavy metal board. GTA 3 style look away, look back and new NPCs are generated.  People have the same conversations over and over. Try looking at traffic from a distance - literally 2d sprites. Bizarrely the city itself seems almost one dimensional - for all its vastness, beauty and flashing lights, i felt i was plodding around impenetrable blocks of nothingness, not a teeming corporate metropolis. Also items just disappear from your inventory, terrible quality of life issues persist, etc etc. Choose the appearance of your genitals? Intention - mature, edgy. Outcome - pathetically childish. It's like nobody who's played games was allowed to see it before release. Completely gutted.Sadly, I think the problems are way too deep to fix and in fact, you'd need to start over completely. Yes at times it is awe-inspiring, it's certainly playable - even fun - but so relentlessly disappointing. It's a Yes/No recommend, slightly more No.

author: xoru
review: Pretty solid experience so far, a good bunch of glitches here and there, floating models / cars, characters getting stuck which results in blocking my butt and so on. Overall it's still a fun game with an interesting storyline / humor to it. I might update my review whenever I am going to finish the main story because my preferred way of playing is to get everything done at the same time. Don't get too distracted by all the hate and criticism towards the game and the publisher tho, in my opinion it is worth the money but of course you can wait a month or two to get it a bit cheaper if you are unsure about it yet. I hope that they will polish it in the near future so that every single person will be at least a bit satisfied with the end product. Appreciate the time and effort they have put into this world they created even if it took them longer than expected, which is totally fine. Keep up the great work, defo recommended from my pov.Edit: Finished the game after approx 113~ hours with 100% completion and I gotta admit the grind has been insane and I was able to enjoy myself to the fullest extent. Still, there were many times where the game kinda bit me in the butt (aka falling from the height of a tiny rock and instantly dying) but that doesn't really make it worse for me in the long run. Had to start a second playthrough as well which I managed to finish in less than 7 hours to get the last story related achievement cuz I kinda f'ed up in one of the key missions but hey, was able to speedrun it in great fashion. I've lost the sense of time while doing all of this and oh boy.., I would do it again. 11/10.

author: Flackness
review: those people who complain about how their pc cant run the game smoothly is the same people who skipped all the dialogues. lol

author: Efe hellcase.org
review: Judy is hot.

author: Shin
review: Foreword: While I enjoyed the game and had fun playing it, I cannot recommend this to anyone due to so many things that plague this game and pull it down and the circumstances around the whole game, marketing, support for the game etc. In the end I don't hate the game for what it is, but for what it isn't or rather what it was supposed to be according to CDPR.The good: -Some characters are enjoyable to interact with-Story is fairly decent -Night City looks very amazing-Side quests are fun-The music in this game slaps-Its pretty easy to be OP in the game without even trying so you feel super powerful by the end of the game even if you waste all your skillpointsThe bad:-They have lied directly to the consumers about features, purposefully misleading everyone in the promotional materials, even shown stuff in trailers that wasn't included in the game, even tho the trailer came out 2 months before release -The game is unfinished really so many things are broken or missing or just feel rushed-AI - lol the game has no AI for cops or peds and combat AI for enemies is barely functional-Customization is ass, you will look like a clown due to looter shooter elements-The optimization is ♥♥♥♥ for console, PC and everything this "runs" on, there are several games that look on par or better than this game but somehow manage to hit consistent performance while this game does not-The open world is just a background where quest markers are dropped in, can't be interacted with whatsover outside of quests, no minigames, no drinking in bars, dancing in clubs, watching concerts-Its not a good RPG, your background doesn't matter and you cannot roleplay. Witcher 3 had more choice than this game has. Everything plays out the same no matter what you choose basically-Its not an immersive sim. For people who think this will give them their Deus Ex fix, just look somewhere else -The cyberware in this game is a joke and doesnt feel like you can alter your character into some ungodly cyberhero. Most is stat boosts. Every arm cyberware is just a melee weapon that scales off a certain stat, excluding the one that turns ur wrist into a rocket launcher.If you expect deus ex levels of augments/cyberware here just forget it. Its not even close to Deus Ex.-They had to completely rewrite the game two years before release to make Keanu Reeves the main character which the whole plot evolves around. Good one guys. You ruined the possibility of an amazing "choose your own path RPG" just to have some big actor in the game. The character Keanu plays tho is pretty enjoyable tho and probably why so many people, including me, say they like the characters.-Emotional moments feel rushed, you can't get attached to anyone besides Keanu-Shooting is worse than Fallout 4, no gun customization either besides stat boosts, silencers and a handful of scopes. No other muzzle attachments at all-Most skills in the skill tree are just stat increases which is boring af if you are used to something like modded Skyrim or certain Fallout games. Also many skills just don't work. One skill tree is completely broken and can't be leveled properly. -The driving feels horrible without a controller and even then most cars drive like they are on ice-You don't own anything in this game, one apartment which can't be customized, cars are just in a list which you can spawn. You can only display certain weapons-Crafting breaks the game and was terribly designed-Horribly unbalanced. Tech weapons can basically trivilize every combat encounter because you can shoot through seemingly unending amounts of mass between you and the target.-Some quest chains never go anywhere. They get really interesting then end on a cliffhanger or just fizzle out-Texting with other characters is broken and barely works like you want it to-You get called up by random NPCs every 2 seconds if you drive past objectives-So called "Gigs" are just a grindy excuse to give you money and exp and get repetitive very fast-Default keybindings are stupidly designed making you skip dialogue when you try to crouch for example-The game will die if you play too much, corrupting your save forever. -Bugs. So many bugs. Verdict: Wasted a bunch of development years to incorporate some big actor which people liked, so they had to make him the main character. This game had potential but most issues cannot be fixed and this game will never be the promised big open world game it marketed itself to be.Seriously don't buy this game full price. Don't buy it at all. Don't encourage CDPR by giving them money. I regret that I cannot refund the game. Pirate it if you wanna play the game.I will maybe update this if the game gets any interesting updates.

author: stardraigh
review: There are bugs.  Doesn't matter.  Storyline is a good one.  Gameplay is excellent. Had fun.  Felt my own feels.  Great time.  Will play again.

author: DoctorDrew
review: advertised as a "next gen" open world adventure, touting "make your own choices!" constantly, except you can hardly do anything to influence the story or the persona of the MC

author: krisstijan
review: - DIFFICULTY -🔲 My 90 year old grandma could play it🔲 Easy☑️ Normal (Customizable)🔲 Hard🔲 "Dark Souls"- GRIND -🔲 Nothing to grind🔲 Only if you care about leaderboards/ranks☑️ Isn't necessary to progress🔲 Average grind level🔲 Too much grind🔲 You'll need a second life for grinding- GRAPHICS -🔲 "MS Paint"🔲 Bad🔲 Meh🔲 Graphics don't matter in this game🔲 Good🔲 Beautiful☑️ Masterpiece (If were not looking at visual bugs which will be fixed, the game is already beautiful looking at medium settings and low isn't that bad either)- MUSIC -🔲 Bad🔲 Not special🔲 Good☑️ Beautiful (Most of the music was done specially for this game)- STORY -🔲 This game has no story🔲 Like playing "Temple Runners" for the story🔲 It's there for the people who want it🔲 Well written☑️ Epic story~ VOICE ACTING ~🔲 No voice acting🔲 Oblivionly bad🔲 Acceptable🔲 Good☑️ Pure talent- PRICE -🔲 Free🔲 Underpriced☑️ Perfect price 🔲 Could be cheaper🔲 Overpriced🔲 Complete waste of money- REQUIREMENTS -🔲 You can run it on a microwave🔲 Average☑️ High-end (Max Settings)☑️ "NASA" computer- LENGTH -🔲 Very short (0 - 3 hours)🔲 Short (3 - 15 hours)🔲 Average (15 - 50 hours)🔲 Long (50 - 90 hours)☑️ Extremely long (90 - 110 hours) (Even a lot more if you are a completionist, also there are mods to play with and photo mode)🔲 No ending- FUN -🔲 I'd rather watch paint dry🔲 Hard to enjoy🔲 Repetitive🔲 Actually pretty amusing☑️ Ride of your life- REPLAYABILITY -🔲 It's a one - time experience🔲 Only for achievements🔲 If you wait a few months / years☑️ Definitely (There are three different life paths to choose, your decisions will matter, you can play on different difficulties, there are mods to play with and also there's photo mode)🔲 Infinitely replayable- BUGS -🔲 Never heard of🔲 Minor bugs☑️ Can get annoying sometimes🔲 ARK: Survival Evolved🔲 The game itself is a big terrarium of bugs- WORTH BUYING -🔲 No☑️ Wait  for the big hotfix patches if you don't want to play with bugs, which aren't really that bad and game breaking.☑️ YesDon't forget that  was also buggy on release and look where it is now, It's one of the best games ever made and It's still popular and played a lot. The game was done by the same developers.

author: Snekie
review: There IS a game here, a very good game in fact. But it is currently below countless waves of bugs, technical and performance issues.If you don't have a very high end PC, you're most likely not gonna enjoy yourself playing it. Since it seems like the game only tends to have even more issues if you don't have a setup that's way above the recommended specs.Don't trust the info that a 1060 can run it. It struggles to get 30fps on medium, and the low settings gives you a boost of 8fps at best. That's not acceptable for a FPS game.

author: Lace Black
review: I have played this game a great deal and I have enjoyed it thoroughly, despite the bugs, despite the launch. I haven't been this invested in stories and characters in a game or movie or any form of media like I am with Cyberpunk 2077 in a long time. The story, characters, and facial expressions are a breath of fresh air in an environment that is otherwise saturated with cardboard cutouts with drawn on eyebrows. This game also has Judy Alvarez. She is the best character ever. I love Judy.Based on the game as presented, with the good (gameplay, story, etc) and the bad (buggy launch, cut features, etc), I give this game a 8/10.Based on the fact that this game has Judy Alvarez in it...∞/10, would talk a suicidal AI-driven taxi out of jumping off a cliff again.

author: HappyRogue
review: After playing the game for a decent amount of time and got 2 endings (second one, i just loaded it from the point of no return and played again), here are the pros and cons that I can think of. Pros:1. Gameplay is fun. (Although that depends on what you're looking for)2. Soundtracks are great. 3. The environment is great. 4. Story is decent.Cons:1. Loads of bugs and optimizations issues (What a surprise, right? Although I'm sure they'll fix this eventually)2. Controls don't seem too smooth sometimes. (Although this could just be me).3. Story felt a bit short to me. (I could've finished it in like 20-30 hours, but I played as many quests and stuff I can to experience everything completely)Having said all this, I'd say this game is good, or at least decent. Is it the best game ever made or GOTY? Hell no. But does that mean it's bad as people make it out to be? Definitely not. It's your average game. A decent story, fun gameplay stuff etc. Nothing out of the ordinary. I'd recommend it if you are thinking of buying this. But I'd suggest waiting for a sale. If not for a sale, at least, let them fix the pesky issues. And you're good to go.

author: Matiyahu
review: +200 hours in, 4-5 playtroughs, 100% achieved and have still yet to play on very hard difficulty or pacifistic-ally.Enjoying the story and characters much more than Grand Theft Auto 5 or Watch Dogs 1.The world is severely bugged and cut out, but i knows bugs and cut outs can be fixed later.If you fail at making the story first, it can not be repaired and i did not have that problem, thanks!The PC version is worth it if on a sale... with its ups and downs and i can't wait for the coming updates.Sick Masterpiece !From a more critical standpoint. It is much easier to live up to negative feedback, than to live up to positive feedback. At this point, high expectations are going to really hurt a lot when the competition is compared to... Watchdogs Legion, Star Citizen, you name it.  Those competitors are in for a game, minus the charade business is playing during this grace-period of market elbowing strategy. If great expectations exists, they can not fool around anymore and have to use the brains again. They have a fan-base to save, rather than abandon the negative impacts of current lies, winning time rather than profit won't take them anywhere they want to be in a year from now. They will have to choose financial suicide or business. Negativity results in a freedom from responsibilities and obligations made prior to launch. Positivity = expectation, future, profit. This whole project have floated on a loan and banking success until now, where other companies had to "pay the price" to move forward and not only as a word, expression, in a hit song. It is not that easy... Action > Word.

author: Archbear
review: Cyberpunk 2077 needs no introduction. This is the game most of us have been waiting to play for a very long time. Got to sink a good amount of hours into this, and I am aware that I'm nowhere near finishing it soon. My completionist heart has taken over and I want to explore and do every little side activity I can find. However, I think I'm ready to express what a fantastic, breathtaking and imaginative role-playing game CDPR have managed to create. The writing and delivery is a step above anything the studio has done before, with all characters delivering stellar voice performances that are confidently grounded in Night City.I mean the world building, characters, quests, music on display are insane. It's jam packed with a cynical and philosophical view on humanity. Consumerism fuels the economy, and megacorporations taring the world apart. Literally striping humanity to the bone by the addition of cybernatic enhancements that have become the norm. This is a mean and cruel dystopian hellscape that takes hold and refuses to let go. The storytelling, in my eyes, ventures to places that challenge our views, exhibiting all the worse qualities of this battered and broken society, which is something that easily be applied to our future.There is a lot to unpack in the first hours. The path you choose will not only determine where our mercenary grew up, but also how they react to situations throughout Night City. This leads to a multitude of narratives, offers depth to your character, V, who can have different insights or knowledge about certain topics depending on their attributes. I went for more of an engineer type character for my first playthrough who is also specialized with handguns. So far, I'm having a blast!I really like the combat in the game. While it isn't unique, the RPG elements that surround the game offer a bit more diversity to how you approach each conflict. What I absolutely respect is the decision for first-person perspective at all times, because once you start playing the game you will understand the value to your immersion by having this one preset view. For me it helps to really be immersed in this universe. Now my decisions, or rather V's decisions, make for a more compelling experience. You can diplomatically defuse a situation or pull out your weapon and just blast every scum in your way, forcing you to accept whatever consequences might surface as a result.It’s unfortunate the game was launched with so many bugs, glitches and poor performance (not everyone) after a number of delays. I personally encountered very few bugs and had no performance issues, for Cyberpunk 2077 has run smooth all throughout my playthrough. As far as I'm aware, many of these issues are predominant on consoles. As I am playing this on PC, maybe I'm just lucky. Flaws aside, this is an open world, bugs and glitches are to be expected in the first couple of weeks, and I'm very sure CDPR are doing their best to bring out fixes ASAP, but I can understand people's frustration with this.Update:Months and months have passed, showing the poor state of development this game was in, as of now there are numerous issues, from performance to more glitches and bugs, some added recently from the patches, that really stains the overall quality of the game.I had fun playing and finishing Cyberpunk 2077 when it released. The few bugs encountered were just funny to me, and did not break the story at any point. Time has passed and I'm reflecting on many things I've ignored or simply left alone thinking they will be fixed soon. It is crystal clear to me now why so many people REALLY hated Cyberpunk 2077, and while I do disagree with some of them, I totally agree with the rest. There is very little excuse that this game was released to such a degree of unpolished and disregard to the fans. I can only hope and wait for CDPR to sink serious time and resources to rectify these mistakes.Overall, I will recommend the game, if you like cyberpunk themed stories and crave a good shooter, at least on sale.

author: ★ Raroog
review: + good main story+ a lot of interesting side quests+ fantastic graphic even without RTX+ absolutely amazing car designs+ good looking and well written NPCs+ many different options to build your character skills differently- minor bugs (to be honest PC version is "almost" bug-free)- main story isn't too long__________Overall - 9/10, every gamer must-play title.

author: R3VOLUTION
review: Great Graphics Great Gameplay Great Bugs [Hopefully they fix it in future updates]They kinda rushed the game should have delayed once again , to clear out those massive bugs ;__;

author: allreadydead
review: Unlike general opinion, the game was playable and at a level of bug that I call "acceptable" for me. Yeah, there are glitches, yeah, there are bugs that I did not experience in game but people did and showed on videos. But when the game is not breaking up for you and you pass those, the feel and environment of cyberpunk setting is surely there. I was expecting more of a bladerunner/ghost in the shell/altered carbon like gloomy environment but there sunshine parts which more like mad max setting.Overall, even being not a fan of this GTA/Watchdog like games, the cyberpunk setting mixed with RPG elements is doing fine for me. I'd give this game a solid 7 out of 10 with the potential of going up to 9/10 when it's bug free. A masterpiece but a hurried one, unfortuntely..

author: LAGRIE
review: Cyberpunk 2077----------------------------A really well crafted game when it comes to the openworld, characters, combat and story.You will be hooked from beginning to end.Every character is extremely detailed and well written.Every quest is fun and is well implemented.The world feels and looks fantastic and has a lot of charm.And the story.... is just the icing on the cake.Cyberpunk is not a revolutionary game, but its a strong and powerfull one.It does not re-invent the wheel, but it makes you have fun and reminds you why games are a form of art.From characters to world building to lore. Cyberpunk is a damn fantastic game.Sadly the game on its release has tons of bugs and a few optimization issues.But when compaired to the entire package, you cant deny how well crafted the game is.I would love for them to add a customisation option for the character in the city (hair, eyes etc)And the Car AI does need some tweaking. But these are pickings that can be put aside for now.Cyberpunk is a must play, a game that knows how to deliver a story.Enjoy yourselves samurais.You have a city to burn !

author: ⭕⃤ BIPPO
review: the good:game's artistical part is 10/10. the city, clothing, cars, ambience and music are amazing.story's good, I'm not a rpg guy and it hooked me to the end. side quests are a mixed bowl: some of them are generic trash and  some of them (most of them, i'd say) are just epic, like peralez' quest chain, delamain or one where you have to help kerry (old johnny's band colleague) sabogate a k-pop band that is doing covers of his songs. the bad: the game is absolutely bug-ridden. there is a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ of bugs in every imaginable way and facet, too many of them to list them here. Most of em weren't gamebreaking at all. For example, when exceeding X speed with a car or bike your character will briefly appear over the vehicle in a T pose. npcs eating invisible food, taking selfies with invisible phones, alerted pedestrians disappearing when moving the camera off them and generally acting super dumb ... that kinda stuff. those didnt bother me too much so I could go through the game without too much hassle, but I can see some people getting rightly frustrated by some of the bugs.  they can be very immersion breaking at times.another thing this game is severely lacking is world interaction. as I said the city is amazing, best open world scenario ive seen in any game, period. problem is that this amazing, colorful world is an empty shell where you can't do anything but questing. Billiards, arcade machines, npc hookers, ambulance/firefighter missions, casino, pachinkos... you can't even sit on a stool. the amount of wasted possibilities is massive. Some games like gta 3 did that 20 years ago. let that sink in.the ugly:both the bug and interactivity issues don't bother me too much because i know the former will be eventually fixed, and the latter will be adressed by cdpr via dlc/free patches.the AI of the game however may be a more difficult issue to tackle. it's bad, like very very bad. wanted sysem is the worst of all: when you commit a crime, instead of police cars and other vehicles chasing you, police npcs will start poppint 3 meters away from you. no matter where you go, they will keep popping right in front of you. if you get out with a car they won't pursue you simply because the game inst programmed to do that. all the cars are programmed to follow a straight on-rails line and won't leave it no matter what. If you block a road with your car other cars won't try to avoid it, they will just sit there honking like ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥. likewise, if you shoot people inside their cars, they will just leave them and crouch with the standard "afraid" animation and stay there forever or until killed.there are few races in the game where the cars are absolutely unable to follow you or actually drive and win the race, so the game just respawns them behind you every second. this is probably the most flagrant example of terrible npc driving ai.about performance: you will need a beefy machine. I'm getting 30-50 fps with a 3080, 3700x and 16 gb ram with everything on ultra + rtx on at 2440p. my conclusion is that the game is good, even with its flaws, and definitely worth the price if youre not too bothered by the bugs and ♥♥♥♥ performance (which will be fixed eventually, I hope).

author: Bap
review: The game itself is fine i guessPlayed 2 full playthroughs to see what the game has to offer and well, there isnt much..My main gripes are The world feels souless and empty, most npcs are interactable in the most basic way and only like 1 or 2 vendors have more than one dialogue line. The only time it feels like im actually talking to a person is when interacting with Johnny, one of my fav parts of this game. Skill trees are absolutely pathetic, nearly all perks are just meager stat bonuses. Borderlands 2 did skill trees much much better  ago. Not to mention crafting is mostly locked behind one skill tree. meaning if you dont wanna spec into technical you wont be able to craft anything above uncommon items. too bad! While the gunplay is enjoyable and the same goes for melee combat, the weapon pool is so small. For example there are only 2 lmgs, both are power and none are iconic, while pistols have tons of iconics to choose from.and you know what, even with all this i'd be willing to give this game a recommendedIF the game didnt run like ♥♥♥♥and didnt have copious amounts of INFURIATING unfixed bugsCyberpunk has the worst popin ive ever seen in any game EVERthe time it takes for textures to properly load is unacceptableThis is the first and last game im buying from cd project.

author: CB
review: Unplayable 1 year after release, game breaking bugs prevent me from advancing into story further. You got my 60 eurs tho ngl

author: Smorconomics
review: To preface, I am one of the few lucky ones who have experienced no crashes or game breaking bugs. So this negative review is genuinely regarding the quality of game play. Like so many other gamers, I am a sucker for a great open world experience. Since the days of Morrowind I have eagerly consumed most every AAA open world adventure/action/RPG: the GTA, RDR, Elder Scrolls, and Fall Out franchises have generally delivered fun experiences, with some being better than others; some excellent while others just slightly average.Every single Bethesda and Rockstar title in recent memory, as well as CDPR's own Witcher 3, provide exceedingly immersive, engaging and enjoyable experiences compared to Cyberpunk 2077.In fact, in my 15 some odd years of being on the Steam platform I have never felt the need to post a review until today.- character models are jittery and animations are rough, looks like a beta game or something from 5 years back- NPC collision animations only trigger a small amount of the time; sprinting through a crowd of a dozen pedestrians feels hollow, as you fly straight through them, colliding with some while passing straight through others- constant light and texture flickering and popping- terrain objects showing clearly through fog or at great distance, breaks immersion in all flying scenes- pedestrian models and vehicles constantly appearing and disappearing just 5 feet from you- a muddy, almost hazy look to the game, even at fully maxed setting at 2K resolution- small immersive things like jumping into a pool or body of water result in no water animation or noise, as if this were a title from 2007. there is in fact no animated liquid in this game...- numerous collision bugs; I've been thrust into the sky as high as a skyscraper when I brushed past a car once- AI is abysmal, they will attempt to shoot you through walls and doors never hitting you; they will find cover and just stay there waiting for you to heal and reload calmly (on Normal difficulty)- While the map seems full of activities, the world is hollow with not much to do other than visit item shops or buy hookers; NPCs quite literally have one response to any action your character takes in public: cower. I once bumped into a huge, tough looking, 300 lb, fully sleeved NPC and he simply cowered on the ground, it immediately broke immersion- there are more things to list here, but you get the gist- combat has little intensity and feedback; you cannot tell if you are taking damage unless you look at your health bar or until your vision starts flickering and becoming red- AI are akin to AI you would encounter in games from early 2000's; they either stay in place uselessly or run at you- the guns are lifeless and don't FEEL like they are packing a punch; you'll inevitably find yourself soullessly spraying magazine after magazine into an enemy- stealth boils down to: hide until the NPC starts on a route and leaves; that's it. this game has no concept of stealth- melee feels weightless with no momentum or impact; i remember a mission where i had to sneak into a guy's office after giving up my weapons at the lobby. he proceeded to pull a gun and attack me after a conversation went bad. i went on to punch this guy and heal as he shot me with a pistol for what felt like 2 minutes until he finally died, somewhere around the 100th punch.- the hacking abilities are boring and offer little to either stealth or assault tactics- the inventory and UI is a mess, you'll be spending quite some time understanding just what the hell is going on; junk items and food items everywhere- upgrades to gear, to tech and to the characters skills are real dry; rarely something that is unique or interesting, usually just increase X by 5% type stuff- driving physics feels wrong; the car grips far too much to the ground, to the extent that when you collide with other vehicles you will literally scoop underneath them. motorcyle physics are terrible, and you can run your motorcycle into a wall at 60 MPH and nothing happens.- movement and collision with the world is jumpy/jittery, and it is far too easy to accidentally trigger a dodge- again, lot's more to cover here but the combat leaves much to be desired- took about 6 hours to get past the intro act; every single moment of it felt dry and boring- i often found myself confused by the introduction of characters, not understanding how or why they were important- after the intro act, I expected things to pick up, but the story only dried up further and began to dredge along around hour 10- they seem to have added Keanu for marketing sake; his character is neither complex nor convincing- the only character with any charisma is killed within the first 10 hours of the story line- side quests are no fun; it makes me appreciate the truly unique side quests that games like RDR 2 have to offer- the story makes me want to go level another character in Classic WoW

review: you can have sex in a tank

author: RCS
review: Completely Changed the Review. The Game, while needing a lot more love, is getting a lot of love from it's developers. I hope they continue making the game all it can be.

author: explosivedeer
review: This is one of the very few games that managed to suck me right in. There are some noticeable issues with the game but you can tell time and effort went into this, and I hope to god they continue to pour their souls into this tremendous and innovative game. It has endless routes for expansion and I sincerely hope the cyberpunk-esque game genre sees more titles in the future after this.This was a massive undertaking and to say they fell short of nailing the vibe is just outright stupid. The soundtrack is incredible and really brings the spectacle that is Night City to life. Cyberpunk managed to strike an atmosphere with a similar level of accuracy to Half-Life, Unreal Tournament, Nier Automata and Metro, all of which I hold high regards for.I've already sunk 40+ hours into the game and I haven't even reached an ending yet. Needless to say I'm pleased and selfishly wanting more. All I ask of you CDPR:Continue to fix, expand, and support mod development. You've easily beat the captivation I had for Skyrim. I couldn't be happier.I've gotta cut this review short cause I just wanna go back to playing it.

author: GosuDRM
review: This is an RPG.It is not a AAA shooter with deep gunplay mechanics and intuitive aiming.This is an RPG, with guns in it.It is not a high spec driving/racing game with dynamic drifting and G-force physics.This is an RPG, with driving in it.It is not a dating simulator with softcore porn.This is an RPG, with sex in it.It is not a stealth game built entirely around the mechanic.It is an RPG, with stealth in it.People late to the hype train, drooling over the promises of the most perfect game ever, without paying attention to what the devs are all telling you, are going to throw a tantrum when they find out the game is made around the story and characters.The game is made to be a deep role playing experience, which requires you to go in with an open mind and desire to be immersed in a new world. When you go in as a 5 year old wanting to play the new Call of Duty and mindlessly shoot everything highlighted red, you will be disappointed.Make sure you know WHY you are buying this game and are so excited for it and not just jump on the hype train to be a salty ♥♥♥♥♥ when its not what you thought.

author: Zelerity
review: Saddest part is; this is the best (NEW) AAA game I've played on PC all year.

review: Last update...

author: FantasyFreak_UK
review: Genre - Cyberpunk FPS/RPG1st Hours ImpressionsYou need 15-20 minutes to create a character you care about.Graphics on my mid-level rig seem fine. But I am not a highest settings kind of guy.Chose a Nomad and driving around felt a bit like Mad Max, which was a game I enjoyed.I soon felt integrated into the story and universe after a few character interactions and minimal reading.Playing on normal and using a controller, seems easier than mouse and keyboard.Worth doing the tutorial, might need to refer back to it for hacking etc.

author: Marksman
review: Not recommended for reasons exemplified by the following video:Witcher 2 was great for its time, and Witcher 3 was one of the best games I've played. CDPR, you can do better. Next time spend less money on actors and marketing, and more on development. We all heard the stories of devs being forced to work crunch hours. Delays are better than releasing a half finished game. Let's hope the game improves with updates, and that CDPR learns from their mistakes.

author: Batpadre
review: Well, after finishing the game with most of the side missions done and a decent build and all that, I can say Cyberpunk 2077 is not a bad game but definitely is a disappointment. (Not that I hyped myself for it.)I pre-ordered this game on July 2019. That was a huge mistake on my side but thanks to Cyberpunk 2077 I will not do that mistake again for any other promising game or a developer that i think i could count on.The state of this game is just "breathtaking". Number of bugs that I encountered with are out of imagination. And significant amount of that bugs are game breaking bugs that I need to reload my save. And there is another kind of bugs that just destroy the immersion, excludes you from atmosphere of the game. T posed NPCs hovering around in a serious cutscene, sudden changes of time just hit you with a blinding light, ghost cars that NPCs piercing through other cars or killing whatever come to their way and the last but not least of them is the crashes. It happened to me especially on my last 10 hours or so. I am playing this game on a 1060 6gb "supposedly recommended system" and my fps were ~45 at 1080p, low-med settings. So this game is not optimized at all.Story is intriguing, particularly if you are enjoying the genre like me. Some of the supporting characters' story lines also good. RPG element is .. nope until the end. Combat is nice even thought I didn't think it would be. Enemies are not like a bullet sponge, that's a relief. Things I like the most other than Keanu Reeves' company are little references and easter eggs that are great.In conclusion, I can't recommend Cyberpunk 2077 to anyone in this state. It needs so much polishing in every aspect.

author: accesstoarasaka
review: I bought the Cyberpunk 2020 game book in 1994. I have wanted to visit Night City ever since. The world of R. Talisorian's Cyberpunk, and cyberpunk fiction in general, has been a huge inspiration for my music, my creativity, everything - as all those who know me are well aware. I am happy to report that the gritty nature of its roots has not been lost in translation for new audiences. This world is not a shinier and happier version of 2020. It's exactly what we envisioned while netrunning back in the day, just with the updates one could expect from 57 years of in-story advancement.I can now run the streets of Night City in what might be a new entry in my top-5 favorite games, giving me a feeling that I haven't had since Deus Ex: HR and the newest returns to the world of Shadowrun. I feel like I'm home.This was well worth the wait._//AtA

author: DPotatoman
review: This game is released in an embarrassing state. I can't play the game because my latest save crashes to desktop. The more you play the game, the less polished it gets.Instead of requesting full price for the full release, Cyberpunk 2077 should've been published as an  game. CDPR should be ashamed of the amount of issues they let slip through just to release a game in an unrealistic date on 6 different platforms. They couldn't even meet their own deadlines 3 times. Yet delays didn't help.CDPR is bad at managing their own ambitions. What's happening with the bugs, underpromissed content and multiple delays is the result of the toxic ambition this game was fueled by. Avoid this game until underpaid programmers crunch out the fixes.Disclaimer: I love this game and I think the gameplay and story are somewhat great. I just don't want to give CDPR management any slack. AAA priced games should never be released in such state.

author: Arszilla
review: :- Night City is massive. Lots of side missions and random missions to do amidst the main story.- The story, the characters, voice-acting, etc. is quite amazing. The story quite grabs you by the heart and beats the living crap out of it.- The soundtrack is amazing. Both the original soundtrack and the radio tracks etc. Top notch.:- The optimization is terrible.- The AI is more braindead than you. They also spawn out of nowhere.- The police and the wanted system is utter ♥♥♥♥.- The minimap in driving sucks. You either gotta pay attention to the road or miss the turn, or pay attention to the minimap and crash.- Lots of missing features that were promised. Including cyberpsychosis, AI having tasks, car customization, apartment customization, gun customization, clothing customization etc. The list can be found on Reddit: - Only 4-5 romancable characters. Besides those, there are joytoys (AKA prostitutes).This game will need No Man's Sky level of fixes, reworks and improvements in order to save CDPR's ass.Final rating: 6.5/10

author: Astasia
review: Quick "early" review at the 22 hour mark, may update this later with a more detailed one. The game is amazing, it's incredibly immersive, has a lot of very deep gameplay systems, an engaging main story, and a ton of open world side stuff to do.A lot of people are saying the game is super buggy, I've only run into one real bug in 22 hours played, and a few trivial animation errors. It's been a very smooth experience.Graphics, I'm somewhere between minimum and recommended, with a GTX 1060 3gb card holding me back, I'm able to play the game on mostly high settings at 1080 with stable 35-40 FPS in most situations. I would have guessed it was higher, but that's what the FPS counter says. It feels pretty smooth, no chop, very playable after updating to the nVidia game-ready drivers. The game looks amazing, the characters look amazing, animations are amazing, my only complaint is it seems like TAA is forced on with no way to disable it, I'm sure I could get a few more frames with that turned off and I generally don't like the the blurriness of AA or especially the slight after-images caused by TAA, but it's barely noticeable in most situations (and/or I've gotten used to it by now).Big thumbs up. I'm of the opinion a lot of people really enjoy being contrary and this game is the new big thing for them to latch onto and be vocal about. This game was at about a 70% within hours of release, which is ridiculous, but it's been climbing as the trolls are drowned out by legit players playing long enough to actually form a valid opinion. It should be a 90-95% as far as I'm concerned.Edit: I played for like 7 more hours. This not the big update to the review I was planning on doing, just more of a small edit. I ran out of steam at about the 30 hour mark, through no fault of the game, just that I can only do so much "story" in a game these days before needing a break. It's a long story, which is a good thing, and I wanted to push through it, but I'm less into story these days than I used to be. I don't have much else to add at this point, I still never ran into any serious issues with the game in terms of bugs. I can't say most people wont have serious problems, but I imagine that is the case, and that it's one of those games where so many people are playing that a lot of fringe cases come up that make it seem like an entirely untested and broken experience. The reality is that there is a solid stable experience in there that a lot of people have enjoyed, but there's no guarantee at this point that you will have that experience, so I guess until there are some serious updates it might be a bit of a gamble to buy, short term. Long term I have no doubt they will fix all the bugs people are having.

author: Colonel Patrick Sanders
review: Cyberpunk 2077 is an open-world action RPG from the makers of The Witcher 3. You play as a character named "V". You play in Night city, a techno-metropolis built by the mega-corporations that rule the world.Let me start out by saying, this game has gotten A LOT of critics. Mostly for the console versions, as PC is much better. But even on PC the game has quite some bugs/glitches.To me this game, in terms of the main story, did live up to the hype. Let me explain. Dialog and building bonds with characters is so well done. There’s a lot of moments in between the action you just get to talk with characters. You will end up just choosing extra dialog options just to get to know that character more or work out the relationship you have with them. You can choose and give your character the attitude you want, and even though some dialogs always end up at a certain result, sometimes the options you choose really do matter later on. The story in general is really well done and interesting and has a good length if you ask me. Not too long, not too short(Took me about 33 hours with some side missions in between). Talking about side missions, they are also really fun to do! Some of them have some great little story’s sometimes part of a bigger story that involves multiple quests. There’s just a lot of content in the general.Gameplay itself is also really fun. You level your character the way you want it. Focus on hacking, melee, gun blazing, assassin etc. You can also buy cyberware at so called ripper docs to basically modify your character's body and gain all kinds of cool extra skills and functionalities. Good to note is the category you put your skills points in also helps you in dialogue. There’s plenty of skill checks during dialogue just like in for example Fallout.So let’s talk about Night City. Night City in itself looks absolutely amazing. It looks alive, has a lot of cool places and they really nailed the feeling of a crowded bustling metropolis. There're lights and skyscrapers everywhere, and there’s some really cool areas. But… It’s missing some essential stuff. There’s just not much to do in Night City itself. I wish it would have more small things games like GTA have. For example: entertainment such as mini games, barbers to change your look, and other small activities are just missing. There’s a lot of small food places, and in most of them you can buy some food but you can’t really sit down to actually “eat food” there. Also there's just no real interaction with NPC’s that are walking around. They all give you some kind of random one liner as a response. It’s a shame because Night city has everything else. The way you navigate the city is really cool. In other open world games you just drive to a place to start a new quest. Here you actually walk through cool alleys, up some stairs past some people doing their own things etc. It really feels alive, so missing these crucial features are just a bummer.On the performance part, I got an average of 40-50fps on my GTX 1070, no crashes and some frame dips at times(Medium/High settings). Do not forget to install the NVIDIA drivers. It seemed to help a lot of people with their crashes and performance. I found some glitches and bugs, but most of them could be compared to the ones The Witcher 3 also had at launch, or games Like Fallout often have. Just visually. I had 3 breaking bugs where I needed to reload my save because it was stuck somehow. Next up, A.I. Damn it CD Projekt Red…. The A.I. of people in the open world is absolutely horrible. To not even start talking about police. There basically is none. When doing a crime, some police spawn right next to you, then you walk away 1 corner, and they just leave you be. Lastly, CD Projekt Red made quite some promises that they didn’t deliver. I personally didn’t follow the hype and promises, so I wasn’t disappointed, But it sure is a big miss to not have some of these features they promised. Hopefully they will add those later on.So to sum it up, would I recommend this game? Hell yes! It was really fun, and I’m sure with time it will even get better as they polish out bugs, and hopefully add some ofthe missing features. For me Cyberpunk 2077 is a great game! A bit disappointing on some parts but I can’t wait until some more polishments are made and we get cool new features and DLC. Knowing CD Projekt Red they will keep working on it.

author: D4N1326
review: Cyberpunk 2077 might be of the most anticipated game of all gaming history but with a bad ending on december 9.I played this 120 hours and I liked it but don't get me wrong, It doesn't mean I am happy with cp2077 and fanboys think that some gamers are only upsets because of bugs, That is not true. I'll keep it short for those who doesn't like to read long reviews.THE GOOD-The story of cb2077 is amazing and they really put their heart on it, You can get emotional with the characters.-Night city world Cdpr really did an amazing job crafting the world, there is so much detail on the buildings, If you try just to chill and walk you can really appreciate all of it.-The music on this game is just incredible there is nothing more to say.THE BAD-There is so much missing content that it hurts, I still wondering what went wrong?-The main story is just too short this was a letdown for me when I realize I was about to finish it :(-Crafting is almost useless- You can't customize you car, you can't even change the paint.-Beware! When you create your character you can't change your style anymore because there are no barbers on night city-Police is broken(spawn behind you) If you like police chases I am sorry.-CDPR post a video about styles, Keep in mind! Styles does not matter in this game because it's armor, this sucks for players that like to look very good on their games-Your choices barely matter-Npcs does not have day-night cicles, they keep doing the same thing forever.-Lots of bugsThere is so much but those are the basics for me and unfortunately I trusted CDPR I thought they were one of the best gaming developers but they just lied a lot maybe more than HELLO GAMES with no man's sky, There is a patch releasing soon but that won't be enough to fix all the problems this game has unfortunately but who knows?.Don't forget this does not mean cp2077 is a bad game is good but with all those issues it has, It's better to wait until the game is actually READY! and have the full experience of Cyberpunk 2077.

author: SeeSquared
review: TLDR: If you like the idea of an FPS/RPG hybrid that takes place in a setting that's basically the Deus Ex universe on bath salts. This game is for you. Maybe wait a bit longer for more updates but certainly don't write it off for good.Full review:At nearly 40 hours in, I figured I'd give a review of my experience so far. I'd like to preface this by saying that if you try to forget everything that you thought this game would be, forget the hype, let go of your expectations of the dev, etc. Its really an impressive game, bugs and all. And yes its still pretty buggy. I have only come across minor ones mostly, although I have seen a couple of pretty jarring things(i.e. rush hour traffic in the middle of the desert) but in the end I think this really is an amazing game that's just in early access(but the devs arent calling it that).Graphics 4/5:I would be completely willing to give the graphics a 5 if anyone(literally anyone) that I knew was capable of actually playing this game at max settings to even witness how good it can be. Im playing it on med-low(mostly low) and its still great aside from glitchy things that pop up in the environment from time to time.Sound 4/5:Nothing in this game has truly captivated me sound wise but I also have very little to complain about, the radio stations are decent, score is fitting, voice acting is really on point. The only complaint is that sometimes the dialogue volume of one person in a conversation will suddenly be much louder for a sentence or two.Story*so far* 4/5:I've enjoyed the story so far, its very much witcher 3 style story progression, just different characters in a different setting.Gameplay 3/5:This really is tough to judge, sometimes i feel like the gameplay is wonderful.. sometimes its awful. This could be due to bugs that will be fixed eventually. Also, even though there is a seemingly adequate tutorial this game was incredibly overwhelming for me to actually get a grasp on what my choices for different playstyles were and what TF it was exactly that I was supposed to be doing aside from the main story. Eventually you mess around enough to get it but it was bit frustrating for a while.(tip, invest in the attributes that are higher levels, that means that you are preforming those actions more, i.e. if you notice that your assault is higher than pistols, while you may have thought you liked pistols more.. you simply arent using them as much.. invest in what you naturally play)15/20 Recommended

author: Strange
review: Game is a 6/10 mashup of The Division, Fallout 4, and GTA. It's fun, but if you stop to examine almost any individual element of this game, you'll realize fairly quickly it's either often mediocre, poorly implemented, or both. The game world is beautiful at a distance but fundamentally dead. There are simply many, many missed opportunities in this title which fundamentally prevent it from being more playable and compelling:- the starting life paths have almost no relevance after the beginning of the game- gunplay and melee feels clunky as hell- you can't hijack air ships whatsoever - cops don't even give chase in cars- the cop response mechanic overall is goofy and braindead instaspawning- there's no player choice to align oneself with the criminal demimonde or the police or corps or any group- many if not most of the buildings are inaccessible, and frankly there is little to no detailed oriented exploration in the style of GTA, RDR, or BOTW- there is little to no emergent gameplay featuring NPCs interrupting you out in the world, and so your connection to the world is largely restricted to phone calls or explicit interaction during questsI could go on, but that's enough.On top of everything, there are a ridiculous number of bugs, and let's not forget that CDPR literally lied to base console players that their product ran "surprisingly well" when it is in fact crippled. Speaking of which, anyone else having problems with their implants and skills? I'm trying to create a run and gun char but the health regen effects supposed to be granted by my build choices don't occur in or out of combat. The hilarious thing is that the build variety would be the one thing to keep me playing this game, yet this side of the game suffers the same fate as the rest of it - glitches, cut content, and extremely poor implementation. I mean, there's no excuse for the entire crafting skill tree to be useless. There's no excuse for an entire skill tree (techie) to be stripped without any replacement.From all appearances, the game was stuck in development hell and, at some point, there was a haphazard change of course from a more rpg experience to an action-adventure playstyle. The proof is in the muddled mess we got.

author: Doc Shaftoe
review: The 1.5 update fixed many of the problems plaguing the initial release. It still isn't where the pre-launch hype promised it would be, but the game is in a very. very good state right now. Even at launch the core gameplay was solid enough to support a well-written story with some of the best voice acting in gaming. Keanu Reeves turns in an excellent performance and both voice actors for V are terrific. If you're on the fence, I strongly recommend picking the game up on sale. It's definitely worth your time. Don't let the review-bombers from China and Russia lead you astray. If you're looking for an excellent role playing experience, Cyberpunk delivers.

author: Sіlncr
review: Broken Masterpiece. As anticipated, writing, gameplay are very high level. BUT! additional activities are literraly broken and I encountered 3 uncompletable GIGs on 1st area of Night City! Teleporting enemies, sometimes clunky animations and very artificial looking city. It's really hard to believe it even in the slightest. CDPR is a great company that deserves our deepest respect, but releasing game in this state was a mistake. Flying objects gonna break cutscenes, explosive barrels sometimes bang, cars teleport, people&cars render in front of player eyes. Buy if you aren't afraid of losing immmersion. It's 100% worth its price, sadly CDPR didn't invest in enough testing and fixing. Maybe I'll update review when it's fixed.. Next time no preorder.
