author: Titan
review: Cyberpunk 2077 has been one of the most highly anticipated games in recent years, promising to deliver a thrilling open-world, action-adventure RPG set in the futuristic metropolis of Night City. Developed by CD Projekt Red, the game is set in a dark, dystopian future where players take on the role of a cyberpunk mercenary who is trying to survive in a world of corruption, violence, and advanced technology.One of the standout features of Cyberpunk 2077 is the ability to create your own character, customising their appearance, abilities, and playstyle. You can equip your character with cybernetic enhancements that allow you to do things like slow down time, hack into computer systems, and enhance your physical capabilities. The game also offers a wide range of upgrades and enhancements that allow you to further customise your character to your liking.As you explore the sprawling, neon-lit city of Night City, you'll encounter a wide range of characters, each with their own unique personalities, motivations, and stories. The relationships you forge and the choices you make will shape the story and the world around you, with multiple branching paths and endings to discover.In terms of gameplay, Cyberpunk 2077 offers a mix of first-person shooting, driving, and hacking, with a heavy emphasis on player choice and freedom. You can approach missions in a variety of ways, using stealth, combat, or hacking to achieve your objectives. The game also features a robust economy and crafting system, allowing you to earn money, buy and sell goods, and upgrade your equipment.Since its initial release, Cyberpunk 2077 has received a number of improvements and updates aimed at addressing some of the game's technical issues and improving the overall experience. These updates have included improvements to gameplay mechanics, bug fixes, and visual enhancements, among other things. The game also includes a variety of free additional content, such as new weapons, customisation options, and more.Cyberpunk 2077 has undergone numerous patches to fix bugs and performance issues, starting with emergency fixes in Patch 1.1. Patch 1.2 was a massive patch that introduced in-game changes, while Patch 1.3 added more fan-requested changes. Patch 1.31 was a minor patch that brought visual improvements, while Patch 1.5 was a massive patch for the launch of the game on next-gen consoles. It reworked many aspects of the perk tree, combat AI, driving, economy, and added new features like changing appearance, buying apartments, and fleshing out love interests. Patch 1.6 was the last patch for last-gen consoles and introduced new weapons, Gigs, appearance customisation, and cross-progression. It also launched REDmod for managing mods on PC.Overall, Cyberpunk 2077 is an ambitious and immersive game that offers a deep and complex world to explore, with a compelling story and memorable characters. While the game's initial release was plagued by technical issues, the updates and improvements have helped to address many of these problems, making the game a more enjoyable and polished experience. If you're a fan of open-world RPGs or cyberpunk fiction, this is a game that's definitely worth checking out.

author: V I R A L
review: Trying to play this game on a low spec computer be like:"Wake the ♥♥♥♥ up peasant, we got a PC to burn "

author: etneveL
review: I heard about the issues and criticism for this game, all of the backlash and disappointment about the final product back in 2020. To be honest, I really didn't cared about it much, I wanted to see how the game is now... and I have to tell you, that I'm flattered.First of all, the game has issues, like when the script sometimes doesn't go forward in certain situations, or the physics is weird most of the times, NPCs and vehicles doing silly things and appearing from thin air, a few times interacting is pain and of course, the driving is abysmal in the game, however you can get through all of them, find some kind of easy fix and you can also get use to the driving, too. It's not perfect indeed, but on the other side it has a great story, lot of interesting side missions and gigs, game mechanics which makes the gameplay more complex, the graphics looks amazing even in lower quality, and the soundtrack is fantastic. It's worth to explore Night City and not just focus on the main story missions, because you can miss a lot. Maybe the game deserved those criticism back then, I don't know really and don't care either, but playing it now is really great and I can't wait to see Edgerunners, because of it. There is no question that you should buy this one, even for the full price.

author: amb3rdawn
review: I bought this on GOG when it first came out, invested way too many hours and played the living hell out of the game. This game is so good, i bought it for steam too. I'm not a 'cyberpunk lore' person or a master of all video games, but this game was fantastic. The story lines, the missions, the characters, all of the choices and different paths. The beauty of the game on PC is unbelievable, and all i have a is 1660. I'd recommend this to anyone with a PC, console users... wait. Other than the console issues, this game is unbelievable and my favorite solo game of all time.

author: WICKED MANTICORE
review: Cyberpunk 2077 is an engaging experience unlike anything else. The open world mechanics are top notch and there is almost always something to do on the map. Furthermore, we have a large number of different game paths to choose from, all of which give you a very own experience of the story. Combined with the hundreds of weapons, augmentations, upgrades and side missions, there is plenty of material that will last over a long period of time. Cyberpunk 2077 will definitely be remembered as one of the most significant titles in the history of gaming media.

author: 𝖋𝖎𝖗𝖊𝖆𝖓𝖙𝖟
review: You see it all, heard it all day. A big disappointment if you expect a next-gen, futuristic GTA 5 clone with this game. It wasn't, and not Jesus second coming after all the hype. Aside from the dumb NPCs AI & glitches in the game, I see why many people are perceiving this as a complete s**t and garbage, starts comparing it with GTA and other games - if it wasn't because of the delay, the marketing behind the mega-hype as a game of the century, it would be just another fallout 76 or no man's sky at most.  The main quest, the storyline & the detailed open-world city are the only things the game shines right now - which I enjoyed so far, but everything else is in limbo and need to be fixed. In fact, that's the reason why I didn't give it a thumbs down; because being someone who enjoys good narrative-driven RPG games; it deserves a spot for the amazing storyline they put in the game; a Bladerunner type in a dystopian world with remarkable detail. With all the hype it's not perfect but I think it is not that bad either. I have enjoyed the quests without getting bored easily - even the side quests are unique and brilliantly crafted into the game. Voice acting is good but not a masterpiece, but really interesting characters that are suited for the main & side quests. Braindance is another great game feature that adds a whole new depth playing the main storyline. Inventory management, customization & crafting feels a lot similar to Outer Worlds. You can sell junks, disassemble parts and craft them to make a new item or upgrade other items in your inventory.  An array of weapons to customize & upgrade and the weapon's animation was smooth and has great attention to detail. Again the level of detail in the game's open-world city is something I have never seen in a long time - a dystopian sci-fi, mega-city genre. That's the only good thing that makes up the absurd amount of bugs/glitches it's throwing right now. It seems that the dev didn't have the time to make it a complete game like what it suppose to be, so yeah those thinking that this is a next-gen GTA clone, in a sci-fi open-world sandbox game will feel ripped-off paying full price, otherwise just enjoy the shallow but immersive open-world city without much interaction to do. However, if you like narrative-driven RPG games and the rest comes second, you surely gonna enjoy the hell out of it. Unless you had enough playing games like Deus-Ex many times maybe it won't entice you that much, but the detailed dystopian mega-city is a complete exception when comparing it in the same genre.Is it worth the price now? No. Maybe wait for the sale or best to get it in a few months when it is patched with all those issues completely addressed.7/10

author: Pedder
review: The world, the characters, the (main) story - game of the year.The gameplay and everything else - a f*cking disappointment- Bullet spongey enemies- Hacking gets boring really quick- Cyber-upgrade system for your body is boring and after almost 20 hours I am still rocking the basic implants because game changing ones are expensive as ♥♥♥♥ and you need to grind for it- Grind: they told us, that every side quest will be story driven with cool characters and so on? Yeah, think again. Most of the gigs are just a quick call by your fixer who tells you to go to place a and shoot/rescue/steal b, and you will get some money in the end. Thats it. You want to have the cool implants? Yeah boy, get ready to grind uninspired side missions for 20 hours first. Jeez what have they done?- The gear & clothing system: Just awful. Every 5 Minutes you need to sort your inventory and check if you have found something marginally better than you have equipped and scrap or sell the old stuff. You dont get attached to any gear at all. The clothes look like ♥♥♥♥, at one part my character looked like a garbage man. Also: You cant hunt special equipment down, you just need to hope that you find something which you want. I havent seen a single trader where I can buy special blueprints for my crafting. What the hell?- And then: The bugs, the glitches... yeah, its playable. Yeah, it feels amazing. But you feel abused at the same time somehow.

author: Squishy
review: On my first day in Cyberpunk, I...✓ made V look like a cyberskunk✓ scavenged a bunch of cyberjunk✓ crammed things in my cybertrunk✓ drank vodka and got cyberdrunk✓ fell asleep in my cyberbunk8.0085/10 for the immeasurable amount of nipples in this game

author: Daven
review: Before release: you could do literally everything in this nonpareil Night CityAfter delayed: you could find literally everybug in this content-cutting Night CityBut still, have faith in CDPR, since Wither 3 was in the same boat and got patched and polished after.

author: Morphinof
review: I'm really disapointed about the "choices matters" thing, choices you make does not matter as much as i was expecting. For example i had a non lethal build, killed nobody and limit myself to the base implant to stay human as much as possible but it doesn't change anything at the end of the game so why bother, just be a killing machine it's more fun... Chosing a path was a really good idea but beside giving you some dialog options it did not much, it's sad. The game is really beautiful and immersive and the build possibilities are great. The map is not as big as it seems even with verticality lots of buildings are not open, obviously it's not a problem, the world has a lot to offer but it's always frustating to see a closed door that leads nowere. The main quest is too short imo, side quests are awesome so don't pass on they're adding a lot to the game story.Bugs wise, yes it's very buggy but it's not unplayable, it's just immersion breaking.AI is very basic and broken, it's very hard to do something realistic in term of ai behavior but i'm sure that can and should be heavily improved in it's current state. Overall the game is very good and will get better and better with future patches / extension but disapointing on some aspects that were advertised. It was a very nice journey but short and with a bitter sweet after taste of "it wasn't ready yet". I still recommand it, i don't regret my purchase and will wait for improvements.

author: Gvauz
review: under all the bugs, glitches and performance issues hides an amazing game, I wish you discover it's beauty

review: no, i don't only like this game because keanu is in it. the pecker customization is where the real value comes from.

author: ©- The Silk Road 🌍
review: Hello everyone ;Certainly a lot of effort has been put into making and designing this game ;Eight years !With additional packages and free delay ;Delays that enticed everyone, even myself, with the release of seductive videos ;And finally we saw the release of the game ;The game, whether we are a launcher or a console, surprised everyone with its beautiful and unbelievable bugs ;The bugs and their number were formed as if they were intentional ;I don't know, maybe it wasn't ;Anyway, this game insulted all gamers and was disappointing ;All those who have been waiting for it for years and enduring its delays ;And now they had to watch the bugs ;I hope this never happens again, although I know it will happen again ;What Sony did was right, it makes us see games in the new generation that deserve the quality of this generation ;Finally , I hope that if Cyberpunk 3077 is to be released in the future, it will be better and focus more on rich content than content ... ;Better AI and fewer bugs and less latency ;Project bug ;Successful bug project ;>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>This game is still bad after many updates ;

author: killak1d
review: To begin with, I pre-ordered this game, so you can consider me to be a clown, but... I did really enjoy the game. The most interesting thing is that I have almost had no bugs, maybe 2 or 3. I dont know what does this game look like at its current state, but it was playable enough for me to get my positive emotions. So I can highly recommend the purchase.The atmosphere, characters, the plot, the Night City itself (especially at a night time (how surprising, huh?)), everything is beautiful. Decent amount of builds to play around - you can be a hacker, a stealth player, shoot everyone around, slice everything that's moving with you katana, etc.As some people have already mentioned - your choises do not have any consequences except your endings, but there're some important side storylines that you'll like for sure, I promise.People say this game is a buggy mess, but on release there were few hundreds of thousand players and atm the game has steam online around 20k players.P.S. Dont skip the side storyline with  .P.S.S. Dont mess with Johnny Silverhand!

author: Spyce
review: So after playing 100% of the game, This is review.Story - 9/10 I love this story one of my favorites.Voice acting - 8/10 really good voice acting but male V can sound stiff most times.World - 8/10 The world is crazy. I can see why alot of time went to that. Makes my eyes open wide to see this world they worked on for so long.Graphics - 9/10 One of the best looking games i ever seen.Gun Gameplay - 7/10 I like the odd types of weapons but needs balance changes.Melee Gameplay - 5/10 Melee sucks early-mid game, you get oneshot most of the time on very hard. feels like it meant for a 3rd person game. But late game I love to go into a fight and swing my bat and kill everything.Car Gameplay - 6/10 Ok so i feel like they forgot about cops and car paints, more racing, and would love to tune my cars. But I like the driving alot like GTA.SO IN ALL I WOULD GIVE THIS GAME 7/10! ITS A GOOD GAME BUT NEEDS SOME WORK AND THEY SAID THEY ARE GOING TO FIX IT AND IF THEY DO FIX ALL THE WEIRD STUFF I WOULD LOVE TO MOVE MY SCORE UP!

author: medoras_obi
review: The Storytelling is amazing - i also love the character progression. My 1st playthrough took me 90 hours.Inventory, looting and such could be better, a lot of things need some patching, sure. Hoping to see improvement over the next few months.Ran decent on my i7-9700k and rtx2070, but not with rtx on.A game that is different and truly unforgettable. What an amazing world, sound and ambience!

author: Vault Boy
review: Steam would not let me ask for a refund, which is a shame. I never expected Cyberpunk to be like this, not after the entire Witcher series and the way CD Red created an amazing trilogy. A severe lack of features that should be present on any modern open world game, underwhelming rpg systems, really bad performance and an insulting amount of bugs and glitches kill the game right from the begining. At this point, i doubt CD Red can actually save the game

author: Draqua
review: It's like receiving a cake on your birthday with slices already missing.The world is stunning visually and it does have a nice main story with a few flaws, however my biggest issues as of now;-cut content-MANY bugs-boring/non responsive AI-Constant phone calls that cannot be ignored-An overall non interactive world.-VERY limited character customization, cannot be changed after.-Very limited if not no visual body modifications (in a world where that is one of the most important things, how can it fall so short?)-police spawn around you no matter where you are if you're catching heatI honestly feel lied to and missing so many features that are either cut or bugged is inexcusable,My ray of hope is a year ahead full of patches and/or dlc that will fix things up but as of now i cannot recommend this game

author: Zettai
review: CDProjekt has done it again! (At least on PC)A game like no other one, where Night City engulfs you to a point where nothing will take your eyes from the screen. That is, of course, if you have a good enough PC to run it properly. I cannot wait to go back to Night City every day after work - I cannot wait to do another quest or lose myself in this amazing and decadent city. I have spent literally hours just walking around looking at the walls, the NPC's and the environment. If you are a fan of Cyberpunk, the tabletop RPG, and have a good computer, you will definitely enjoy this one.  Otherwise, wait a couple of months and you will most likely get a much stable game, although I have to say I have not experienced any game breaking bugs, only one minor bug in more than 40 hours of gameplay.

author: Steve Harrington
review: In the current state, take it, provided that you really want a cyberpunk. If there is no such need, wait until the end of spring / summer and take at a discount.I played the game myself 2 times, watched 3 prologues. The best thing here is the atmosphere and the plot, about 25-30 hours. But unfortunately, this is not a release, but a demo, because the open world is dead, here is the most terrible police in the open world that I have seen, and besides, it was very disappointing that you cannot see how the clothes look on the hero while you can't buy it. (And of course there are a lot of bugs, I had critical plot bugs also!)One gets the feeling that the game was in a great hurry, and many aspects suffered. In its current state, it is 7/10.Why do I recommend you ask? Hmm ... I think the developers are obliged to clean it up, as it is a matter of their honor. And I believe that something interesting will come out of this.

author: Crimson
review: Don't waste your money and time on it.

author: Genz
review: Fallout 76 all over again...

author: Askrad
review: not bad tho

author: Sunny Senpai
review: So far the game looks great and has a lot of potential but the visual glitches and low fps ruins it. The graphical settings are mostly related to Volumetric fog and shadows. Even on the lowest settings possible I barely get 30~40 fps. I have a GTX 1060 6 GB which comes under recommended spec for the game, but they don't mean anything nowadays. Surprisingly it never crashed and despite the low fps, it doesn't have any micro stutters.These are all the problems that I could find in my hour and a half of gametime, there could be more that I'm not aware of.Deus Ex fans such as myself can enjoy playing this game instead of waiting for the final part of Adam's trilogy as I can already see some similarities such as mail interfaces, stealth, etc. in CPI'm sure CDPR will fix these issues in the coming days but until then, If I were you I would avoid the game because it ruins the experience. I tried to ignore the bugs but they occur more and more frequently and it eventually breaks the immersion for you. So far the game feels unfinished to me and I have no clue how everyone is playing this in it's current state because it just feels disappointing only to wait all these years to play something that's hot unfinished garbage.I just bought the game to see if my potato can handle it but since it can't, I'm gonna have to refund it for now and will pick it up again when I build a new rig (whenever that is)EDIT: Spelling, and turns out this game supports family share!

author: Fomin
review: This is NOT the game which was shown to "influencers" and later posted on Youtube as a "gameplay" reveal. That game was a purely fake demo created solely for hype. This game is an incredibly bad attempt to imitate that game made in a short amount of time by a small team of inexperienced devs (many of the best devs at CDPR already having quit before getting a chance to work on any game other than  which was OBVIOUSLY not made by the same people who made this garbage-fire of a product.)This isn't ; this is  which is to say, a low-effort, second-rate knock-off rushed out to cash in on hype for something else (which in this case was a fake demo for a game which didn't actually exist.) This is literally the most disappointing game I have ever bought... and I wasn't even expecting it to be good. As you can see from this group I created before release, I thought that this would be a mediocre AAA game that wouldn't even measure up to Far Cry.... and I was still incredibly disappointed.(BTW, if you bought the game hoping for adult content, you are REALLY going to be disappointed. In my time in the game, the closest I came to a love scene was being able to see these fully-clothed middle-aged housewives dancing in the window of a locked building I couldn't even enter.)This doesn't even measure up to the worst of what you would expect in a AAA game. This is basically a terrible indie game that isn't even as good as a number of indie games like  and  which I literally purchased for less than $1.I actually made a list of good indie games, most of them dirt cheap, and Cyberpunk wouldn't make the list even if CDPR were a plucky indie dev because it would be an insult to compare anything that is actually good to this low-effort abomination.At this point I am going to cut to a video which does an exceptionally good job of explaining why you will probably have more fun installing the game than playing it. I have played open-world games since Morrowind and GTA 3 and this is the most barren, lifeless world I have ever encountered. A cramped spaceship full of zombies like in Dead Effect feels more interesting than a city of drab, minimalist buildings that you can't enter and are thus effectively just an ugly map painting while procedurally generated NPCs literally pop into view with AI so bad that they actually make the city feel LESS alive. To be frank, you shouldn't have traffic in a game in which you can't be bothered to give the cars the ability to change lanes or back up. You shouldn't put NPCs that move into your game if they just walk back and forth aimlessly with terrible animations in a way which emphasizes the fact that they are NOT people or indeed, even smart enough to survive as earthworms.You should NOT put a wanted system in your game if your police AI is literally too stupid to follow the player (something that better games managed on the PS2) and NO you cannot work around that by making the police magically appear behind the player and shoot him in the back of the head while at the same time, every door and elevator in the city stops working to prevent the player from taking cover inside.This was obviously NOT made by the same people who made The Witcher 3 (many of those people joined to work on this game, found that CDPR wasn't actually making it, made the Witcher 3 instead and then quit in disgust at how badly CDPR's game development was being managed.)The quests in this game aren't good enough for a modern MMO much less a single-player RPG. That isn't hyperbole. The last quest I did in  (Mistress of the Lake) was more open-ended (allowing the player to choose a side leading to one of two very different follow-up quests) more interesting, and felt more meaningful than ANYTHING I encountered in my more than 12 hours with CDPR 2076.In CDPR 2076, the game starts out with dialogue and choices so pointless that I found that not only did my "choices" not make a real difference; they literally didn't even affect what people said to me in some cases. The only good memory I have from this game is being able to pet an ugly cat in an alley... and the game took even that away from me by making that cat disappear after the boring mission was over.If CDPR didn't finish the game, why should I? I HAVE finished plenty of other games including multiple entries in  all but the most recent expansions in  etc. I did NOT finish  and that game is FAR better than this one.This game is so bad that I can spend literally hundreds of hours in other games but can't force myself to endure more than 12 hours of this blatant rip-off.If you are thinking of buying this game, try  (with the latest mods it actually looks and sounds better than  or any one of the other literally hundreds of readily available games that are better than this one. This isn't even the best RPG on GoG. In fact, having this game on GoG is an insult to most of the other games that are sold there.There's only one good thing to do with this game...

author: ellie
review: Specs:CPU: i5-6600KGPU: GTX 1060 6GBThis game is not playable with these specs. I could not achieve 60fps even on the lowest settings. If your specs are similar to this, do not purchase this game unless they optimize it further. You will not be able to achieve 60fps.

author: Rhowan91
review: As someone whose favorite game is The Witcher 3 and someone who has a lot of respect and admiration for CDPR, this game is truly mediocre as hell.It felt incredibly cheap, like an offbrand open world game. It also doesn't do anything new. Once I finished the main story and a few side quests I had absolutely no desire to play any further, or explore any further - and I am someone who loves seeking out every inch of a game world, collecting every collectable, and completing every side quest. Valhalla is holding my attention significantly more than this game did.Gameplay was ok. Shooting was ok. Most of it was just ok. Nothing stood out. Melee was incredibly shallow. I spent most of the time playing with the mantis blades and there's a massive collection of ONE single execution animation and it throws a cog into the flow of combat, which became annoying very quickly.Animations are terrible, especially when a character dies. They seem to like to stick a leg up in the air for some reason, and turn incredibly stiff.There's a video on YouTube I watched today that inspired me to write this. It's basically a comparison between Red Dead 2 and Cyberpunk which highlights an array of differences and how each game displays/performs each feature. It truly highlighted how mediocre this game is.Better luck next time CDPR, hope the next Witcher game is a significant step up from this.

author: Lockpicking
review: Good game with a great story, but needs polishing.

author: ultra
review: verypog

author: Far
review: Cyberpunk 2077 is like having a window that looks out over a serene, picturesque view of the mountains but that window is covered in grime that prevents you from enjoying the view. Every little detail of Cyberpunk deserves to be witnessed, but it's hard to enjoy it with the current technical issues. Wait for a couple months of patching from CDPR and it will be much better!

author: Dr. Gabersen
review: It pains me so to write this review, but I have to warn people.Normally I don't write reviews on games until A) I beat them or B) I've experienced most of what the game has to offer (Specifically in multiplayer/games you play multiple times).Unfortunately, I have to make an exception for Cyberpunk.To start, when the game works, it's an absolute blast, I enjoy the gunplay, night city, and story as a whole. While it's not perfect, it's well done. Unfortunately, this is only the case if the game is working. I ran into an issue today where I could not load my save files, or my screen would just go black and never load the game. I waited over 30 mins just to be sure it wasn't loading incredibly slowly. I took to the internet to figure out what my issue was and noticed tons of people were having the same issue. After trying all the various things people suggested, it still didn't work. Eventually, I just tried loading older saves until a save like 7 saves back finally worked and I lost over an hour and a half of progress. Not only that, but I've had MULTIPLE missions completely bug out on me making them in-completable, leading me to have to restart them. That's not even mentioning the dozens if not hundreds of graphical glitches that constantly occur giving me a new crazy thing to laugh at every couple of minutes. In a full price $60 game, this is un-acceptable and I can not in good faith recommend this game. Wait 6 months to a year at least for this game to come out of beta. This game has huge potential and I will update my review when/if the game ever gets to a stable state and when/if I beat the game to give my thoughts in more detail.The game when everything is working- 8/10Game in current state- 4/10

author: Tresha
review: has been added to my list of Favorite Games. From certain  point of view I liked it a bit more than The Witcher 3 - map is not as big, which is a huge plus for me, and it is a lot more colorful: neon signs, ads, NPCs with all sorts of clother and chrome, gangs, markets... Main story, however, is a lot shorter! At least it felt that way for me, but hey, that's just me - I would love to be in that town a lot longer. But don't get sad just yet! The hours lost on the "short" story have been compensated with map exploration and character side quests, which are a MUST since they are well written and interesting.  soundtrack is a blast too! I still can't believe they hired Refused band to make few original (and epic) songs. You can lose hours just listening to radio in your vehicle.What surpised me the most, however, was the fact of how smoothly the game ran for me, on semi old PC. All I had to do was drop my resolution to 1920x1080 and I could use mostly high settings! So you could say I was one of the lucky ones.I really hope they will add more content, and not just DLC story - I'd love to see customization packs (full on chrome body, lets go!), more vehicles, additional map content (like bounty hunting). And I hope to see the day of Multiplayer!Overall, the game itself could use more POLISHing (ding) and I don't see what would stop them - The Witcher 3 had similar issues at start, but they worked hard on it. Hope they will make an optimization gem out of this one too.If your PC can run it, you should definitely play it. So plug in your cyberware, put on your leather jackets, we got a city to burn!PS. , thanks for this game, I had the best week of none stop, sleepless fun!

author: OikZ
review: Horrible Performance on any settings with a 1070 and 6700k.Couldn't get 60fps in most of the first 60-90 minutes with any settings (including 50% res scale at 720p and lowest settings/lowest FOV), either hitting a CPU bottleneck or a GPU bottleneck even on the latest drivers. Most of my game time was spent at around 40FPS with the above settings.Found 2 T-Posing characters within the first 30 minutes.No crashes though.Wait for a patch.EDIT:For those who think that I might've been CPU limited, I did run afterburner for a lot of that and was mainly GPU limited at the lower framerates and only got CPU limited at around 70 or higher FPS in small rooms.

author: Endless ∞
review: is an engaging experience unlike anything else. The open world mechanics are top notch and there is almost always something to do on the map. Furthermore, we have a large number of different game paths to choose from, all of which give you a very own experience of the story. Combined with the hundreds of weapons, augmentations, upgrades and side missions, there is plenty of material that will last over a long period of time. It will definitely be remembered as one of the most significant titles in the history of gaming media.⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

author: Khoon
review: I didn't think that I would be playing this when I heard it's coming out 'cause FPS games aren't really what I'm looking for. Decided to pick this up after knowing it focused more on RPG. Yep! Definitely is. Been playing nothing but this one in two days, lots of side quests but they are not repetitive like other games out there (you know which one I'm talking about).The game is heavy on the content so pick this up if this is your cup of tea. Otherwise, if you're looking for a game that focused more on action, this one not going to do the job. Other than that, I'm totally immersed in Night City. You can do a lot of missions without touching your guns, perfect for a scaredy-cat like me. You can also approach a mission in many ways, open the door by force or using technology skill, going from the front door or climbing on top of the roof,... Although they spent a lot of time working on this project, I guess they're more focused on the story. A lot of bugs, which could bring your experience down. A simple reload may do the job, but yeah, they definitely need to fix it in the near future.

author: vertiN
review: Make sure to download the new nvidia drivers before playing this game. When you go to install them, skip express install and click custom install instead. Then click clean install. It will delete all old leftover drivers and do a cleaner install. No crashes with 2080ti 9900k 1440p. Average 60fps. Good game so far besides some small visual glitches.

author: FSOOOLKSA
review: في تحسن كبير بعد التحديث 1.2 اللعبه صارت اكثر استقرار لكن لا زال الابتمايزيشن مو الافضل القلتشات اغلبها اختفى لكن لا زالت في قلتشات بس ما تأثر على تقدمك الذكاء الصناعي ما تحسن لكن اللعبه اقدر الان اختمها وصارت قابله للعب بعكس التحديثات السباقه لكن مراح اغير التقييم من باب الفائده  وان لا زال يحتاج لها شغل بس الان افضل بكثير من السابق

author: GodMustBeAFK
review: I've played about an hour of actual gameplay and ive got to say this may be the most fun ive had with a game since the witcher 3, and thats saying something. This game is absolutely amazing in every single way. Visuals are breathtaking, story seems amazing, soundtrack is JAW DROPPING, combat is really good, stealth works well, rpg elements are intense and in depth. so far, best game ive played  for around 6 years. no doubt. buy it and realise.Edit: After playing for 40 more hours after my initial review, i can safely say this game lands in that "special" category. It just has that something special. Walking around the city with the sound cranked up and graphics tuned up, absolutely breathtaking experience. its NOT without its issues, but most people are acting like the game is just straight up bad because of issues a lot of other less impressive games get away with ALL of the time. Yes it has some problems, but im certainly not  going to be able to say they even remotely ruined my experience because thats just shallow and pathetic at best and straight up trolling at worst. Glitches and dull NPC AI does not make this game even close to being bad. Because if we were judging every game off its launch state and bad AI, almost every game to release ever would be "terrible" as some people so happily and readily say about this game, with 0.5Hrs play time logged on their account. All i'll finish with saying is, do NOT allow any of the negativity deter you from buying this game because i guarantee you, if your PC can handle it at settings YOU can personally accept and enjoy, and you like RPGs with immersive settings, then there is absolutely NO WAY you wont have a good time with this game. Anyone telling you otherwise is speaking out of the dark place between their lower cheeks. People giving it negative reviews after playing 30 mins are the same people that expect the game to run well on xbox one hardware lmao.  GET A BETTER PC MY FRIENDS. it's extremely demanding. Dont try to run it at settings that make it a bad experience and maybe you wont have a bad experience.EDIT NUMBER 2: After having played MANY MANY more hours of this game, reaching 100 percent completion of the content, i have slightly changed my opinion on how glowing a review i would give it. My goal was always to hit 100 percent, did it on each Witcher game. This game, unlike the Witcher games, fought against me EVERY step of the way. Countless crashes, completely broken quests, losing hours of progress multiple times, glitches that slow progress to a halt and many, many headaches. I finally achieved my goal, with sheer perseverance and many work-arounds, i finally got there. Instantly uninstalling the game after doing this felt like a weight off my shoulders, which is a very bad thing. I do also have that usual feeling of accomplishment when completing a behemoth task such as this, akin to Witcher 3. However i am also left with a dirty taste in my mouth, which is a shame. I won't edit my initial reviews and edit, because i want people to know the ride they're in for if they plan on investing a considerable amount of time into the game. It starts out like ana amazing honey moon period, deteriorates into something akin to a 20 something years old marriage, warts and all. Would i still recommend this game? Absolutely. If nothing else, for the AMAZING story alone. And i do mean amazing. However, if you're like me, enjoy getting sucked into a universe, bleeding it dry for content, maybe that recommendation would change. Just consider whether or not you want to sacrifice your initial enjoyment of the game for the achievement of saying you've beaten all it has to offer. Wish i had, but hindsight is 20-20 as they say. How were we to know the game would be this broken. We only had the Witcher series to go off in terms of expectations, and well, this game is a far cry from the quality of those in terms off polish and performance. Story: 10/10   Graphics: 9/10   Sound: 9.5/10  Gameplay (bugs considered): 7/10  Gameplay (at face value):  8.5/10   Performance and overall polish:  4/10.

author: Mert Günhan
review: Cyberpunk 2077 is an achievement in game making.

author: nekomimikickflip
review: should've delayed another year

author: Xtremecole
review: The best pile of SH*T I've ever indulged in!!Update:Game is shaping up, is a lot more impressive now! Enjoying it with smiles :D

author: Dugi
review: One of the best games i've ever played (core game not counting bugs) but would i recommend you to play the game in this state? short answer would be no, in my opinion just wait 3/4 months so they can polish the game more (like CDPR should have in the first place) and then enjoy the game.this is an amazing game that i will go back to to play again with better hardware and when the game is truly ready to be played.

author: Sнagzy
review: CD Projekt Red, a company that claims to be "the industry's leader in creating role-playing games". Where do i begin, for 8 years i waited and waited putting all my hopes into a company that gets credited way beyond what they deserve. They have only ever made one game franchise which in my opinion, just like their recent work of art, is another overhyped clunky pain of  a game that you have to sit through and experience. Performance wise, i went out and bought a rtx 3080 double the retail price just because i wanted to sit back, relax and play my most anticipated game of the decade.  The game barely runs on 60 fps even with DLSS assigned to performance mode. The game is full of bugs but not to the point where its unplayable, if you are a patient person and you are willing to restart the mission every now and then because the objective wont show on the map or some of the characters wont spawn then don't worry you are in for hell of a ride. CD Projekt Red, next time do us a favour and don't bite off more than you can chew. Coming when its ready. Yea right.

author: Dakeyraz
review: Despite the patches, there is still a TON of bugs in this game. Though slightly less game breaking ones, and optimisation is better.But the core of the game hasn't been improved, and that would still be an issue, even if all bugs were patched!The best part of this game, is really J.Silverhand, he is the one reason you might play.Everything else is either mediocre or subpar.Menus are mostly a mess, I never access what I want/need right away, and you to go through submenus, with poor readilibty.Gunplay is.Loot is on a somewhat of a looter/shooter style, but with a more RPG like game, it does not fit too well.The map is "big", but very empty, and you have only horizontal means of travel, that feel very limited.Shops are very scattered, and I found them not be worth it.Crafting feel bland, and you spend way too much time disassembling stuff.I should mention that due to the loot system, you end up constantly changing your Armors. And many, many of them look like trash. That doesn't help with feeling attached to your character.Story is very linear, and choices barely matter. (Out of all you can do, there is like 1 or 2 side quests that have an impact. The rest if just filler)TL;DR : 5/10, not terribly good, not terrible bad.

author: jmamma
review: This is an early-access game. An unfinished mess in parts.Broken or non-existent AI and bad combat mechanics. Bugs galore, dialogue mistakes, missing/cut content.The elements of the game that are finished are stunning, this includes the design of the open world and set pieces in the main story.  But these only serve as reminders of what could have been, which is greatly disappointing.

author: alvaroL0L
review: I was skeptical with the futuristic settings because those are not my cup of tea but I tried it because I love story rich games. I must admit I enjoyed this game more than I expected it. Pros :+ Various playstyle options. You can play this game as a netrunner (hacker) or a ninja or a madman with a gun. The game offers you to use your own preferred play style and they're all fun. Consumers love more options.+ Great story. One of the strongest selling points from this game. I am not going to elaborate here, but I love the narrative.  + Great characters. IMO this is what I like the most, the main characters are well written. There are some characters that always gets me excited when they're on screen. + Great voice acting. IMO female V sounds amazing and her voice fits to the narrative. Also, don't forget we have Keanu Reeves and he did an amazing job as Johnny Silverhand.+ Interesting side quests. Even though some of them are disturbing. + A lot of weapons available in the game. What I really like about weapons in this game is that they don't feel copy and paste unlike other shooter games.+ Ray Tracing and DLSS support. Great for RTX graphics card users.Cons :- Bugs still exist. T-pose and characters passing through walls. - Somewhat short main story line. You could complete the main story line only within 1-2 days. But that would be much less enjoyable unless you hate the game. IMO you need to play all of the side quests in Cyberpunk 2077 at least once. - Meh physics for a triple A title.- Night City feels not so lively. The NPCs don't really feel "alive" unlike for example Red Dead Redemption 2. - Game performance is not something to be proud of. It is cpu and gpu demanding. Conclusion : Even with the lackluster physics and existing bugs, it is very much possible to enjoy this game. It is a great game and I really enjoyed it but I wouldn't call this a flawless masterpiece (only in some part but not overall).

author: Attrition
review: In the sea of reviews, this is just another drop in the bucket - but I am enjoying cyberpunk 2077, and you might as well. Think GTA, but set in the future. The main storyline is interesting and conceptually engaging. The combat and stealth mechanics are strong enough to be entertaining, but this game is primarily about feeling immersed in a dystopian future world, and it's mostly successful. There are rough bits that are unfortunate here and there, but if you don't get too distracted, the broad picture is compelling.

author: du
review: How I'd describe CD PROJEKT RED's most ambitious project ever? A perplex dynamic action full of surprises.I'll update this review after I beat the game, however, in only 5 hours of gameplay and a couple of missions/side missions done you can feel what this game is about. CDPR's precious ability to throw you in a world never seen before and making you feel you're already belong there, dejavu-ish, is the heart of this game. Night City is a dynamic ecosystem forged by a huge amount of micro regions, the diversity of different people/culture/economic patterns are insanely well-portraited by the polish studio.It's expected that a game of this magnitude would have problems, due the tight schedule. Annoying medium gameplay bugs and perfomance issues(low fps) are the negative point. I'm certain CDPR will fix it. Just a tip for Nvidia users: Try to go to GeForce Experience and optimize the game settings, I've gained ~20 fps after I optimized.(To be continued...)Game idea: ExcelentStory Telling: ExcelentAmbient/Level of Detail: AmazingGameplay: Acceptable, could be better (current with bugs and perfomance issues)Perfomance: Acceptable-ish, wait for some future patches to get better

author: Paul
review: This is a nice game. I am playing it on GeForce Now in the cloud! The story is nice but the shooting is quite hard.

author: Nisox
review: me likey

author: TO BURBLE AND PINE
review: Game has improved exponentially.This games makes you feel something which i can't describe. It's a mix of sadness and anger and regret The games writing deserves the award it gets and i hope the DLC will continue V's story. Night city takes everything from you and you definitely feel it, The tragic story of V should be experienced and played. The endings of this game did not pull any punches. This was a human story with true-to-life conclusions. The end credit tunes punctuated that perfectly - beautiful and harrowing.No matter what ending you get, even the one where you leave Night City with a slim chance of hope, the consequences follow you - and may still consume you yet.Night City always wins.The customisation is very good. Making your own character is lots of fan and you can truly embrace the cyberpunk look. This game has changed in a very good way and CDPR have kept their promise to improve it. I truly hope we get more of V as its a heavily complex character.Critics can say what they want. This was a phenomenal game and a great effort by CDPR. The scope of it is huge and the side quests are nothing like Ubisoft open worlds. They all involve doing something different. If only Ubisoft spent this much time on their AC series instead of cobbling together the familiar revenge plot main story with totally irrelevant and repetitive side quests to pad out the play time their games would rate much higher. I really hope CDPR bring out the extra time they said they cut as DLCs. Seriously. Go listen to the soundtrack of this game and truthfully tell me it doesn't feel like someones taken everything from you. The music while talking to Johnny, The credits theme and then going onto Never fade away. On top of that What AAA Game touches suicide? This game touches on suicide and the consequences of choosing that. What happens to the people around them? What happens to your friends after you've gone. How will it make people feel. CDPR have huge balls to cover that very sensitive topic and it's not shallow in anyway. You feel the weight of a characters suicide and the characters feel the weight of- if you choose it; your own suicide. What a masterpiece. I could go on for hours about this game but i'll leave it there.10/10Goodbye and never stop fighting, I'll be waiting for you, V.

author: -Le0n-
review: One of the best games I have ever played. Completed my 1st playthrough and just the main storyline after so many people were trying to spoil the end. This game is not disappointing at all. Every game has it's bugs and glitches, so besides that, this game is truly amazing in all the aspects. Story is good, Graphics are good, Music/soundtracks are good, Voice acting is good, Has many memorable characters, the game is packed with so many little things to do and hardly saw 2 same npc in a frame. The details are eye catching, Don't know about RTX but even without RTX I loved the lighting and shadows and reflections.On the serious note, this game is far away from a perfect game. Story is good but really doesn't feel great. Open world is filled with so many details and npcs but they all are just there as eyecandy. The AI is terrible and gameplay is super easy that even a 7 years old kid can play it. The story feels rushed and could've made better with character building and something worth fighting for. The awesome characters and voice actors did their job so great that you almost don't pay attention to other things. As a fan of Single player game, this game surly does feel good to play for fun.Even after so many years of development there are many noticeable bugs are present in game, Which I am sure in next few updates will be fixed. This game is worth the wait and price IMO. 7.5/10 for me. Will give 9 if they fix the bugs.Specs - i7 6700k @ 4.5GHz  , GTX 1070  , 16GB ramSettings - High/Medium @ 1080p........... 45-55 FPS avg.UPDATE - After the Reddit user's performance fix, I got 20-30% boost in overall performance on High settings. Smooth gameplay, fast loading and no crashes.

author: [CM]McKnight
review: Friends...I come bearing bad news. I wanted to be a believer. I wanted to be part of the hype crew. I wanted to hang out with Keanu and do some Cyberpunk ♥♥♥♥. I wanted this game to be the end all salvation for all of gamekind. I wanted this game to be the *one* and we can retire from our lives during COVID. I joined all of you at the end of the hype train. My only hope is that Internet Historian will review this game for what it is... But enough of me... This is about *you* right? That's why you're here. You're wondering why you pre-ordered this game. You're wondering why the world around you doesn't make sense? It's okay friend. MacDaddy is here for you.I won't spend too much time on bugs because the meme material on YouTube makes Fallout 76 look like the most successful launch game of it's time. They exist. If people tell you they only exist on consoles they're lying. Granted the PS4 console gamers have already committed Seppuku (Peace be upon them) and the PC version is not as buggy that doesn't matter. The bugs are game & immersive breaking. Let's talk about the game itself. Let's pretend the bugs never existed because that's all that people talk about is bugs bugs bugs. If I could summarize this game in the least exhaustive way possible... this would be it: The game consists of you doing nothing but grinding from one side mission to another. You will have MORE than your fill in side missions, bounties, and police situations. That's your immersion. That's all you're going to get. You could easily clock 70 hours of grinding these boring side missions. This is how this translates to me... the developers had to ask themselves how do we immerse the players into our Cyberpunk environment? How do we get them *involved* in the world and to bear the consequences of those decisions? SIDE MISSIONS! They developed this elaborate, beautifully crafted city and the only thing worth doing are these boring side missions. This is their way of pulling you into the world. If you get the itch to stop, and decide you want to shoot a few pedestrians with that newly modified gun of yours... better think again... get prepared to have an army of cops spawn LITERALLY on top of you. Every time I wanted to break the linear boundaries of the game (side missions / main story line) I was severely punished for it. The game was telling me this is not Cyberpunk is meant to be played. Why even make an open world game at all? You will not experience GTA like chases from the cops. You will not experience a gradual wanted system that pulls you deeper into the world of the game. You will have an army of cops spawn right on your head and end all the fun for you.Why even have a WANTED system at all if we can never engage with it? The WANTED system means instant death... yeah sure you could bug out the cops and drive around the block and *poof* they're all gone... you could walk into a building, and walk out and *poof* they disappeared!  What is the point of that? I want the cops to chase me, I want a fighting chance, I want to be a Cyberpunk in Cyberpunk. But it's not just the wanted system... comparable to GTA this game lacks every successful immersive element Rockstar has going for their games. Why is this important? Because Cyberpunk had the opportunity to not only build upon those elements, but deliver something far more fresh and advanced. You won't own properties in Cyberpunk. You won't be able to store vehicles and customize them. Even driving vehicles in the city is janky and unrealistic. You won't be able to customize your character's look outside the introduction menu. GTA is a perfect control in our thought experiment here regarding the immersive elements (or really lack of) that Cyberpunk offers. There is nothing that PULLS you into your character and game apart from these missions. I can't even believe they're entertaining multiplayer without addressing the lack of immersive features. Besides the mentioned features... what about the NPCs? The NPCs that exist in Cyberpunk are nothing more than filler people. They are an illusion made for you to believe you are playing in an environment filled with life and activity. I was convinced of this when I first started playing. As soon as you begin to interact with the NPCs all that immersion falls apart so what do you do to stay immersed? Don't interact with the NPCs at all! There is a great YouTube video showing the comparison between Cyberpunk NPCs and GTA found on 'Bearing Game Asia' YouTube channel and I highly recommend you watch it. To summarize my thoughts here... the game is OK as linear questing experience. Side missions will sort-of keep you occupied, and having fun (kind of). It's just a shame you are doing these side missions in an empty world. The main story line is fun and engaging. The cut scenes are great. The game is visually pleasing all around. Otherwise... as an immersive open world experience? This game fails completely. So when you factor that all you have left to do is drive from A to B in an empty bug filled world that leaves you with a very mediocre experience. You'll snab a few 'wow' moments where the city visually encapsulates you but you won't enjoy that experience once you interact with it. 'Look but don't touch' should be the gameplay motto. Here is my advice to those of you on the fence... Wait. Sure they'll clean up the bugs eventually, but that won't be enough. Wait for the modding community to get involved and invested. If an open world world experience isn't important to you than go right ahead and purchase Cyberpunk. Otherwise think of all the amazing ways the modding community expanded the immersiveness found in Skyrim, Fallout, and GTA. My hope is that the community will revitalize this game as it was meant to be played: an open world role-playing environment.

author: H y s t
review: Cyberpunk has an astonishing story, a dark dystopian future where the internet has evolved and integrated within us. Playing as V you choose what becomes of your future, with an amazing support character played by Keanu Reeves aka Johnny Silverhand. You and silver hand take on the mega-corps making your way to the top and if you're lucky, be the king of Night City. Playing V you have multiple choices. Within those choices, you the player alter the timeline and the outcome of the end of the game. Cyberpunk had an unplayable state, but over time, the game has become one of those unique experiences that you'll never forget. Cyberpunk has been expanded by modders and changes the way the game is played and gives it a facelift, making the game's experience all the better.🔆 - 📜 Story✅ Lore to its story☐ Compelling story☐ Decent story☐ What was I doing again??☐ No Story here🔆 - 🩻 Difficulty☐ Easy☐ Light☐ Moderate✅ Hard☐ Crushing🔆 - 🦾 Grind☐ No Grind☐ The Grind is fun to the gameplay☐ Competitive Ranks/Upgrading to excel✅ Much needed to thrive☐ Might as well live in this game🔆 - 🌇 Graphics☐ Realism✅ Beautiful☐ Decent☐ Could be better☐ 8-bit Gaming🔆 - 🕐 Game Time Hour☐ Contentful☐ Short☐ Average✅ Long☐ Time flys when you're having fun🔆 - 🧱 Bugs☐ Don't see that every day☐ Some bugs here and there✅ Fixable at times☐ Needs work gets in the way of gameplay☐ Uninstall and wait or get a refund

author: Jigen
review: First, a forewarning. While Cyberpunk 2077 is a very good game, you must have a high end PC as of 2020 (for me, an i9-9900k, a fast NVMe SSD, and a 3080) to be able to appreciate the visuals with good performance.Of course, there's also lots of visual bugs, but as of the time of this review I have not experienced a single gameplay affecting bug nor have I experienced any crash. I've seen probably a half dozen T-poses, and a fair number of flickering objects or things that pop out of view when they shouldn't. But nothing that has hampered any element of gameplay.The world is beautifully realized, delivering fully on a full 3D explorable world of the likes of Blade Runner, Back to the Future 2's future Hill Valley, and other 80's visions of the near future. The design is nearly impeccable. No name NPCs occasionally look far better than main characters of other contemporary games. It looks that amazing. It also poses absolutely cutting edge technology with raytraced reflections, shadows, and global illumination simultaneously.However, the depth of the world experience isn't equal to other, smaller-scoped games. You won't find a lot of interesting, worthwhile secrets. You won't find mini games. The arcade units sitting around aren't playable. You can't strike up a conversation with a random, awesome looking NPC. When you're not on a mission there isn't a lot to do.The missions are mostly excellently designed, each offering moderately sized Deus Ex-like microcosms. Most have multiple different physical, dialog, and tactical routes. This is where the meat of the fun from the gameplay comes from. The polish on the missions varies, ranging from reasonable to some of the most polished experiences in a video game to date. That said, the polish is indeed spotty, some missions leaving you disappointed and others enthralled.Mechanically, most of the systems are engaging and interesting, except firearms can sometimes be very dull. The firearms experience being the weakest mechanics of the title, there are ways to make it more fun. However, the driving, melee, inventory, crafting, equipment, leveling, dialog, and other systems are all more engaging and add more to the experience.Cyberpunk 2077 isn't my favorite game of 2020, it's not profound like Disco Elysium, it's not up to par with the original Deus Ex. That said, provided you have a great PC, it's one of the best games of 2020, and the most vivid video game realization of a cyberpunk world yet.

author: ratburn-san
review: cannot recommend the game as is. AI and driving are terrible- cars will just be stopped on the road with the NPCs idling in their vehicles, creating motionless lines of cars. the NPC aiming, movement, and reaction to violence is extremely poor. NPCs tuck in the fetal position with delayed/overlapping screaming audio instead of reacting to your actions on them or around them. driving control and vehicle collisions are terrible.police will spawn on top of your character or out of nowhere. losing your "wanted" level is a very underwhelming and easy. just run around a corner and your 4 stars will go awaymost doors on buildings you can interact with but cannot open. as it is on launch, this is an underdeveloped mix of GTA and Far Cry. currently this is just an open world with nothing compelling in it.

author: Bust On Entry
review: Game is beautiful and interesting, very unique however a little overwhelming at first, there is a lot happening at once on the screen. I'm looking forward to exploring it. But that being said, it runs about as well as a fat chick and that's with a Ryzen 7 5800x and an RTX 3080.. Hopefully they release a performance patch soon.

author: Gorre
review: Proclaimed by many to be the most hyped up title in all of gaming history - does it really deliver? It certainly does however that depends on your expectations. In my opinion it is the most promising open world RPG up to date bringing a lot of attention to detail for the world and its design which I have not experienced in previous triple A titles of this scale. Your eyes will be delighted upon your first visual contact with Night City; neon lights lining every street block making you relive classics such as Akira and Ghost in the Shell at least that's how my first impression was. It truly looks next gen if you have a powerful enough rig to max it out as ray tracing here is more than a gimmick, first implementation to impress me and many others. The art direction isn't fully photorealistic but that's for the better as it would never fit Cyberpunk's world, instead the mesh of colors establish the futuristic immersion. Intro is determined by your chosen life path with diverse characters for each choice adding a lot of different dialogue options throughout your journey in Night City enhancing the RPG experience. First contact with Keanu Reeves aka Johnny Silverhand seemingly the story's main attraction will be when finally your character's shackles are severed and you can reign free & forge your ultimate legend reputation in the merc world instigating fear towards biggest corpos. Love him or hate him, the charisma he brings is what causes the character to feel relatable and realistic from the beginning up until the end. As per usual CDPR delivers colossal amount of top notch side quests with varying degree of difficulty, ways of approaching & morale impairing compromises that are never easy to conclude. Monotony is wholly absent when you let yourself be absorbed and  along the waves of rich entertainment present as unwrapped packages.My first thoughts when seeing the skill trees were how much of a Deus Ex Human Revolution experience I can transcend - indeed you can very much mimic its authenticity through stealth and violent fighting alike. Combat as of now I would categorize it most polished, it feels very solid whether you're going classic guns blazing or a more closer approach razor neck massage to anyone standing in your way. By the time you advance end goal you are going to be fully kitted with your choice of build, enjoying the impressive and dynamic arsenal of an elite cybernetic soldier. I personally went on do or die mantis blade route hack 'n' slash away every single thing that moved within my  which at times felt troublesome to execute on hardest difficulty but the gratification was very much so worth it. Replay value exists strongly thanks to all the crazy customization of wealthy skill tree so don't hesitate to experiment on your first playthrough you will find your niche regardless. V's lack of customization diversity is probably my biggest dislike since I love to glamour my RPG characters most uniquely, standing out from the NPC crowd and whatnot. Music from the radio while driving can definitely be memey although they're all selective and varied to please everyone's tastes; OST & sound design don't need be mentioned they've spared no change on its quality, precisely atmospheric fitting all locations and situations. All characters in main storyline are depicted with exclusive traits, diverging backstories and emotionally linked to ideals shaped by their traumatic struggles since childhood, conflicts within your perspective of Night City shall clash continuously like a raging hellfire. And by far I enjoyed female V's voice acting the most through all the interactions she gives off incredibly deep & raw emotional attachment to the people she enjoys company of and not only, romance option you've made shines like sun rays because of how much you feel immersed into it. Overall it does have its negatives but they're contained by the positives so don't lose focus and enjoy the exceptional attention to detail brought by devs in this universe, which in my opinion isn't anymore present than few titles I could count on fingers in recent past. It could have been so much more, I'm sure in due time it'll achieve its initial promised prestige up to a 9.5 or even 10 score, however for now it can't pass beyond an 8 out of 10.[]- graphics & retro futuristic art style- solid gameplay & build paths- sound design & OST- top notch voice acting- very high replay value[]- performance & bugs- missing & broken features

author: Knuffybaer[GER]
review: Cyberpunk 2077 is a first-person action role-playing game that was developed by the creators of CD Projekt RED (The Witcher).For all those who haven't noticed: The days of Geralt, sorceresses and enchanting fantasy worlds are over for the time being at CD Projekt. For the first time in the company's history, the developers dared to play a game that was not set in the Witcher universe. Instead, Cyberpunk 2077 goes in a completely different direction. A futuristic setting that emerged as a sub-genre of science fiction in the 80s. For example, many people are familiar with the film Blade Runner. During this time, the pen & paper role-playing game "Cyberpunk" was created, which, especially in its version entitled Cyberpunk 2020, served as a template for the game.So you can say that cyberpunk is a dystopian vision of the future of humanity, in which huge corporations rule the world, the transplantation of technical components into the human body is the order of the day and the gap between rich and poor has reached enormous proportions. In this brutal world, you slip into the role of V, a mercenary who tries to make a name for himself in the metropolis of Night City. It is up to you who exactly V is. Before creating your character, you choose one of three life paths. These determine the background story and origin of your character. For each path there is an individual introduction to the game, similar to the Origin stories in Dragon Age: Origins, which with around 30 minutes of play time are by no means as extensive. The origin plays a role again and again in the rest of the game, affects dialogues and V's behavior.The introduction to the world of Cyberpunk 2077 is quickly told and I try to keep it short: First of all, repaired the car, lubricated a border post, eliminated strange pursuers - and somehow I'm involved in something in Night City that I don't quite understand yet. Even my own character, a nomad in search of happiness, is still a little strange to me. The biography is so far vague, the game world exotic, but I'm already smuggling very dangerous things for shady guys. So after four hours I feel like I'm in a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ up neon fair with bizarre characters. I haven't really arrived yet, everything is just building up. The background story? Somebody probably made a biochip that promises eternal life…So you suspect that very powerful people will show a lot of interest. But in my role as a mercenary, I'm first of all a greenhorn who moves into his place. The fascinating potential already flashed, even in small scenes: If you e.g. Open the blinds in his apartment and look at this colorful hustle and bustle of Night City. When you then go downstairs and disappear into the crowd between all the individually designed women, men and children. Or when you gossip with your buddy over noodle snack, rotate the camera freely in ego view and soak up this coolly designed city with its neon advertising and freaks strutting by.But the best moments are provided by the dialogues with the important characters: Apart from the fact that they are well animated, so that a lively, almost intimate atmosphere is created, there is situational tension at the highest level: You are currently talking about an aggressive customer the payment, while you look around freely and see danger lurking everywhere. In the background you can see a figure who is more and more interested in the conversation. At first it comes slowly, then quickly, and suddenly the situation escalates...With your answers you influence the following dispute, sometimes with the clock ticking. You can either kill yourself, convince your counterpart, depending on the talents you have developed (grayed out, you can see unavailable options due to values ​​that are too low) or master a direct kill. If the big guy named Royce survives, however, there will be a boss fight later. This openness and these dialogue scenes, which are also available on a smaller scale, will be the salt in the roleplay soup in addition to the intrigues and factions in the background. And right here, in the staging of the conversations, CD Projekt RED shows clear progress over The Witcher 3.+ Greetings from John Wick and Blade Runner+ Keanu Reeves+ gripping / dark story+ good scope+ beautiful night city+ terrific art design+ matching soundtrack+ fantastic dialogue system+ Decisions that have an impact+ many weapons and upgrade options+ Achievements and Trading Cards- many bugs still floating aroundCyberpunk 2077 is a delightful mix of Grand Theft Auto, Deus Ex and a breeze of vampires: the masquerade has become. In summary: A role-playing game that you will never forget and who knows the Witcher series already knows what I mean. Clear buy recommendation. Cyberpunk 2077 ist ein First-Person-Action-Rollenspiel, welches von den Machern um CD Projekt RED (The Witcher) entwickelt wurde. Man kann also sagen, Cyberpunk ist eine dystopische Vision der Zukunft der Menschheit, in der gewaltige Konzerne die Welt beherrschen, die Verpflanzung von technischen Bauteilen in den menschlichen Körper an der Tagesordnung ist und die Kluft zwischen Arm und Reich enorme Ausmaße angenommen hat. In dieser brutalen Welt schlüpft ihr in die Rolle von V, einem Söldner, der versucht sich in der Metropole von Night City einen Namen zu machen. Wer genau V ist, liegt dabei in eurer Hand. Noch vor der Charaktererstellung wählt ihr einen von drei Lebenspfaden aus. Diese bestimmen die Hintergrundgeschichte und Herkunft eures Charakters. Für jeden Pfad gibt es einen individuellen Spieleinstieg, ähnlich der Origin-Stories in Dragon Age: Origins, die mit rund 30 Minuten Spielzeit aber längst nicht so umfangreich ausfallen. Dafür spielt die Herkunft auch im restlichen Spiel immer wieder eine Rolle, wirkt sich auf Dialoge und das Verhalten von V aus. Der Einstieg in die Welt von  Cyberpunk 2077 schnell erzählt und ich versuche mich kurz zuhalten: Erstmal die Karre repariert, einen Grenzposten geschmiert, seltsame Verfolger eliminert - und irgendwie bin ich in Night City in etwas verwickelt, das ich noch nicht so ganz verstehe. Auch mein eigener Charakter, ein Nomade auf der Suche nach dem Glück, ist mir noch ein wenig fremd. Man ahnt also, dass sehr mächtige Leute sehr viel Interesse zeigen werden. Aber in meiner Rolle als Söldner bin ich erstmal ein Greenhorn, das in seine Bude einzieht. Das faszinierende Potenzial blitzte schon auf, auch in kleinen Szenen: Wenn man z.B. in seinem Apartment die Jalousien öffnet und auf dieses bunte Gewusel von Night City schaut. Aber die besten Momente liefern die Dialoge mit den wichtigen Charakteren: Mal abgesehen davon, dass sie klasse animiert sind, so dass eine lebendige, fast schon intime Atmosphäre entsteht, gibt es hier situative Spannung auf höchstem Niveau: Gerade spricht man mit einem aggressiven Kunden über die Bezahlung, während man sich frei umschaut, überall Gefahr in Blicken lauern sieht. Im Hintergrund erkennt man eine Gestalt, die sich immer mehr für das Gespräch interessiert. Erst kommt sie langsam, dann schnell näher und plötzlich eskaliert die Situation... + John Wick und Blade Runner lässt grüßen+ Keanu Reeves + fesselnder/düstere Geschichte+ guter Umfang+ wunderschönes Night City+ grandiosen Artdesign+ passender Soundtrack+ fantastisches Dialogsystem+ Entscheidungen die Auswirkungen haben+ viele Waffen und Upgrade Optionen+ Errungenschaften und Sammelkarten- viele Bugs noch im UmlaufCyberpunk 2077 ist ein reizvoller Mix  Grand Theft Auto, Deus Ex und eine Brise von Vampire: Die Maskerade geworden. Ich sag nur, dass Spiel hat Hitpotenzial und wer die Witcher Reihe kennt, der weiß schon was ich meine.
