author: Classicsniper00
review: As disappointing as the poor performance and bugs are, my biggest issue with the game is it's lack of depth. A mile wide but an inch deep. The world feels empty, the NPC's feel lifeless, and you can't even interact with anything. You can't change the look of your character after the customization at all, which defeats the purpose of customization in the first place. Any cyberware you get does not alter your appearance in any way. Where is the Cyberpunk that was promised in 2018? What happened to being able to go on every floor of certain buildings? What happened to calling it an RPG and now suddenly changing it to an Action-Adventure?AND WTF WAS THE POINT OF GENITALIA CUSTOMIZATION IF IT SERVES ZERO PURPOSE IN THE GAME??????This game is such a dumpster fire...

author: Syntra
review: After 100% completing the game, getting all the achievements and finishing all the endings; I can comfortably say I've enjoyed the hell out of Cyberpunk 2077 at this point. While it may have had a rough start for some, I feel I had a relatively smooth entry to the game, small glitches here and there however nothing to the point of "game breaking" or frustration inducing that I feel they ruined it for me at all. At Ultra settings the game is beautiful, the city feels alive with all the people, cars and noise and I enjoyed quite often just running/walking down the streets of Night City checking out every nook and cranny to see what amusing things I could find. The story in my opinion was fantastic and I give a lot of kudos to the voice acting in the game because it was really great (Male/Female V's voice acting was my fave). After all that I can't wait until the game is patched to the point that everyone can enjoy it to the highest degree, can't wait to see what the future holds for Cyberpunk 2077 and it's DLC :)

author: Awkwurdd
review: It's a fine shooter with a pretty cool storyline .Just don't go in looking for a rpg because even fallout 4 is more in depth in that way.The lifepaths don't really do anything apart from giving you a different intro into the game and having some different dialogue options.Its mostly illusion of choice and while some do affect your ending it is very limited.Not the best game but certainly not the worst

author: Corpse
review: 160 hrs in. I think I can write this now:SHORT: The game is not without faults, but it is an amazing achievementLONG: The world and lore that they created is amazing. Yes it is a little rough around the edges, and yes there are some bugs that will cause some aggravation, but overall my experience has been fantastic. 160 hrs in three weeks means that they did something right.The true areas of genius are the open world, the side quests, and the graphics. There are so many different ways to approach the different challenges that there is some decent replay value. The challenges are the bugs, the lack of some open world staples from GTAV and others, and the disastrous previous-gen console release. The bugs I can understand. It happens with a game this ambitious and they are quickly patching the worst. The lack of some expected features I can live with because of the large expansions and patches they have already announced for the coming months. It is obvious they are devoted to fixing and expanding the game. The real failure was in the console release. Someone high up decided for the cash grab and released the game on the previous gen consoles, and that should have NEVER happened. The game looks and plays awful. There is no excuse for that. I understand why they did it, and I understand that it had already been delayed several times and their hand was forced a bit.....but it just should not have happened. Absent that, I believe 70% of the bad press would have evaporated. But here we are. All that aside, the game is a blast. It needs some balancing and rework of some of the perks. It needs some polish to the NPC spawn-in. It needs more depth to the characters and world. It needs the sync between the voice files and animations improved. It needs more content and lots more customization options for clothing, housing, and vehicles. And yet I put 160 hours into the game in three weeks. I recommend it. Play the game. Immerse yourself in the world. Do the side quests. Develop your character fully. Enjoy Night City and all that it has to offer. And above all wait and hope as CDPR continues to improve and develop the game.

author: Enzevil
review: Important note: The game has a lot of glitches and performance issues. It is currently not optimized very well, but playing on a very high end PC makes it playable. This review is based on playing the game on a high-end PC, if don't have one I wouldn't recommend playing the game until it is patched up a lot.Without those issues, the game is very, very good in my opinion. I loved the main story, the bigger side quests and the important NPCs. Those feel very much alive and are one of the best I've seen in any game yet. The perk progression system is also quite good and fun, but not very in depth with very much game changing perks. The "gigs" are also just kinda there, they're not boring if you customized a fun playstyle, but they aren't really shining in particular either. It's mostly about the first three points I mentioned: main story, side quests and NPCs. Here's where the game really take it's shine, and you see the love and detail CD Projekt Red also put in Witcher 3. I find it really amazing and that what makes this game really a must play for big RPG fans. Driving works okay, gunplay is okay, hacking is okay, but nothing groundbreaking. What I would love to see is more customization. For example: customize your houses and vehicles, more in depth perks, a transmog system, deeper romance system. Also, the game isn't short, but I would've loved to see more in depth side quests, because they were that good. This game could really benefit for expansions on scale of Witcher 3. I also hope that they also include these feedback points in them. So all in all, if they improve this game more (definitely for consoles), I really recommend it if you love RPGs. The game does really great things in some aspects, and some that are just okay. If they also include the performance issues and the feedback points in the future, it becomes a must have. Definitely a fun game and can't wait what they will do with it in the future. For now, if you currently don't have a very high end PC build, I recommend waiting a bit until most performance issues and bugs are fixed.

author: DRΞAMΞR
review: Have only played about 20 hours now, but wanted to leave a review based on my thoughts so far: It's an amazing immersive game- After the introduction missions, I got totally hooked in the story. I really really like Johhny (the character played by Keanu Reeves). These dialogues between Johhny and the player are just awesome. Also I found . author: Dr. Balls, M.D.
review: So I wasn't hyped for this game at all until the day before release when I pre-ordered it, but I must say it has quickly become one of my favourite games in my library.   First of all, it looks absolutely fantastic, and I don't even play with ray tracing on with my 2060! Sure, my friends who play on there 30 series cards get a much better visual experience than I do, but I have genuinely never seen such a beautiful game before. The indoor and outdoor lighting is absolutely fantastic and it adds so much to the overall quality and immersion of the game.   The map itself, while not being the biggest, is certainly one of my favourite when you contrast the packed high-rise city centre to the sparse badlands. I can see why people are disappointed with their hopes of a vertical city which there admittedly isn't too much of and, even when it is accessible, it isn't made very obvious.   The story line has got to be one of the most engaging I have played through and it took me around 55 hours while focusing on side quest story lines too. The endings depend heavily on your completion of many side quests and can vary pretty heavily based on this. The game manages to create characters that you become somewhat emotionally attached with, especially Panam and River in my play through. It's so well written that everyone is exactly how they should be. Rouge is the character that doesn't seem to care too much, Panam isn't quite sure what to do with herself and River is the honest cop who's willing to take a risk to do right by his family.   But you can't talk about Cyberpunk without mentioning the bugs. Sure, I've came across a few visual and lighting glitches and T-posing characters, with a few friends falling through the map, but nothing really game breaking. Sure this will vary for everyone playing the game, but I just can't justify all the hate this game gets, unless of course you're a PS 4/Xbox One player.   Overall, I'd easily say this is now my favourite game and I can't see that changing for some time. Hopefully we'll get some more optimisation and bug fixes in the near future, but I'm loving it even without them. If I were to rate this from 1-10 I'd happily give it an 8.

author: Exaelus
review: Where to begin, I've been waiting for this game since 2013 when they first showed the teaser trailer for this game. Expectations were high, but this game is quite a disappointment and not because of the hype, but because of all the lies and deceit by CDPR over the years, not to mention the content that was removed or never existed and yet they advertised it through their gameplay demos. I played through the entirety of this game, maybe missed a few secrets, but that really doesn't change much. It's super obvious there was so much content cut and not because gamers complained that Witcher 3 was too long, but because they were trying to hit their deadline, so they cobbled something together as fast as possible and here we are.Before I even get into the issues that this game has I have to say that the game is not as good as CDPR's previous game The Witcher 3, which was way more immersive, tells a better story, has far better endings, has actual choices throughout the game that matter and was way more consistent as an experience overall. On the other hand Cyberpunk 2077 has a lot of design flaws, it's extremely unstable and buggy at the moment and the whole experience is flawed, but the city does look great, gameplay is fun, story and characters are well done. Keanu Reeves was used well and did a decent enough job.I am aware that even W3 had bugs at launch but the problems with this game go far beyond just bugs, it's the design decisions they've made, they're questionable, so many aspects of this game don't function properly or are just leftovers of the content they cut. It gives me the feeling like there was a reset during development and this was put together in the last two to four years. It feels like Anthem did back when it was released, even though this game is far superior to Anthem and a lot of love was put into it, it's extremely sad that this is what CDPR released to the public. I also hope they cancel the multiplayer version and redeem themselves and focus on expanding the game so it can become a more complete experience as it was promised/advertised, I do doubt that will happen though.Now let's talk about what kind of game did we actually get. We got a game that has a huge identity crisis, it doesn't know if it wants to be an open world game such as "Grand Theft Auto" or more like a role-playing game such as "Deus Ex: HR" and it doesn't do either as good as the games mentioned. Let me give you an example, they crafted this huge beautiful city and the only thing you can do in this city is NCPD copy and paste missions, where you basically just go and kill a few enemies, loot a box and leave. There are gigs where you have to save someone or upload a virus on a server, but that's not a lot of variety and that's what you will be doing over and over. If you were expecting shops like in Grand Theft Auto where you can preview clothes before you buy them or car dealerships you will be very disappointed, not to mention ripperdocs which install cybernetic implants into your body have only one animation when you first meet them, then you just buy the implants through a very lackluster shop UI. Cars are bought by receiving a quest over your phone, you walk up to a car and press a button to buy it, which is just strange. Not even a person standing there to sell you the car and to talk to you a bit about it, it's just sitting on the parking lot and you press a button on it.I also have to mention that they also removed the 3rd person camera angles when you talk to people, their reasoning was because of immersion, well let me tell you, this basically invalidates any cosmetic gear you are wearing, you will never see your gear except in the inventory, mirror or motorcycle, and it wasn't cut for immersion but to save time for sure. This is yet another flawed system, this game was advertised to be all about style yet every single piece of clothing has stats tied to it. So on a higher difficulty you want to get the gear with the best stats, so you will equip the most powerful gear but look like a clown. On the topic of immersion, when you think of W3, you go to a quest board, you pick up the quests, find the farmer/person that posted that quest, you talk to them, and then you solve their problem. In Cyberpunk 2077 the immersion is quite weak, you are spammed by people on your phone every time you make a turn, everyone just magically knows where you are, and most of them all immediately know when you are finished with the quest to call you again, so you don't have to go and talk to anyone face to face, a few quests actually require you to go talk to the people that hired you, these are usually the side quests, which in a lot of cases surpass the main story in quality. In my opinion, meeting face to face is the smart thing to do, considering how information control is a problem and how everything digital is unsafe in the cyberpunk universe.The advertisements were also about how Cyberpunk 2077 is a mature game, but you won't see much of anything when it comes to nudity, this whole aspect was a marketing scheme, you can select your genitalia, but it plays no role in the game at all. When you compare it to the entire game it's really out of place, it's also very jarring when you open your inventory and your character's junk renders first and then the clothes pop in afterwards. I've also had random characters show up, fully clothed on a stage dancing like strippers which was hilarious.I have been able to hunt down all achievements and see all endings and I have to say the ending variety is also quite poor, there are seven endings that you choose from and when it comes to choices, this is probably the most impactful choice in the game, almost every other choice is an illusion of choice. What I will never forgive is how CDPR lied about origin stories, how you can pick one of three origins for your character. Remember the trailer when you see your character dancing with your friend Jackie in a club or how you go buy guns with your buddy, yeah guess what, that is a video montage that also plays in the game. Yes you read this correctly, you watch a montage of fun stuff you do with Jackie within the game as a trailer, the origin stories take about ten to fifteen minutes before they play this trailer within the game. You are watching what you were expecting you were going to play, that was super discouraging and depressing.As the last part of this review let's talk a bit about AI, difficulty and economy. The AI in this game is completely broken. If you attack civilians police just spawns on top of you, they also cannot drive cars at all, so you walk down the street and you are fine, the car chases are all scripted and they happen two or three times in the entire game, yet another thing that was cut. The difficulty curve doesn't exist, you will have a super hard time early game, the moment you get a few upgrades you become a god. The economy is also broken, easy to duplicate money which makes the game way too easy.                 Did I have fun playing this game? Yeah I did.Was my experience hindered by the terrible bugs, AI and design decisions? Yes it was.I lost a lot of respect for CDPR but I still recommend the game, as long as you have a strong PC, don't mind the bugs and you want to experience a cool story, gameplay, world. Just don't expect optional mini games, side activities and/or in-depth mechanics and you will have some fun.

author: Neto

author: Mythicalus
review: At its core, Cyberpunk is a great open world action RPG with a meticulously crafted environment, and gameplay which feels fairly tight and good to immerse yourself in. There are multiple references and easter eggs, and most side-quests are unique, though not as well written as the ones in other titles like Witcher 3 or RDR2. Although fairly short, the main quest line is really well written. In terms of graphical fidelity, the game looks really good especially with everything on ultra including ray tracing, and DLSS (if you have an RTX card) is a plus.The game at launch however, is plagued by a multitude of issues which could've been resolved had it been delayed for another year or so. It's really hard to get yourself immersed in its world when bug after bug comes looking for you, instead of you having to intentionally look for them, many of which could've been fixed had CDPR simply even play tested the game. Exploding debris, poor NPC & police AI, duplicate NPCs with repetitive one-liners, T-poses, broken status effects, texture glitches, poor vehicle destruction, non-existent vehicle AI, floating objects, quests breaking, you name it.There's also a lot of performance issues with the game at launch as well as cut features such as character customisation which was heavily marketed prior to launch. (You can't even get a haircut in the game and your choice of hairstyle is permanent after character creation, lol)Don't get me wrong, the game's good, and I'm sure it would be fixed down the line, similar to how Witcher 3 was at launch. Currently though, the game's an 'eh' from me, and I'd skip purchasing it until a year or so later. Will update my review then.

author: Qrow The Drunk
review: It's addictive.

author: kris.KROSS
review: The game has it's share of bugs but the content, story and gameplay have more than made up for it so far.

author: pmemer
review: First off, look at how most of the positive reviews are dumb memes and unfunny ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥. Keep that in mind when looking at the ratio.Anyways, the biggest problem with the game are the bugs and the performance. This is probably one of the most demanding games ever made. If you don't have a card capable of DLSS (20/30 series) you wont be able to play at a decent framerate at anything above 1080p. Even with DLSS and everything on medium/low the game absolutely tanks the moment a handful of NPCs appear on the screen. The game doesn't even look that good, it's just horrendously optimized.Second, the bugs. Nothing too game breaking, but it adds up. The audio issues are the worst. I've had music and NPC dialogue just refuse to play. This game needed another 1-3 months worth of work, but obviously they couldn't delay it again so here we are. idk how they managed to release the game in this state after all those delays but hopefully they iron it out within the next few months.

author: Kevduit
review: it was me. I was the punk all along.

author: Nancy Wheeler
review: 11/10 just for Panam :)

author: Noruki
review: This game is phenomenal. The shooting, the soundtrack, the story... Everything is perfect.Sometimes it felt like I was watching a movie. This being one of those movies that, after it ends, leaves our minds screwed.I think I had the best possible ending. I wanted the story to continue, and yet at the same time, after so much emotion I think the game should not have a sequel. This game for me in terms of story, should just stay as it is. Finished.And about the bugs? Well just a few minor and funny ones.Congrats CDPRJ! This is one hell of a mighty game!

author: Kirkey
review: My perspective as a person who has ample experiences in The Witcher 3; Deus Ex MD; Watchdogs 1, 2 and Legion (relevant genres) for multiple playthroughs:: Yes, raytracing is beautiful, it's the future of volumetric rendering techniques. But that's one pathetic excuse to cut corners on some of the fundamentals aspects of what constitutes "A Next Gen Graphics". Take textures for a good example. They look like absolute blurry S*** in 4K except for character models cuz they are in between high poly to low poly. Since most of the time u cant even see urself, so texture quality actually matters a lot. If ur on 1080p, this probably wouldn't matter to you at all but hey, they promised.:A very interesting matter to discuss since I would classify it as both immersive and skeletal. As u might have noticed while doing the quest "Automatic Love", the extensive conversations available between V and the Doll really bring it to an unprecedented level. As words cannot begin to describe the insights of desperation, hope, love and fear which coexists on ur abruptly introduced protagonist. It's awesome, it's bloody brilliant, It's tens of thousands times better than TLOS 2.  HOWEVER, with a mere 26+6 main quests, introduces many noticeable and very disturbing inconsistencies and a extremely restrictive field of options and playability. Lets be honest here those 6 endings are more or less the same and they feel rushed, not exploring the plot completely, it's already lacking plot. (they dont explore or expand on the plot in anyway tbh). That's....a shame.In conclusion, I personally wouldnt call this game mediocre. But it surely didn't live up to CDPR's promises either. Its a fine game with a "cardiac-arrest-inducing-ly" thick layer of candy coating.

author: Nexxa

author: Ayuu
review: Huh? I have some hard feelings for this game for someone who waited like 2 years for this game, can't imagine the ones who waited 8 years. Soo, what should I start with? Right... I'm just disappointed... This game was in development for 7 years. The game got a release date on 16th of April, then got delayed almost 1 year just for us to pay 60$ for the pre-order and then be the beta testers for this buggy mess of a game. I can tell you how many times I fallen through the map with or without a car, how many missions (side quests) I couldn't finished because I wasn't able to interact with what was I supposed to get or do, how many visuals bugs and a few other things more. And on top of that, the game isn't really that optimised either, I can barely play it on low (1440p) with a RX 590, which I usually play almost all games on ultra. And this is on PC, the last gen console guys have it even worse, also playing at 25 fps or below with spikes and crashes on graphics lower then low.  Putting the technical issues aside, this game feels pretty dead really. Yes there are lots of NPC's walking around but that's it, just a pile of NPC's, the AI is ♥♥♥♥. You shoot a bullet and everyone gets to the ground or starts running and begging for their life's, seems like a normal reaction, right? Not really, here we talk about Night City, where almost everyone carries a gun with 'em, so you would've expected more reactions. I'm not even gonna talk about the traffic since is kinda the same thing. And ahh... The police... Besides the police just spawning on you no matter where you are, but to escape them it's even more pathetic, you just gotta drive in a straight line for 100m and "Ohh, he got kinda far, guess he's not a criminal anymore". Another thing that kinda pisses me off about this game is the lack of features. Not that there aren't many enough, just that we got led to expect more form "The future game", ya' know? Not even be able to change your haircut? Add some tattoos? Upgradeability to the car? Customise the apartment or get a better one? And others features too. I don't even know how they didn't thought of some this, since most of this features are in The Witcher 3, one of the best if not the best RPG game ever made, and it was made by ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ YOU! Is just disappointing... Now don't get me wrong, the game is pretty much a let down for quite a lot of people including me, but that doesn't mean it is a bad game, in contrary, this game it's pretty ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ good if you ignore the bugs. Like, the story is amazing, hands down. It's an absolute blast to drive through NC, mostly if you have the horse power to run this puppy on ultra, I barely even used the fast travels points because of it, plus that if you used them you can lose some phone calls as well. The combat is pretty divers, and I actually found it pretty fun. The skill tree is also pretty well made. And there is a lot of attention put into the details of NC and the scenery, too bad the same attention to the details wasn't put on the other stuff... And there are some other cool features also, but that's it.The game isn't bad, just the marketing over-hyped. For some people this is enough and they enjoy this game a lot, and I can't blame or tell anyone not to enjoy the game, cas I enjoy this game too, is just that I had high hopes as a lot of us had but just got disappointed in the end. But hey, let's just hope this is a No Man's Sky situation and it will get better.

author: GeersArt
review: It has it's bugs and issues which I'm sure will be patched out someday but as is, I'd recommend this game for anyone that's a fan of in depth, story driven RPG's, Sci-fi fans and fans of open world exploration.

author: Moosie
review: Something I love about RPGs is that it's a way to step away from my day-to-day and enter into this amazing fictional world where I can live a life I've only dreamt of - A life with a big penis.

author: hurleybird
review: While the trappings are wonderful, there isn't a good game underneath. The problem is that the main quest is mediocre (not to mention abruptly short), and so are the open world aspects. The open world activities are entirely cookie-cutter, and sidequests are generally short, disparate affairs that lend little to the tapestry of the game.On a big sale, I might recommend this just purely for the technical aspects. It's a shame that the game itself is so mediocre and soulless.

author: Darkgate
review: After having played for 56 hours - I think it was time to say ye or nay.For me its a ye!Does it have flaws and bugs'a'plenty - yesAre those fixable - yesDo I enjoy the games story and sidemissions - A lot!Does somethings annoy me in a game - yes - like in a lot of other games there is always something you would have liked was different to your liking.But all in all - I am not even close to get the the end of the game and I am truly enjoying it and will have hundreds of hours in it for sure.

review: Soo this is my second review and playing game 2 time for now i'm going to finish the story at least 5 times and this is what i thought about the game:The game have a lots of bug right now i hope they fix it (after waiting about 8 years) but it's worth your time to play it and have fun in Night city.Your choices does not effect your story too much that we were expecting from CDPR and there is no NEW GAME + after finishing the game.I hope they fix the bugs first and add the new game+ (not after years like witcher 3) and give us some good DLC because they didn't give us what we were expecting because the story is not that interesting.

author: ozzma
review: ProsImpressive Art Style (when it loads in properly)Decent musical diversityGood Voice Acting (do not pick the male main voice)Solid Story (that falls apart toward the end)Fun Combat* ConsBUGSGlitchesAnomaliesAnd Strait Up MalfunctionsSome Quests are BrokenLeveling some skills requires heavy grindingThe economy is nonsensicalThe Mini Map is borderline UselessSome of the Stat Requirements are ridiculous* Some mechanics feel unfinished like begin able to put points in LMG use, but the game’s Machine Guns lack power and variety.  The AI is all over the place, some really great like the boxing matches, but most foes are potatoes.This is the shell of a masterpiece and you can have a grand ol time with it.  But I cannot recommend it in its current state.  Said state is unfinished.  Buy when it’s done, check back in maybe a year or three.

author: › Ali Salar™
review: ~ DIFFICULTY ~🔲 My 90-year-old grandma could play it🔲 Easy☑️ Normal🔲 Hard🔲 Dark Souls~ GRAPHICS ~🔲 MS Paint🔲 Bad🔲 Meh🔲 Graphics don't matter in this game🔲 Good🔲 Beautiful☑️ Almost you missed the difference between the game and real life!~ MUSIC ~🔲 Bad🔲 Not special🔲 Good☑️ Eargasm, CDPR always use the right person on making ST~ STORY ~🔲 This game has no story🔲 Like playing Temple Runners for the story🔲 It's there for the people who want it☑️ Well written, had new things that other stories didn't have🔲 Epic story~ PRICE ~🔲 Free🔲 Underpriced🔲 Perfect Price☑️ Could be cheaper🔲 Overpriced🔲 Complete waste of money~ REQUIREMENTS ~🔲 You can run it on a microwave🔲 Average☑️ High end🔲 NASA computer~ LENGTH ~🔲 Very Short (0 - 3 hours)🔲 Short (3 - 15 hours)🔲 Average (15-50 hours)☑️ Long (50-90 hours)🔲 Extremely long (90-110 hours)🔲 No ending~ FUN ~🔲 I'd rather watch paint dry🔲 Hard to enjoy🔲 Repetitive☑️ Actually pretty amusing, after a few patches🔲 Ride of your life~ REPLAYABILITY~🔲 It's a one-time experience🔲 Only for achievements🔲 If you wait a few months/years🔲 Definitely☑️ Infinitely replayable~ WORTH BUYING ~🔲 No☑️ Wait for sale🔲 Yes----------------Well, here we are reviewing Cyberpunk 2077, the game that many have expected game and many unfortunately passed before game releases. the game used the old engine so I'm gonna be honest with all those badass trailers were CGI and the game has really nothing to compare with leaked gameplay and trailers. I am aware there are some limitations but it's all because they used the old engine on this game, the same engine they made Witcher 3 with, so it's CDPR's fault that made fans have very high expectations! I'm not saying this game is bad I actually enjoyed playing it but everyone is angry for the missed content that we were supposed to have. One of the positive things in this game was the soundtrack, Marcin Przybylowicz the same artist who did The Witcher 3 soundtrack worked on this game and it was literally AWESOME! it gives you some good moment like DOOMs soundtracks that made you happy, the second thing is the characters, they all have a good background and they are all interesting, you kinda feel them but on the other hand some character who had the potential was cut out of the game for the lack of time in developing but the remaining ones were good,

author: NickGrande
review: TL;DR: A great game- buried under a mountain of bugs and unfinished content. I'd wait for more patches before purchasing.I will update this review as more patches go live.

author: ☯ dreamer ☮
review: The short and wide version:The game has bugs and during my first 200 hours, I was disappointed a few times. And I also had a lot of positive moments, fun and good feelings, because so many things are done right!The long and narrow version:+Amazing graphics+Beautiful screenshots (epic photo mode)+Character customization+Unique quest contents+Music and songs+Freedom to jump over almost anything+Funny references+Wide variety of nice weapons and cars+Shooting enemies through walls+Very reliable navigation system, mostly+Takes more playthroughs to explore everything+Cats+A lot of missions can be completed without killing anyone+A lot of useful settings+Auto-save sometimes saves the game where you can't+A lot of useful info already made it to the internet+Limitless potential+FREE DLC in the future-Things and NPCs sometimes just disappear-Auto-save is sometimes inactive if you are roaming Night City, don't forget to save-When I call my car, sometimes it gets destroyed by going through walls and obstacles-There is no way to watch banned or explicit BD recordings-Some parts of the game just feel empty or repetitive-Some locations could really use more containers for the amount of possible dead bodies-Impossible to fast-forward during the initial quest scenes, eventhough I played them many times already-Don't forget to save, because it may save you from playing the game all over again-I died or lost too much HP a few times by dropping from few centimetres of height-You can save one car by sitting in it while saving the game

author: Szpero
review: Never been waiting for this game.Never watched any trailer.Bought just for fun to see what the people were waiting for when having Christmas holiday.I know there is many things to be done to make it balanced and playable for everyone but personaly, it is the best game I have ever played packed of characters we can identify with and great but short story and no upset boy with wooden pc gonna change my mind.

author: Ethel Chamomile
review: Gameplay - OKStandard shooter RPG, pretty solid.Story - OKIntriguing, makes you attached to characters enough.RP - So soChances for fun RP comes up a lot, but most of them don't carry much weight, shallow consequences, but just for fun, like being a jerk to some NPCs, it's good enough.World - Could be betterMobs are liveless and most of the city is uninteractable but some spots have this nice sensation into it that somehow can be related to my sensations in real life when visiting similar places.
